title: Get the descriptions on Booking sorted out
text:
This time I came back to New York to show my daughter this big and wonderful city!
I chose this hotel based on the description on Booking(.com). 
It promised me a hotel in a good location in a quiet area. 
A room of 33 square meter with two single beds and a sitting area. 
I was hoping for a nice view. For our 7 nights stay I knew we would spend some time in the room.

We got an approximate 20 square meter room with a sitting area consisting of an armchair 
sandwiched between a bed and the desk. The room was dark like a cave with a windows to a deep atrium.
The area was reasonly quiet but the vents in the room was running all the time - thats something to get used to.

When I did a complaint about the room by telling that I expected to get a room that (to some extent) fitted 
the description found on Booking (22 square meters isn’t 33 square meters!). 
I was told: "we have no 2 floor plans or room layouts that are just the same - configurations and square footage may vary slightly" ... 
but by 10 square meters! and they didn't know anything about a seating area.

I just didn’t get what I paid for. Then I expected to pay for what I got. But there could be no question of a decline in the price.

One of the most disappointing hotel stays I have experienced in the US.  

My recommendation for the hotel - get the descriptions on Booking sorted out.

Location is great! Close to attractions and the subway.

title: Club Quarters Hotel
text:
Great place to stay with an incredible view of the world trade center. The room was big and clean. Beds comfortable and well working televisions. The staff was friendly and professional. The hotel is also located in a great spot. Close to the next subway...

Had a great time there

title: Professional, courteous and clean
text:
The staff at reception were always very professional and courteous, requests via text message were answered promptly and carried out reliably.
The room was modern and clean, everything worked.
When it came to room service, it wasn't quite clear to us whether we always had to order it or whether it came automatically. The time when it came was also always different and therefore sometimes inconvenient for us, as we had already been back at the hotel in the afternoon because of the bad weather, but the room hadn't been cleaned yet.

title: Perfect hotel
text:
Magnificent view. Unlimited bottles of water, coffee and tea. Very well located, quiet area. Extra bedding!! Room cleaned every 3 days. Transport nearby.
The only negative point is the air conditioning which makes a lot of noise.
The staff is very nice.
Beautiful terrace and bar on the 20th floor.
We were in room 1440, exceptional view

title: Cannot wait to go back!
text: This quaint hotel is in a prime location. The immediate area is quiet, yet has everything at your fingertips, the 911 Memorial and Museum, shopping, dining, and a host of commuter options including several subway lines just steps away from the front doors. The hotel itself has several nice touches that make it a comfortable oasis at the start or end of a busy day in the city. From the free gourmet coffee and bottled water in the main floor lounge, to the fresh air of the outdoor terrace on the 20th floor, this place is a true gem!

title: staff could not have cared less
text: we arrived on 3/27 around 1700 flying from Europe. No room was. No option was given to us by staff but to wait in lobby. room was available when we arrived back at 2100. staff said reason, it was busy season.

title: Excellent hotel
text:
This one was my second time at Club Quarters WTC hotel and couldn’t be more satisfied.
I spent over a month at the hotel and I really felt like at home. 
Spacious rooms, some of them with an amazing view on World Trade Center skyscrapers, very good cleaning and housekeeping service. 
There are also a gym, laundry service, washing machines and complimentary beverage (tea, coffee, espresso, cappuccino..) you can enjoy all day. 
All the staff are amazing, nice and friendly. 
I would like to especially thank Marsha Ann at the reception, very professional and always cheerful and helpful, as well as Carlos, Dawn and Spencer for their kindness and willingness.

title: Guest from Ireland
text: Excellent Hotel.Beautiful room overlooking WTC. Spotless clean, very well laid out, and facilities easy to use. The Staff  are Amazing. From start to finish,from checkin staff, to check out .Cleaning staff, lobby staff , everyone so friendly, helpful ,polite and professional.  Marsha and Spencer in particular were Brilliant, so knowledgeable, patient and diligent. But honestly i found all the staff were so friendly,and genuinely seem to enjoy their work. Hotel is also in a great location close to eateries, sightseeing, and transport .Thankyou for a wonderful firstclass experience.

title: Very good experience. I would return.
text: Very good location of the hotel, safe area and close to the entire financial and tourism center in the southern area of Manhattan. The attention at reception from Marsha and her colleagues was excellent and very willing. It does not have breakfast but it does have a cafeteria and tea service to serve yourself before leaving or upon arrival, water with bottles in the hallways. Very good and daily cleaning. The room and bathroom were comfortable and very good beds and bedding. We stayed at the Word Trade Center hotel. The wifi is good. It has a cocktail bar on the 20th floor, no food.

title: Our new go-to!
text: This was the nicest and roomiest hotel I have stayed in in NYC. We got two twin beds (which I swear were doubles) and there was plenty of floor space on either side of each bed and between beds and restroom. Restroom was also spacious and nice to have shelves to place toiletries. Beds were so comfy, which is important after a day of walking, and the pillow were heavenly! If you need towels, TP, cleaning, etc, you just text a number and they respond quickly. Chilled water bottle stations are in each hallway that I saw, and a Nespresso machine was in the room, along with a microwave and fridge. Best of all, the staff was very kind and welcoming! This is definitely my new go-to hotel to use!

title: Drop your bags & go - great base.
text: Great location for a few days sightseeing in New York. Really comfortable beds & soft pillows. Water bottles available on each floor & tea/coffee in the lounge. This is a hotel to use as a base, very helpful staff at reception and clean basic rooms. If you want luxury look elsewhere. Plenty of places for breakfast & coffee in the area.

title: Great ! Great welcome, clean and great view
text: Brilliant hotel, a superb view and a very pleasant welcome with staff who will do what they can to make your stay pleasant. My trip was a few years ago. The rooms are very clean, at the foot of the world trade center. I will return there with pleasure.

title: Don't
text:
Where do I begin? When I checked in we had to deal with the annoying kiosk check-in. When I pay for a hotel room, I am expecting to pay for the experience of someone doing that for me. 

Anyways, we get checked in and head out. We woke the next morning to a phone call accusing my wife and me of smoking in our room. I have asthma, she is a cancer survivor, so suffice it to say we do not smoke at all. I mentioned this and they said their engineer came up and said it was us. So either he was too lazy to do his job, or he's a terrible engineer. I invite them up to have a look. He comes up and doesn't even come in. Says that he can see it's not us now. 

As I am leaving for the day, I ask if we can change our housekeeping from the Express to Full for the next day. I am told no, that they have already set it for the weekend, so we are screwed. Sounds like BS to me. Anyways, we keep noticing the smell of smoke and I keep telling them that I am not going to be blamed for this. 

Then the next day, we get in and take a nap. I awake to find hotel staff standing in our room. Despite the DND sign. The guy runs out of the room. I jumped up and ran after him thinking that he was up to no good. I corner him by the elevator and he says that he was looking for another room. Sure. After that, we start locking everything up when we leave. 

After that, the WiFi is horrible, the TV channels barely work, and trying to get your luggage out of luggage storage takes forever. 

I had decent expectations coming in and they crapped on all of them. I will be posting this everywhere. I almost feel like I should get a refund. 

Never again.

title: Good
text:
The view wasn’t that good. But the room was fine, luminous and spacious.  And Devell welcomed me really nicely giving me a better room that i should hav had!!
The body lotion and the products in the bathroom are quality ones
Thank you again for that

title: Great experience
text:
I have appreciated the staff and in particular Spencer on the reception desk. Spencer was really helpfull, professional and very customer service oriented. I have appreciated as well the comfort of the room, The bedroom was really nice and the bathroom clean. 
The hotel is situated just next to the World Trade Center, very easy to go to midtown and uptown.

title: Great location, economical and friendly
text: Perfect location for visiting the memorial of the World Trade Center but also for surrounding Manhattan. Comfortable, cosy rooms with a friendly and efficient employees (a good vibe can be felt throughout the hotel). Economical, clean and central - recommend highly.

title: great location; friendly staff
text: Great location for exploring the area around the 9/11 memorial.  Good options for eating - Indian restaurant, Mughali, for dinner and George's for breakfast. Top floor bar was nice for a view of the city at sunset.  Facility was perfect for our needs.

title: Great Stay
text:
Liked · Lovely big rooms and really comfortable beds, with a brilliant view of the World Trade Centre and 9/11 Memorial. Easy access to bars, restuarants, subways and a short walk to the ferries to both Statue of Liberty and Brocklyn. There was a coffee machine, fridge and mircowave in in the room, you just asked at reception for extra coffee pots. We also liked that they didn't clean every day but only every third day but you can request whenever needed. Its a great hotel for that price.

Disliked · Nothing really, except for the noisy ceiling fan/air conditioning - we should have mentioned it to the hotel to give them a chance to rectify but we didn't want to change rooms (1208) as we loved the view.

title: Like being at home!
text: The location is strategic due to its proximity to several metro stations and the 9/11 memorial is in front of the structure! The room including the living area and the bathroom are spacious and very comfortable, the bed and pillows are very comfortable! 24-hour self-service restaurant on the ground floor, very comfortable and well-stocked! Great experience!

title: a great experience during our trip to New York city
text:
the location of the hotel is within walking distance of the metro under the Oculus and the 9/11 memorial.

The staff is friendly and helpful.

The rooms are very clean just like the overall impression of the hotel. We had a double room with 2 single beds of 1.40cm wide which gave us an excellent night's sleep.
The rooftop bar is also worth a visit for a drink where you have a nice view of the 9/11 memorial. Drinking water machine in the hallway and coffee/tea in the lobby are free.

title: Couldn’t ask for more
text: Absolutely superb. Can’t think of one drawback. Coffee and water complementary was more appreciated than expected. Locally coffee was close to $8! And water $5! So it was nice to be able to avail of both before and after a days sightseeing. Location was excellent. Silent nights, close to subway. I was really impressed by this hotel in every possible way.

title: Great location, amenities lacking
text: Wonderful clean updated hotel. Comfortable beds, soft sheets, lots of plugs and nice TV. Room set up was great. Booked a kitchenette room, was not as described and service and support was lacking. Received dirty kitchenware and the manager did not resolve. Great location to explore NYC, and lower Manhattan. Staff unwilling to help you tour.

title: Wonderful experience
text: This was my first time staying in lower Manhattan, and I could not be happier with the experience. The hotel was clean and comfortable. They had refillable water available. I got a great night's sleep on the bed. The subway was close by and there was so much to do in the neighborhood. I fully enjoyed the entire week that we stayed. I would recommend booking the room with a kitchenette and a view. Well worth it!

title: Excellent Guest Experience
text:
Marsha Ann
Friendly staff, hotel location convenient, close to subway station and walking distance to 911 Memorial. 
Rooms are clean, front lobby very cozy for drinks and hot tea. 
Our stay was enjoyable & pleasant!
Thank you for making it happen.

title: A consistent standard
text: Club Quarters is consistent. The rooms are clean, comfortable and spacious enough. But our stay was made so much better by the flexibility and helpfulness of the staff, especially guest services manager Marsha-Ann. She went out of her way to help us

title: Awesome place
text: Perfect location, very close to a major subway station. Loads of stuff to do right in a four block area. Highly recommended! Pizza at Hank’s and Breakfast at Zara’s was our go to for meals when we needed something quick.

title: Love this place
text: Very welcoming and good value! Emely warmly helped us out at the front desk. beautiful views from room and from rooftop. Cozy, affordable room w fridge and microwave. Been coming here a long time. Also a very quiet part of town w easy subway access to Brooklyn and several train lines throughout manhattan

title: Excellent rooms! But secure your own parking!
text: Our room had a balcony! And heated bathroom floor! Excellent quiet heat! Clean and well kept room. Plenty of sleeping space for four. Bed was foam mattress, it was ok. Fold out couch was good condition slept teenagers well! Biggest hurdle was securing parking, discounted QR code provided by hotel didn’t work, we were stressed finding parking and ended up paying a high price.

title: Excellent Stay with a Minor Noise Concern
text:
I recently stayed at the Club Quarters Hotel, New York, World Trade Center, and overall, I had a fantastic experience. The location is excellent, the staff were friendly and accommodating, and the room was clean and comfortable. However, there was one minor issue that prevented me from giving it a full five-star rating.

The hotel's fitness room, while convenient and well-equipped, is located on the same level as the guest rooms. Unfortunately, this means that any noise generated from the fitness room can be heard in nearby rooms as well as on the floors above and below. During my stay, me and my fellow traveling companions were awoken both mornings at 06:00 AM by the sound of exercise equipment, which was very disruptive.

I believe that having designated quiet hours for the fitness room could help mitigate this issue. This way, guests who prefer a quieter environment can rest undisturbed, while still allowing others to enjoy the fitness facilities during appropriate times.

Despite this inconvenience, I would still highly recommend Club Quarters Hotel, New York, World Trade Center, for its overall quality and convenience.

title: Pleasantly surprised!
text: I’ve never stayed at a club quarters property before, but I was looking for a reasonable price for an impromptu overnight stay. The location is a little bit quirky, touched down behind the world, trade center site, but I have to stay that we were very pleasantly pleased. Spotless hotel, great staff, very quiet room. Would definitely stay again!

title: Top choice hotel to visit 9/11 Memorial Museum, Wall Street
text: The staff were very approachable and always greeted Hotel guests warmly. Excellent location with several good food choices. We love Morton’s steakhouse which is in-house and served fabulous steaks. We will surely book CQ is we come back to NYC one day.

title: Cheap Hotel
text:
This is a business hotel, but not for CEO's !  Good size basic room, with a tiny fridge. I felt I was in a campus room. Small bathroom, good only for solo travelers. The put me on a second floor room ...AVOID .It's almost like your room is on the street !!
The bar has a strange smell and horrible service, but a great view.
I chose the hotel for its price, and I wanted to get to know better the area.

title: WTC
text: Overall the stay was okay, the service from the staff was good and helpful. Our only really complaint was the beds, which are really really small and this is why I'm only giving it a average stay.  We didn't go to the lounge area so I can't comment on that part.

title: Perfect place to rest your head after a long day of sightseeing
text: We chose this hotel for its proximity to the ferry from NJ. We didn’t need anything fancy, as we knew this would just be a place to rest our heads. It provided for our every need. The bed was definitely the most comfortable hotel bed I’ve ever had—the pillows were actually fluffy! The staff were really kind and helpful, and the location was safe and accessible.

title: Mediocre hotel in Financial district
text:
Good location. A lot of construction all around which makes it a noisy environment. Rooms are so so. Facing a brick wall. Big upgrade to get a room with view. Room small with soft uncomfortable bed. Staff not helpful. Would not help me with parking app which was not working. Ended up driving around Manhattan to find an expensive parking lot. 
Will not stay there again.

title: Another great stay
text: From entering the hotel to leaving it all the staff we encountered couldn’t have been more pleasant………shout out to Spencer who remembered us from our visit September 2022! Hotel spotless, rooms are roomy, clean with everything you need, water stations & coffee station an additional joy. Lovely after being in the busy times sq area to return to the hotel with minimal traffic in the area. Another bonus is the Oculus close by for subway journeys, 911 memorial, Battery park etc. It’s definitely our go to hotel now in NY having previously stayed around Times Sq. Will definitely be returning.

title: Excelent
text: Excelent service i will come again excelent service excelent coffee excelent internet excelent room service excelent food ecelent to go to new york city housekeeping excelent i will recomended to my friends and family

title: World Center Hotel/CLUB QUARTERS WTC
text: Excellent location, taxi available, steak house outside lobby, free bottled water and coffee, lobby living room is cozy and lots of space. Family friendly and ADA compliant accessible showers. Family friendly/recommended.

title: I love coming back!
text:
This was my 7th stay at this property since 2021. I love coming back... I especially love the location. I usually fly in and out of Newark Airport and I use the PATH train between Newark Penn Station and WTC. I am an avid walker and from this location, you have fabulous access to Battery Park City, Hudson River Park, the Brooklyn Bridge, and all the neighborhoods in Lower Manhattan. 
On my first visit, I made the mistake of booking the cheapest room... Take my advice and spend a bit more to ensure a room with a view (This is critical!). The rooms are rather basic, but they are clean and well-appointed with a comfortable bed and bedding. The windows open a crack so you can have fresh air. Many rooms offer a kitchenette, a mini fridge, and/or a small pull-out sofa. Furnishings are continually updated... On my recent stay, the pull-out sofa was brand new and the mini fridge was new -- It even had a nice freezer compartment! The rooms are very soundproof and quiet (although depending on the layout of your room, you can sometimes hear noise from the hallway and nearby rooms). If you are lucky enough to have a room facing North (9/11 Memorial site) or East, you will enjoy floor-to-ceiling windows. I especially enjoy the two rooftop terraces and the lobby is also welcoming. There are many. many wonderful hotels to choose from in NYC, but for now my loyalty remains with this property.

title: Review
text: The facility overall and the room were very good including size, cleanliness and value; however, the overall experience was terrible due to providing a broken crib for one of our kids upon check-in and dismissing the issue completely by informing us to check again the next day if another one becomes available without any consideration for the safety involved in having a toddler sleep in an unstable crib. The issue was fixed the following day but no acknowledgment, apology or compensation were offered.

title: Nice, clean hotel, but crazy parking lot.
text: The hotel was clean, and the beds very comfortable.  I booked through booking.com and made arrangments with the front desk for people arriving at differing times.  Upon arrival, some guests were checking in via a kiosk, which was encouraged, which made things rather impersonal.  Checking out the same procedure. Very impersonal.   The negative was the highly inefficient way the discounted parking lot worked -- get a QR code, download it & fill out a form, and then get another link via email, etc.... before checking in and before checking out.  IT TOOK FOREVER!!  We checked out of the garage 10 minutes after our "estimated time" we had filled out on the form, and upon leaving the garage the attendant wanted us to pay additional after we had already paid.  The whole thing was crazy.  I wouldn't use their garage again.   We got to NYC frequently, so we have a basis for comparison.

title: Highly recommend
text:
I emailed Krystin Gimpel hotel manager after seeing her email on previous responses…o told her my room requirements and she advised which room type would be best for us. There was plenty communication backwards and forwards as I had to change my dates adding an extra night and then decided to take an extra guest. 

On arrival we were met by London who welcomed us and said Krystin had a room she thought we would like better than what we had booked. We had booked a suite so we were shown that and an interconnecting family room which essentially was a double room with a bath and kitchen area and a connecting twin room with walk in shower room. We opted for the latter…this was most definitely an upgrade and gave us more space and privacy. Thank you Krystin for arranging this for us. 

We loved the hotel the staff and the location was fantastic…so quiet and calm compared to the madness around midtown. I can’t tell you how nice it was to come up from the subway near the hotel and not hear sirens..horns and people. Everywhere is easily accessible via subways…you can walk about 15 minutes from the hotel to teach states island ferry. 

Couple of good eateries nearby…we visited bills burgers across the road…nice food but extremely loud music which wasn’t great. We visited George’s diner which was nice but zazas opposite was a much nicer diner inside…beware portions are gigantic. We also ate at Morton’s steakhouse next door to the hotel…very expensive if you are from the UK bit amazing food and wines. 

The 20th floor bar at the hotel is well worth a visit…service was great and the views are amazing. Although the bar is shut until 4.30-5pm you can access the area and sit and enjoy the views. There is also a terrace on the other side of the floor which has views over to Brooklyn. 

We will definitely stay at this hotel again when back in New York and we highly recommend it. 

Thank you to all staff for making our stay such a great one. Every single member of staff we came into contact with was welcoming friendly professional and just lovely! 

Hope you guys all enjoyed the English chocolate bars we kept dropping at reception every day.

title: My go-to downtown hotel
text:
I love this hotel! I've stayed here a few times because it's close to my office and where I choose to stay if I need to stay in the city overnight for work functions. Some of my favorite amenities:
-Free filtered water and refillable bottles in the hallways (LOVE this so much)
-Nice lobby/staff
-Great tech in the rooms - nice flatscreen TV and easy/modern temp controls
-Rooms are spacious
-Views are great!

Definitely stay here if you're in the downtown area!

title: Great service from Marsha-Ann at the front desk!
text: Marsha-Ann was always ready to help with a smile on her face. I asked her for advice on restaurants I could go to and led me to a really good one, with clear instructions on how to get there and things to take into account. When I got back to the hotel, she remembered my name and asked me how it went.

title: great value in an excellent location
text: This is an excellent value.  The rooms are small but well appointed and very clean.  There is a lovely bar on the 20th floor.  The staff is very nice and helpful.  It is a five minute walk to the World Trade Center.  The coffee service in the hotel living room is excellent.  All in all it was a very good experience.  Would definitely recommend for short stays.

title: great check-in service
text: Great check-in service from Devell who not only got me an excellent room (much appreciated, since I was only staying for one night) but made very helpful recommendations for breakfast. Both very friendly and professional

title: Great Hotel Great Locta
text:
After reading some of the negative comments I became quite anxious about staying here. 

IGNORE THE NEGATIVE COMMENTS

This is a great hotel, with a warm welcome when we arrived, comfortable public spaces, free water, tea and coffee. We upgraded to a view of WTC

title: Staff that cares.
text: Marsha-Ann Hay the Guest experience manager made this stay a joy. She was courteous and very helpful in making our stay more of a home away from home. The rooms were spotless and the bed was comfortable. I didn’t want to leave my room. She is a gem and needs to be acknowledged 🙏🏽. The staff really makes a difference in the overall experience.

title: Great value and clean room
text: Great value especially during holiday time of year.  Room was clean and comfortable.  Bed was extremely comfortable. Staff took care of all needs, even when had to extend stay by additional day. Will definately stay here again when in the area.

title: I’d stay again!
text: Clean, comfy bed/pillows, rooms are pretty good size for NYC. Staff was great. If you’re there for business it’s perfect, work stations on main level. I really like the location, close enough to everything but far enough to not be right in the madness.

title: Excellent guest experience!
text:
We have stayed at this hotel for probably 15 years and have never been disappointed.
During our recent visit, guest experience managers Marsha-Ann, Zeph and Devell went out of their way to help me navigate the parking app process and accommodate our room needs. I can’t say enough about how kind and helpful everyone is here. 
We’ll be back.

title: Stunning views
text: Thanks to Marsha Ann making a room change happen our stay was exceptional: smiling, empathic and action oriented. We highly recommend room 1605 for a breathtaking view on the memorial fountains. The hot coffee in the morning was a nice perk and the observatory deck on floor 20 really makes this hotel special, especially if you don't have the budget this time to have a view from your room and some of the rooms need a refresh) . Thanks again Marsha Ann for who you are and how you show up in your job and in the world! With gratitude for helping us make it a nice stay in NYC!

title: Great location, room a little dated but good space
text:
Great location as you are close to good subway lines but also really nice to be so close to the water for walks in the morning/evening. Also on the route for some 'hop off/hop on' buses which is convenient. 
The room was a bit dated but good size - Staff were nice and helpful when needed. It was generally clean and there is tea and coffee/still and sparkling water available all day. Advise would be to ask for an 'outward' facing room as we were on a corner room facing inwards and felt quite dark. 
Rooftop bar has some great views!

title: Wonderful
text: Spectacular views of the World Trade Center memorial and the new tower.  Spacious room (by NYC standards).  Check in/out was a breeze at the kiosk.  Short walk to the subway.  Will definitely stay there again.

title: Weekend in NYC
text:
Had the most amazing stay over the weekend at this hotel! 
Staff were friendly and readily available to answer any questions. Our bed was so comfortable! Our room was clean and tidy with all needed amenities. 
We had 2 walls of windows and the view was INCREDIBLE ❤️ to sit and have a coffee taking it all in was truly amazing. 
We had a late flight home and staff happily kept our bags after checkout until we collected them. 
I would definitely stay here again.

title: Fantastic option
text: Great location and the hotel was spotless throughout. Wifi was strong and the staff very friendly. Highly recommend. Good access to the a subway and there was a fantastic diner (George’s) just a 2 minute walk away.

title: Best hotel and view
text: Loved the hotel and staff and view. Got the room with a terrace view and we overlooked ground zero; which was great since we there over Veterans Day. So friendly and helpful and went above and beyond for my boyfriends birthday-putting amenities in the room for him. Would stay here again.

title: Awesome Stay
text: The hotel is easy to get to and located near food, shopping, and entertainment.   This my second stay, the staff was just as accommodating as the last visit and went out of their way to improve my visit.

title: Wonderful Birthday Experience!
text: Wonderful experience at the hotel. The staff were quite wonderful especially Marsha-Ann who placed us on a higher floor when she learned we were celebrating our nephews birthday. She was kind and asked how he was enjoying his day each time we passed through. Great location and view…walked to the Brooklyn Bridge, the 9/11 Memorial and was close to the subway. The people who worked there were most memorable!

title: Un hôtel cosy chic et calme
text: Un hôtel de classe, très bien situé au cœur de New-York, à 2 pas du World Trade Center, d’une station de métro, du sud de Manhattan. Des chambres de standing, avec vues magnifiques, un personnel à la hauteur et une terrasse à couper le souffle qui donne une vue imprenable où l’on peut boire un petit verre au calme dans la ville qui ne dort jamais.

title: Amazing location and room
text: The stay was really great and the location above the memorial was just amazing ! The room was big enough for us to feel comfortable. There was a microwave which was super practical for us. The view for the 18th room was amazing.

title: Amazing stay
text:
This hotel was excellent, the rooms were a really good size which I wasn’t expecting in Manhattan. The room was clean and had a good selection of coffee and shampoo etc. 
the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel has a roof top bar which overlooks the world trade centre and is such an amazing experience.

title: Excellent customer Service
text: Guest Experience Manager Ms. Marsha-Ann was excellent. She is very patient,  and tried different ways to find my booking as there was an issue with it. The rest of the staff are very good as well. Always willing to help. Would highly recommend this hotel for great service and location.

title: Great hotel
text: Club quarters was a great base for our trip to Manhattan. Very helpful staff the room was great very comfortable beds. Highly recommend for your stay in New York. Close to the subway which was really handy.

title: Not worth the money
text: The bed was comfortable and I can not complain about staff kindness and cleanliness, but other than that it was an average experience with troubles getting good WiFi, toilet paper and a request I asked for 9 months in advance. Definitely not worth the money, but I guess that’s hard to find in NYC.

title: Highly recommended
text: My mum and I loved staying in this hotel. The location is very convenient, the beds are super comfortable, there is unlimited supply of different varieties of tea and coffee, unlimited and environmental friendly supply of water, an excellent lobby area where I was able to do some work, a small, but well equipped gym, a bar with an amazing view, and finally, very friendly, competent and helpful staff!

title: N Y C: The place to be
text: The hotel was very nice and clean. It was in a very desirable location: close to everything. The sights are very awe-inspiring. Take good walking shoes, you walk EVERYWHERE! Eat at Wolfgang Puck: Cut

title: Adonis at front desk was fantastic.
text: Want management to know Adonis who manned the front desk on Oct 10 was crucial in making my stay exceptional and ensuring my return stays. I previously worked in hotel development and interfaced with ops team. Any hotel would be fortunate to have someone like Adonis who listened and understood why the room I was assigned to would’ve resulted in a poor experience for me and changed my room to one that made sure I’ll return to this hotel on my subsequent trips.

title: Boa localização, confortável, com atendimento que deixa a desejar.
text: Já tinha ficado no Club Quarters em San Francisco e optei por esse em NY pela experiência anterior e por ser perto da conferência que iria. O quarto era amplo, muito confortável e limpo. Com microondas e mini-geladeira foi ótimo para comprar algo no Whole Foods (perto). O lobby é bem agradável, com café, água e chá, além de TV e poltronas confortáveis. O ponto negativo é o atendimento, em especial no checkout. Os atendentes não fazem a menor questão de serem simpáticos e muito menos em ajudar. Isso foi ruim na minha estadia, o que me faz repensar ficar novamente no hotel.

title: Fantastique
text:
Merveilleux séjour au World Center Hôtel. La suite était très confortable,  propre, lumineuse avec une vue à couper le souffle sur le World Trade Center. Des bouteilles d'eau disponibles à tous les étages. Café, thé, cappuccino disponibles 24/24 h dans le superbe lobby au RDC.
Une terrasse au 20ieme étage avec une vue incroyable et où l'on peut boire et grignoter à des prix très corrects. 
Tous les personnels ( des agents d'entretien aux managers) sont aux petits soins.
Merci à eux et un grand merci à Marsha-Ann sans qui mon séjour n'aurait pas été aussi fabuleux.

title: One of the Best Places to NEVER Stay
text: Overall the most overpriced hotel with the staff who are not only unprepared to help but also unwilling to do anything. Worst experience at a hotel EVER. would compare it to a circa 1989 Motel 6. Never again.

title: Fantastic hotel and location
text: Beautiful hotel very close to the 9/11 Memorial with a gorgeous view from the rooftop bar. Nice amenities including common areas with coffee and water and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly, especially Marsha-Ann at the front desk.

title: Ill be back soon !
text:
Impecable Hotel , excellent loction with a  very good enviroment and very well conected  with the rest of the new York City area 
Roof top bar is amazing , great service and cocktails 
 Front Desk and Roof top bar teams were 5 stars  !

title: Exceptional Staff, beautiful rooms!
text: Booked three suites for several days of business meetings in NYC. The front desk staff was incredible at arranging for our team to check in early! The rooms are gorgeous and it is so QUIET! We will definitely be staying here from now on during our regular NYC meetings. Grateful we finally found a hotel that checked all the boxes! Highly recommend if you're in New York to stay here! Centrally located blocks from the Hudson River, the memorial museum & so many restaurants within a block or more! We love that Morton's Steakhouse is adjoined next to the front lobby.

title: Quick NYC trip.
text:
For twin beds, these were the most comfortable I've ever experienced.   Close to everything in the south end , able to walk to ground zero, walk the Brooklyn Bridge and walk to Battery park.....and the staff was exceptional!!
The views breathtaking...

title: Good, clean, modern & well located hotel. Stunning views
text: Location is excellent if choosing southern Manhattan or even as a base for NYC as a whole given proximity to subway stations….easy to head North or into Brooklyn / Staten Island. Rooms are modern, clean reasonable size compared to NYC hotels I’ve stayed in. Incredible views of World Trade Tower (I booked room with view). A very nice facility was the chilled water in corridor with refillable bottles. Perhaps the only thing missing being an in room safe. Excellent roof top bar. A good hotel.

title: Marsha-Ann rocks
text:
Marsha-Ann at reception was the nicest. Friendly cheerful and very professional.
 All the other stuff members where equals pleasant 
Hotel was good too
Room hat an awsome view on the memorial . 
Coffee is free and quit pleasant, towels could be bigger

title: Buena ubicación y atención de trabajadores, cero en utensilios de cocina.
text: Pagamos un dineral para tener una habitación con cocina,  tenía dos fuegos muy bonitos a estrenar, ya q carecia de cualquier tipo de olla y/o sartén para usar, los pedimos y aún esperamos. En cinco noches limpiaron la habitación una sola vez.

title: Vacantion NY
text:
I only stayed one night at this hotel, but I was very surprised of the nice location, friendly staff and cleanness and comfort of the room.
Shops and restaurants on walking distance and of good quality. Ground Zero and WTC museum on walking distance.

title: Great hotel in the perfect location
text: It's our go-to hotel when in NYC. Clean, comfortable, close to subway, restaurants and memorials. This time though (because of the 9/11 events) the room price was 300% marked-up, and we had to wait until 5 pm to get a room. Then we were offered the option to check out late.... for another $99. Not cool...

title: Very poor stay
text: The staff were the least customer friendly I have experienced at any club quarters: we don't do this. We can't do this. We are not a normal hotel were the responses I got from front desk! The wifi is poor and there is no feeling of being valued despite being a member. I've stayed here before and this hotel has definitely gone downhill.

title: Great Hotel
text: Very clean. The bed was very comfortable.  Slept great!  The staff was very helpful and accommodating.  Great location.  Walking distance to the Battery and access to Liberty and Ellis Island and everything related to 9/11.  Good selection of places to eat or drink also within walking distance.  Would definitely return.

title: Good location, unfriendly staff
text: Overall, the location was excellent and the room and the view were nice. Coffee and refillable water bottles were free. The biggest con was the unfriendly staff that was unwilling to help especially at the front desk.

title: One of the best in FiDi
text: Loved my stay at this hotel, staff was amazing and amenities were good. Views from the terrace of the memorial site on September 11TH were magnificent. A little on the pricier side but I left absolutely content. Check in and out was a breeze and my room was even ready a little early.

title: Good location - clean - convenient
text: Great location close to subway. Small but clean rooms. Coffee is available in room and in lobby for free& they have sparkling water on tap. The hotel bar is great, has good cocktails and an amazing view!

title: Trés belle expérience et bonne surprise pour un séjour en famille
text: Pour le tourisme L'hotel est parfaitement situé pour se rendre aux principaux centres d'intérets de la big apple. L'accueil est irréprochable, le personnel à l'écoute et le service trés réactif. Notre chambre trés propre avait un point de vue magnifique direct sur le WTC. Equipée d'un frigo, d'un micro onde et d'une cafetière à capsule. Le plus de l'hotel: bouteilles d'eau fraiches à tous les étages, déclinaisons de café en grains ou thé à disposition h24 gratuitement dans les salons d'accueil. (Du vrai café). Un local au 6eme propose des distributeurs de  friandises, une machine à glaçons avec seau. Une salle de sport est également à disposition et cerise sur le gateau on peut profiter de la vue imprenable d'un top roof situé au 20eme en sirotant un cocktail. Pour l'entretien journalier des chambres il suffit de le demander la veille. L'hotel a grandement contribué à la reussite de notre séjour.

title: Great Customer Service
text: London and Marsha-Ann made my birthday stay extra special. The hotel has a rooftop where you can have lunch or drinks with a breathtaking view! The hotel location was near many restaurants and train stations.

title: Great Location
text:
Great location. Amazing view from the room. Close to the subway station, the PATH train station to Newark Airport and the ferry to Liberty Island. Very safe in the evenings.
Coffee, tea and water available 24/7 in the lobby.

title: AVOID
text: Room was dirty (hair on the lotion in the bathroom, spots of an unknown substance on the chairs). The single most uncomfortable bed I’ve ever encountered. Requested a room with a queen, and I have two twin beds. Extremely loud…you can hear every door open, hallway conversations…it’s obnoxious and distracting. I have a second work trip booked for here in 2 weeks, and I’m changing it to literally anyplace else first thing tomorrow. I have 3 nights left here and I want to cry thinking about it. The location is good and had a nice view of the reflecting pools, but otherwise, I hate it here.

title: Terrible - avoid this hotel
text:
Super thin walls and you can hear Absolutey everything - doors banging, people walking through the halls, neighbors chatting. I had to take melatonin and ear plugs to fall asleep

Tv did not work. I tried casting netflix from my phone but the tv would randomly cast chrome every 10 minutes

Checkin and check out was disastrous. I checked in and they told me my room was ready but that I’d need to wait 10-15 min for them to inspect my room. They said they’d text me when it’s ready. I waited 40 min, no text. I went up to the desk then they checked me into a kiosk and miraculously my room was ready. I don’t think they’d let me know if I didn’t ask. Also this was at 5 pm, well past check in time. Checkout was also problematic but there’s so many negatives here I’ll spare that part 

Avoid hote at all cost

title: Réservation annulée à 2 h du matin !
text:
Réservation annulée parce que nous ne sommes pas arrivés à 18 ! Nous avions réservé depuis plusieurs semaines un séjour de 9 nuits pour 1 couple et 1 enfant par Hôtel.com . Je n’ai pas prépayé car je pensais payer directement sur place . Nous avons été retardés à la douane par une panne informatique . J’ai reçu entre-temps un mail de hotel.com nous demandant comment c’était passé le Check in . Arrivés à 2 heures du matin , nous apprenons comme nous n’étions pas présents à 18h , notre réservation a été annulée et qu’ils n’ont plus de chambres avec 3 couchages mais seulement 2 . Le réceptionniste en avait rien à faire de nous laisser à la rue . Nous avons trouvé une place au Millenium .
Pas finalement déçus de ne pas être allés à cet hôtel car la réception ne nous a pas donné envie vue l’accueil et l’état général de la réception .
Nous voyageons beaucoup et c’est la 1ere fois que cela nous arrive d’avoir notre réservation annulée ! Si je pouvais mettre 0 étoile je l’aurai fait !

title: Worst 1st impression ever.
text: The worst experience ever faced and shocking… upon checkin and confirmation of my room which should have been reserved, it’s absolutely disappointing and unorganised that i have to wait almost for two hour and still currently waiting for my for my room at their lobby. In compensation for their mistake of overbooking they do not provide a small snack and just keep their guest waiting. Absolutely disappointing i must say. Honestly the worst 1st impression any hotel to give their guests

title: Fantastico in tutto
text:
L'hotel ci è piaciuto moltissimo, sia per comodità che per posizione. Nella Hall c'è una sala dove è possibile preparare caffè/cappuccino/té ed è presente anche un erogatore di acqua filtrata.

La atanza è abbastanza spaziosa e ben isolata acusticamente. I letti li abbiano trovati molto comodi. Son presenti: climatizzatore, macchinetta caffè/té, fono, detergenti, frigo. Su ogni piano c'è la possibilità di riempire le bottiglie con acqua filtrata.

La posizione è molto strategica, l'hotel è a pochi metri dal One World Trade Center e Memoriale 9/11. Circa 6-7 minuti a piedi ci sono la metro rossa, verde e gialla.

title: Great stay, central located and great service
text:
We had a great stay at Club quarters.  The roof top bar has a great view, location is perfect next to WTC, 9/11 memorial end museum, all subway lines are very close so all city is easy to reach.
The service of Marsha was great, we got a great room and she helped where she could with advise for trips and restos. She added value to our stay

title: Una piacevole sorpresa
text: Pensavo che la zona, essendo di uffici, la notte si svuotasse, invece è abitata e piacevolmente movimentata. Avevo scelto l’hotel per le tante recensioni positive e le confermo tutte: personale collaborativo e non menefreghista di fronte ai problemi, distributore di acqua  liscia e frizzante buonissima, non offre colazione ma punto di ristoro omaggio con caffè di ottimo livello per la nazione, letti comodissimi, camere ben insonorizzate, pulite, ben tenute, quasi tutte con vista sul memoriale, prodotti da bagno in confezioni riempibili e di ottima qualità. Costo leggermente più basso della media, forse perché non proprio in centro, che comunque è raggiungibile con una miriade di linee metropolitane in pochi minuti. In viaggi precedenti gli alberghi di New York, anche di catene prestigiose, si erano rivelati sporchi e deludenti. Certamente userò questa catena anche per altri viaggi.

title: Good business accommodation in the Financial District.
text: Great accommodation for business jn NYC. Basic facilities but lifted by the rooftop bar from where you have great views of the WTC memorial and skyline. Rooms are on the basic side but have all the essentials. Safe neighbourhood and near a number of subway stations to take you uptown easily.

title: Nice hotel in great location in lower Manhattan.
text:
This hotel offers great value for the price in a absolute top location. Many locations can be reached in walking distance. There is a fabulous rooftop bar with spectacular views of Manhattan. For sleeping it is nice and quiet in this area during the night. 
Would stay here again any time .

title: No-frills, mostly self-service hotel in downtown NYC
text:
This high-rise hotel is conveniently located in downtown Manhattan. It has 25 floors. The rooms, gym and rooftop areas are only accessible to those with a hotel card key. We appreciated this security measure. 

There is a rooftop bar but we did not go there. Instead, we went through the gym to an open air rooftop space with chairs etc for guests’ use.  While we were there, we saw a small group making a dance video (the video-makers told us it was not a formal photoshoot).

Our room was described as a suite on the hotel website. There were two sections - a sleeping area and a living area - connected by a small passageway. The bathroom, situated between the two sections, opened onto the passageway. 

One quirky feature - the main door of this room/suite opened into the sleeping area (typically, in a suite with a single entrance, one enters the living area first). 

The sleeping area had a queen size bed, a built-in cupboard (with hanging space, drawers, a small safe, and small ironing board) and a flat screen TV on the wall at the foot of the bed. The bathroom was quite large (comparatively) and had a toilet, a sink, a walk-in shower area (no tub) with a shower curtain (not the typical glass enclosure). There were no facial tissues or shower cap. The living area had  floor-to-ceiling windows on 2 of the 4 walls. It had a couch, a flat screen TV on one wall, a small desk area with a chair (the lamp on the desk did not work), and a “kitchenette” with a fridge, microwave (both small) and Keurig coffee maker. There were no utensils/cutlery/dishes, paper towels or cleaning supplies in the “kitchenette”, and the only sink in the suite was the one in the bathroom.

Of the people we met at the hotel, the housekeeping staff were the most helpful. We met some of them in the elevator and in the hotel corridors. They told us about the various hotel amenities, the card key access to the elevator, the gym, the filtered cold water available on each floor etc.

POSITIVE ASPECTS: 
-  Reasonably comfortable room/suite. 
-  Walking shower with detachable handheld showerhead
-  Free filtered water in bottles on each floor. 
-  Splendid view of some downtown landmarks from the floor-to-ceiling windows on 2 of the 4 walls of the living area
-  Helpful housekeeping staff
-  Direct line to Curb (NYC taxi service) from the front desk

NEGATIVE ASPECTS: 
Our first impression when we entered the hotel was that our stay would be excellent and merit a 5-star TripAdvisor review. However, that impression changed as our stay progressed. There was no concierge-type figure we could consult about area restaurants and attractions. We did not see any bellhops to help with luggage. Our interaction with members of the front desk staff was minimal. They seemed harried and defensive (even when they were not busy with hotel guests). After a couple of attempts, we went to the internet for answers to our queries. 

The overall self-service ambiance and paucity of human interaction caused us to wonder if perhaps the hotel was still using Covid pandemic protocols (though no one was masked and we were not asked to show our vaccination certificates!). Since there was no mechanism to address our concerns, we decided to check out after 2 nights (we had intended to stay 4 nights). 

In summary, though this hotel was not a good fit for our needs, it  will probably be suitable for those seeking a no-frills, mostly self-service, downtown hotel.

SUGGESTION: 
The hotel could post a list of instructions, amenities etc on the website . The checkin & checkout process could also be done online. Requests for services could also be made online. In that way, guests could bypass the front desk staff.

title: Super
text: Tutto perfetto: posizione perfetta, stanza abbastanza grande, pulita, ben accessoriata, personale super gentile e soprattutto una vista impagabile. Rapporto qualità prezzo alle stelle, super consigliato per vacanze in coppia o in famiglia.

title: Excellent
text: The filtered water on each floor and coffee services in the lobby is a very nice added extra. The overall hotel experience is excellent (I have stayed in many hotels in my life). The room is a very good size with very good Aircon, coffee machine, sufficient amount of plugs etc. The bed is very comfortable.

title: Disappointed
text: We purchased a superior view room with terrace.Upon check in, the room was not as as depicted on the hotel’s website. We were told that room doesn’t exist. The terrace lock was broken. I was told my daughter and I shouldn’t worry as it wasn’t likely anyone could get in. I asked for another room and was eventually moved to the 2nd floor overlooking an alley with no terrace. I was given $60 for my trouble.

title: Great Find
text: Excellent stay!  Everything was as we’d hoped. Very friendly and helpful 1st floor staff. Definitely take time to hang out and have a drink on the roof top bar.  Lowest price was 2 days before check in on Expedia.

title: Fantastic stay at this hotel
text: We had the best 4 nights at this hotel, the staff were lovely, very easy and quick to check in using the tablet system, room was quite big with an extremely comfy bed!! The views of one world were incredible. Rooftop bar was also a good little spot with some nice cocktails. We would 100% come back and stop at this hotel again. Little things like free tea and coffee and water supplied with bottles, fantastic. Thank you!

title: Great stay at comfortable, clean, modern hotel
text: The hotel is clean and modern, and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. I appreciated the additional toiletries and the mini fridge and microwave. The location is ideal for business trips or for tourists. I will definitely be coming back.

title: Excellent
text: We had an excellent experience at this hotel. The staff were overall helpful and friendly. Our room was very clean and comfortable. This is a great location, near most important subway lines to be able to get around Manhattan. We felt very welcome and will be returning.

title: Bad services
text: The staff is rude and disrespectful, staff and in a bad mood. Staff needs an attitude adjustment. You can’t bring outside food they said .  what kind of crap is this just for that I did not buy 1 drink !

title: Fabulous views
text: The hotel was a great experience. The views were amazing and the staff was very accommodating. The front desk clerk Spencer was a pleasure to work with. My only issue was the parking the one that gives the hotel discount refused to have us stay overnight. Supposedly he does that to everyone  so I advise to book in advance so he can’t turn you away. Other than paying over $70 for parking we had a great time.

title: World Trade Center
text: Hotel was ok, no food.  Parking was a disaster.  No directions for parking available.  Had to pay over$100 a night to park. Rooms are very, very small.  Bathroom also small.  Bed very comfortable.  Attached restaurant is Morton's. Nice food, very pricey.

title: Hidden gem in lower Manhattan
text: This was great little boutique hotel.  The highlight was a 20th floor deck with fabulous views and a bar on the same floor with deck seating and excellent service.  The twin beds gave me pause when I booked with a friend, but they were very comfortable.  The room had a micro wave and a fridge and a very good shower.  The room is small so not great for a long stay, but perfect for a few days.

title: Poor hospitality
text:
Would expect better customer service and proactive members to promote tourism.
The rooms had basic requirements.The location was perfect and was close proximity to major attractions. 
The main challenges were at the front desk.

title: Beautiful
text:
I recommend this place 100% good location cleanliness friendly staff comfortable room ,I’m coming again 

I recommend this place 100% good location cleanliness friendly staff comfortable room coming again

title: Great hotel in downtown NYC
text:
A great hotel in NYC. Good sized room for a family and great to have a fridge and microwave in the room.

Free water on every floor and tea/coffee station in reception as well as option for this in the room.

Good value stay and location near the subway. 

Would recommend.

title: Best price and location by WTC
text: Excellent nicely renovated hotel within steps of World Trade Center    Clean bathrooms. Great beds.  Bonus bar on 20th floor with awesome views.  Great value for a reasonable price! Easy checkin and out.  Staff very friendly and professional

title: goood
text: Great hotel great stay great rooms great service overall excellent experience but there needs to be more of a restaurant esthetic to the bar and overall it's a great hotel so please bring back some food just because the panda in the cap and doesn't mean it's need to be permanent

title: Great hotel, excellent location
text: Very nice hotel, excellent price. Hotel is located right next to the beautiful 9/11 plaza, 5 minutes away from battery park and Brookfield place, a lot of other things within walking distance. Nice staff, clean rooms, terrace with bar and WTC viewing area - very happy with it, good experience!

Nice place to spend few days in New York.Very close to ground zero and subway.. pleasant and helpful staff. Room were well proportioned and wee layer out. Water flow through the shower was exceptional.

title: Dirty, smelly, wrong room
text: Upon arrival the room was not available at 5pm and it took until 6pm for a room to be ready.  We laid down and one pillow was not clean, it stank.  This was a handicapped room with interior view which is not the room I booked. It also was a full mattress Not a queen bed which was booked.  Found a bug in the shower, which happens… but the room was attended to only once in 4 nights and bugs were left in shower.  The worst part was the strangest smell once you entered the room.  I researched this hotel, but I’m sure there were better options.

title: Amazing hotel
text: Very good location, excellent customer service, my room was very nice, comfortable and with a privileged view. The hotel is close to the main tourist centers in the area, restaurants and also public transport stations, it is a very safe area

title: Great hotel and location
text: This is a fabulous hotel; comfortable beds, very clean rooms and quiet. The hotel is in a great location. The staff is very welcoming and friendly. I will definitely stay here again! There are many restaurants and bars located around the hotel. I went to the Mughlai Indian restaurant which is half a block from this hotel; best Indian food in NYC!

title: Reservations are not accurate
text: Don't bother making reservations when you get there they will waste ur money give you what they want and you will be s.o.L you'll have to take what they have or not have anywhere to sleep .wasn't cheap and feel like I was tricked just to get me there then they changed everything to what they had available even tho reservations was made two weeks in advance

title: Mediocre experience
text:
Staying in Manhattan, you are supposed to pay a lot for a small room, but you also expect to get a great internet connection when you need to work. 
In this case, I paid a lot, as expected, but the internet connection was really bad.
The room, although very small, was decent. The "fitness center" is small, and very poor fitness options.

title: Terrible customer service!
text: Terrible customer service. Arrived twice and both times (hours apart and passed check-in tine) was told no rooms were ready. Front desk literally didn’t care and just told me to text them. Currently waiting at 9pm ‘hoping’ to get a room that I pre-booked. Unacceptable!

title: Fantastic Stay
text: We had a fantastic stay at CQ. From accommodating a very late check-in through the check-out everyone was very welcoming and friendly. Room was super clean with everything you need. Hotel has a 20th floor open deck with fantastic views, and it is next to 9/11 Memorial (safe area). It has an  easy, very close access to Metro / Subway. Outstanding value for what we paid. We will be staying here again in the future for sure!

title: Muy buen hotel
text:
Un hotel genial, la cama y almohadas muy cómodas. 
Tiene una mini cocina que va muy bien 
En cada planta hay botellas con agua para rellenarlas 
En el lobby del hotel hay café y té  a todas horas del día gratis 
Al lado del museo del 11S
Y de la estación de calatrava que te lleva a todas partes de Nueca york y Nueva Jersey.
El personal del hotel muy agradable 
Y desde el último piso del hotel una terraza con unas vistas preciosas

title: Don’t take Hotels description as gospel
text:
Poor customer service mainly male staff, poor facilities in Room, no usp ports, room only cleaned on demand, and even then did not clean 
Housekeeping very loud and using facilities in executive area, no regard to guests.
I did get an upgrade but this experience left me angry .
Left Hotel 2 days early to book into another Hotel.
Be careful if your planing on booking this hotel there’s much better for the same tarif

title: Excellent stay!!
text: This hotel far exceeded my expectations. From checkin to check out the staff, especially Arnold was very nice, pleasant and helpful. The location was excellent because of the available subway lines depending on where we needed to go. The reason for my 4 rating is due to the water pressure, wasn’t forceful enough but at least it ran. Another plus for us was having  water stations throughout the facility (bottles provided).  Overall this is an excellent place to stay and I’ll be sure to book it again on a return to NYC.

title: Great hotel for the location, terrible restaurant experience
text: The hotel is clean, well appointed rooms, unbeatable view of the world trade center, front desk staff is very nice and helpful, but stay away from the restaurant their service is terrible... bar staff simply doesn't care about the patrons.  Considering the location in Manhattan, the bad restaurant isn't a big deal because there are many other options nearby, but it's too bad they can't manage the restaurant better than they do.

title: Extrem unfreundlich
text: Sehr unfreundliches Personal bereits beim Check Inn. Wir waren 5 Erwachsene und 2 Kinder. Eine Dame unserer Gruppe hatte, nach einer Krebserkrankung, eine Behinderung. Diese Dame wurde mehrfach sehr unfreundlich behandelt, einmal beleidigt und sogar beschimpft. Auf das Verhalten angesprochen wollte man uns alle Zimmer stornieren.

title: NYC experience trip
text: Fabulous NYC trip with great location to get easily to all the spots we wanted to see.  Beautiful view from hotel terrace as well!  Very friendly staff.  Clean, comfortable room.  Would definitely stay here again!

title: Location beyond compare!
text: Excellent location if you are visiting the 9/11 Memorial, Statue of Liberty and more. If you need help with anything, ask the desk. They have great info, but are a bit reserved unless you ask. Great trip!

title: Highly Recommend
text:
Best experience of entire vacation 
Beautiful and people very nice
Clean and very comfortable and view from room was amazing definitely recommended for visitors coming to see the 9/11 Memorial and other places as subway is not far and taxis easily accessible

title: Great location & upgrade to Ground Zero view is totally worth it
text: This is a very nice hotel located in a more quiet area of Manhattan. My friend and I stayed for 3 nights and I upgraded through Booking.com to get a room with a view of Ground Zero. It was definitely worth it! We slept with the balcony doors open and it was very comfortable. The bed was super comfortable, and even the coffee was extremely good. All the staff we interacted with from the point of check-in to check-out, including front desk staff, bar staff and housekeeping were great. We texted once a day to receive additional items in our room, and we received an answer right away, and by the time we got back to our room we received the items requested. I will definitely return to this hotel in the future. Thanks!

title: Outstanding Service. Great location. Unforgettable view of the 9/11 Memorial.
text: This hotel is in a great location and offers unforgettable views of the 9/11 Memorial. Our experience was made even better because of the hotel staff. Spencer, in particular provided world class service. We were always greeted by a smile from Spencer and the rest of the staff as we walked through the lobby. They always wished us a great day in NY when we left each morning, and welcomed us back each night. We requested a few items during our stay such as an extra blanket and pillow. The service was always quick and friendly. Thank you to Spencer and his team for a GREAT New York City experience.

title: May visit 2023
text:
We stayed at Club Quarters hotel at the World Trade Centre sight.
We had room 805. The view from the room was spectacular. Double doors opened up to view the WTC one and the memorial pools. 
The 4 star review is not the same as the UK 4*
The room and bathroom were clean but needs updating. The furniture is old. The fridge was rattling and something you would use temporarily. The shower was powerful and at hot as you would ever need it.  The room service is not automatic and you need to request it each day.
The view from the bar on the roof is amazing but the drinks were expensive.
All the staff were very friendly.
There is no food at all in the hotel. There is free coffee and tea as well as bottled water.
You can leave your luggage securely on the last day. There is no room safe.

title: Convenient and a great value
text: The hotel is convenient to the World Trade Center and you can catch a subway to pretty much anywhere from a five minute walk to the Oculus. The hotel was a great value and in a part of the city that is a little quieter than the Times Square/more touristy areas. The hotel has lots of free water stations. The only thing we would have liked was USB outlets in the room. Make sure to bring a USB brick as the room only had power outlets.

title: Budget friendly hotel
text: Very good hotel situated right by the 9/11 memorial and WTC. Our room was small but comfortable and it overlooked the pools of the memorial. The staff were helpful and everywhere was clean.  The subway was within a short walk as was the ferry to the Statue of Liberty. A good reasonably priced hotel.

title: Most accommodating hotel I’ve ever experienced.
text: Everything about our stay was exceptional. The staff went above and beyond to accommodate any need we had and were always friendly, cheerful and helpful. We needed a safety pin for our daughter’s graduation cap and gown and they searched until they found one.

title: Excellent hotel near subways and sites
text: The Club Quarters Hotel/World Hotel is our first choice when coming to NYC. It is close to multiple subway lines, good restaurants in the area, comfortable and clean rooms, super helpful staff, free internet, free coffee, and distilled/sparkling water. The small things mean a lot!

title: Comfortable, pleasant, quiet stay in NYC.
text: Comfortable, quiet, great, safe area. Friendly staff. Great bar, bar staff, view  and cocktails. Stayed with sister and teen daughter. Attention to dusting and a few tired bits in the room but these were MINOR!! No breakfast but plenty of local places to choose from and free tea and coffee and water from lobby area.Had a great time in NYC made even better by having World Centre/Club Quarters hotel to retreat to. I was worried about noise and sleeping in NYC but this was a quiet little gem.

title: Best kept secret!
text: Years ago I hated staying near Wall Street... Now it is NYC's best-kept secret! After 20 years of construction and chaos, FiDi has returned as an amazing neighborhood. It is quiet, safe, and convenient to public transportation, ferries, The PATH train, shops, restaurants, and spectacular parks. Club Quarters is located in the heart of it. I love staying here, but you need to upgrade and book a room with a view. It will cost you a few dollars, but it will be worth the investment. This hotel has a beautiful rooftop terrace and unobstructed views of One World Trade. It is super quiet and convenient to everything in the City. I have stayed at the hotel 6 times since 2021. I always book a room with a mini fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. You can easily pick up provisions at the Riverside Market - located just 2 blocks West (toward the Hudson River). You can also pick up picnic food for happy hour on the roof. This hotel has a nice lobby, plenty of washrooms, and coffee, tea, and filtered cold water.  The beds are comfortable, hot showers, and plenty of storage and hooks. The windows even open for some fresh air! Some rooms even have private terraces! You won't be disappointed.

title: Great stay
text: This hotel was amazing !!! It’s near a lot of things. Great selection for someone that is traveling solo ! The staff was really friendly and helpful . I loved my stay ! I will defiantly book again !!!!

title: Amazing stay
text: The location of this hotel is unbeat for visiting the statue of liberty, ellis Island and the 911 memorial. Staff was amazing from the front desk to the bar staff. I loved having the coffee machine in the lobby to make it fresh whenever I wanted it! The sparkling water dispenser was also a very nice surprise!

title: Leisure
text: Nice little room for wife and I. Bathroom shelves were very dusty and few outlets were not working. Roof top had a beautiful view of WTC and surrounding buildings. (Which was across the st) Best part of our stay. Highly recommended and yes we will visit again.

title: A pleasant experience ✨️
text: I had a nice experience here at this hotel. I stayed here for one night on the 18th floor, and the best part about the room I booked was the view of the World Trade Center. I couldn't stop looking out the window.

title: Hotel con ubicación muy buena
text:
Muy buena ubicación, hotel muy limpio, habitaciones amplias con cocina.
En el hobby del hotel café muy bueno, té y agua gratis todos el día. En cada pasillo de las habitaciones hay botellas para llenarlas con agua también
 El personal de recepción el líneas generales muy amables sobre todo los que hablan español.

title: Incompetent Front Desk Staff
text: I've had a lovely stay at Club Quarters until an interaction with a guy by the name of Arnold, who called himself a manager. The guy was probably the most incompetent front desk agent I have encountered. My entire stay was ruined because of the interaction over the laundry service process which he clearly did not explain properly. And instead of diffusing the situation and taking responsibility for his miscommunication, he stood his ground on being arrogant to a repeat customer.

title: Had a awesome time location is great
text:
I love the service when you when you check in
Receptionist was very polite and helpful location is awesome rooms were very clean coffee and water 24 hours top floor view is excellent happy hours is awesome

title: great spot for work or playing tourist in downtown Manhattan
text:
A nice place as a work or holiday base - close to the ferries and many attractions. Plus my favorite bagel house. 

Nice shower, comfy bed, good Wi-Fi, and great views overlooking the trade center.

Excellent staff and a great little coffee machine.

title: Great hotel perfect location
text:
Great rooms clean and big room, the hotel is located on great places, many restaurants and coffee shops close by,
The staff was great at front desk, beautiful view from top floor and quiet atmosphere, subway is just 4 minutes away, and Wtc memorial is just outside

title: The best vacation in over 8 years !!
text: On entry I was greeted with smiles they took my bags until check-in time, I was very impressed with the lounge area, and the coffee lounge I was excited before I even got to my room. Beautiful room, comfy bed, clean everything. I’ll be back very soon .  The location was spot on for everything from food to trains to beautiful sceneries .

title: My go to choice
text: Excellent location and beautiful view from rooftop bar. Room was spacious and quiet. The front desk staff was helpful. Cost was in line with other properties but this location is a 3 minute walk to the Oculus train station.

title: 4 night stay
text: We were in Club Quarters Hotel (or World Center hotel) for 4 nights. Great location in financial district. Real value for money looking at room space, quality of service and location. With great view from the hotel bar. On top of that also refillable bottles of drinking water, and coffee&tea for free. Would recommend this hotel for sure. And also saw several flight crews using this hotel.

title: Great stay at a great hotel.
text: When our original reservation at another hotel got cancelled last minute, I took a chance on this one.  I am so glad I did.  There were nine of us (5 teenagers) and we needed three rooms.  Even last minute they were able to give us two of the rooms on the same floor.  The hotel and rooms were clean and comfortable.  The views were amazing.  One room had a terrace that the kids just loved.  The staff was friendly and accommodating.  Christos  went over the top to make us feel welcome.  I will definitely return!

title: An oasis of calm, and good value for the money.
text: I have been coming to NYC several times a year for many years, and I have decided that staying in the Financial District is a good idea because it is quieter than midtown, and almost as convenient, given the multiple subway options. I also have come to prefer this hotel to others in the neighborhood because the rooms are more comfortable, and the design of the bathroom is better. I have had only good experiences here.

title: Excellent experience
text: Everything was perfect, I have no negative incidents to report whatsoever. I would definitely choose this hotel again if visiting New York. Excellent and very friendly staff, great location. Congratulations to all people working there.

title: Worst ever
text:
They were fully paid. They gave my room away and there I was at midnight with no room and their offer was $40 can fare to go
Somewhere else. And when you speak with their staff they don’t speak to you like a person. They use their customer service scripts and every response starts with “I’m so sorry and I know this must be very frustrating for you “ and when I asked them
To just help me find another room and not use their customer service script the desk clerk responded “im so sorry I know how frustrating this must be for you “. And of course since I booked through an app I hey we’re NOT helpful at all in getting a refund.

title: Great
text: Spent 4 nights here in early March. Good location, very friendly and helpful staff. Delicious complementary coffee and water available all hours. Got a room high up with good views over WTC Memorial. Would recommend to all.

title: Very happy
text: Sam greeted us at check in and he was super nice, friendly and helpful! Gave us a great recommendation for pizza as well.  Views from our room were amazing. Very clean, nice design of room comfortably slept 3.  Bed and pullout super comfortable. Having 2 tvs was great.  Fitness room was great and well equipped. Especially liked the way the rooms were separated from the main hall by another little hall so there was no noise from the main hallway, this made the room so quiet and private!

title: NYC
text: Went for my 50th birthday weekend. Enjoyed my stay. It was a great location and view.   The staff was very friendly and helpful. I definitely will stay here when returning to the city. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable.

title: Great hotel in an amazing location
text: The hotel has great features and is really clean. The rooftop bar has a breathtaking panorama of One World Trade Center and Ground Zero + the buildings around. The location is perfect: just a walking distance from World Trade Center, Wall Street and Battery Park, from which you can take a ferry to the Statue of Liberty. Plus great variety of cafés and restaurants nearby. Beware that garbage trucks come very late at night if you are on a lower floor.

title: Should be a 5-Star hotel
text: Clean quiet and centrally located. Close to everything. The staff is amazing and professional. My family and I can’t wait to come back.  So close to the Trade center, plenty of parking around the hotel.

title: My April stay at Club Quarters WTC
text:
Very comfortable room, nice bed. This is the cleanest hotel I've ever stayed at. Its immaculate. Im very picky about hotels and could not find any flaws. The hotel is also very modern has a contemporary feel about it
The million dollar view from the terrace is awesome. Will definitely be back.

title: VALUE
text: Having stayed at more than 1000 hotels in over 100 countries, the overall value of our recent 2 night stay was among the top of list. From the view to the pillow to the purified water to the professionalism of Christos Zeras and the staff — WTC Club Quarters is where you want to stay.

title: Eddie Xiao
text:
Friendly, Clean, Convenient and comfortable.
I brought my dogs with me and we all enjoyed stay. 
I look forward to come back and stay again.
This one is close to my working building and just walking
to no need any commute. Love them.

title: Good place to experience NYC
text:
Good place to experience NYC. Friendly and helpful staff. We had a junior suite for 3 persons, good beds, refrigirator in the room. free coffee and water in the lobby. 
Nice bar at 20th. floor to view and relax.

title: The place to be in NYC
text: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel and can only recommend it! We had a room with a queen bed and a sofa bed with an amazing view. Staff is really nice. There are several restaurants and stores around and several metro stations. Undoubtedly this is the place to stay in NYC.

title: Club Quarters Hotels NYC - WTC area
text: nice location near WTC , easy to get , close to many locations incl Wall St , Brooklyn Bridge like 20 mins walk , Wonderfull terrace on a roof / 20 floor level , good Bar same level , free coffee machine 24/7 , with good quality coffee beans (which is rare in NYC - Im not Starbucks fan )

title: The capacity of the room is misrepresented
text: The problem for us was that the room was sold as fitting for three people whereas there was only one queen bed in the room and the only option offered to solve the issue was to add a roll away bed for the third adult which took up all the space in the room which was not large to begin with.

title: Clean, comfortable, friendly, and well-situated
text: We spent a weekend at Club Quarters/WTC.  Our experience was excellent in all respects--we had a smooth check-in, our room was very pleasant and boasted a spectacular view of the WTC complex, and all comfort and cleanliness elements were right on-point.

title: Super ! Nous reviendrons
text:
Un séjour au calme (chambre sans vue), quartier moins vibrant que le centre de Manhattan mais c'était voulu. Super bien desservi.
Literie très confortable
Ménage fait 1 fois durant le séjour ou à la demande si besoin de plus
Chambre twin sup avec micro onde et frigo. Pas hyper moderne et pas hyper lumineuse mais vu le temps passé sur place !
Fontaines à eau dispos à chaque étage
Un corner café / thé à volonté dispo au lobby
Possibilité de laisser ses bagages à l'accueil le jour du départ voire faire un late check out ($).
Machine et sèche linge dispo au 12eme, gratuitement, voir avec l'accueil. Trop pratique.

title: Great views and clean room!
text: This was a quick 2 day stay in NYC for a comedy show and to see the 9/11 Memorial and Museum. My original hotel reservation for a different hotel chain was cancelled and this hotel was comparable in price. It was wonderful and I’m glad my original hotel cancelled the reservation. The hotel is able to hold your luggage before check in which was great as we got there at 10am. Very pleasant staff no matter what time of day. Reusable water bottles and the coffee machine was a great touch. The views were outstanding. Our twin room was clean and the bathroom was nice but not quite as new/updated. Only negative is that the front desk staff did not inform us on how to use the elevators as you have to hold the hotel key up against the scanner and then pick the floor you want. I would definitely stay here adding!

title: Great experience
text: Great experience. My highlight was customer service. All the staff I met and had the pleasure of speaking to were lovely and so helpful.
