They always had a smile on their face, made me laugh, and were really a pleasure to speak to. Along with the service, I appreciated the amenities (lots of outlets, stovetop, microwave, and more). The business and refreshment area was really useful for me as well. I would stay here again.

title: Thank you
text: The hotel is located in a very central area where you have a place to go for cafes, restaurants and subway stations.. Excellent attention from staff, cleanliness and comfort in all areas thank you!…..

title: Second time here
text: This is an excellent hotel with great prices. Nice rooms right at Ground Zero, which is the new hotspot in New York close to all the train lines. You need to go anywhere on the MTA. The staff is friendly. You’re a great restaurants right around it and you’re looking at the world trade center what could be wrong with that?

title: Excelente
text: De los mejores hoteles en Nueva York, excelente lugar, limpieza, ubicacion, recomendable al 100%, habitación agradable y cómoda cuenta con cocina integral, me encantó la vista del piso 20, súper cerca del 9/11 y Battery Park

title: Poor customer service and overall stay
text: Good location but very poor customer service especially if you are staying with a family. The front desk is rude and do not care about you or your experience. I do not recommend them to anyone. If you choose to stay with them then be prepared to be treated badly.

title: Amazing place to stay!
text:
Absolutely amazing hotel if you wanna see NYC. Location right next to WTC monument makes it so comfortable to have one of the most visiting place literally 2 minutes walk from your hotel. If you wanna visit Statue of Liberty + Ellis Island - its about 10 minutes by walk + you have several metro stations right around the hotel. Rooms were clean and new, bit noisy but NYC does not know how to be quiet ;) ...there is a gym, nice view from 20th floor and service at reception was without an issue as well.
Highly recommended place from my side.

title: Clean, great location, nicest staff
text: Room was clean and spacy for Manhattan (king bed room). Nice and funny staff. Free water, restaurants near by, lovely rooftop bar with snacks. Nothing to complain. Cheap compared to orher Manhattan rat holes.

title: Highly recommend
text: I highly recommend this hotel! I love the location. The staff was great. I will definitely return. I had the room with the terrace which was amazing! I’m surprised this hotel was not more expensive. The only negative was the carpet had stains but that was minor.

title: Excellent stay
text: Stayed for 4 nights and very satisfied with this hotel rooms a bit small bit this is normal for ny water machines on every floor was great and tea coffee in the lobby was also very handy when heading out in the morning..close to the subway and would definitely stay here again when I return to the city

title: Just right
text:
Great spot, excellent service, heavenly beds, clean and cool room.  I got upgraded when I arrived to  a king bed with a view directly if the memorial.  The view of the memorial cannot be beat.  Everyone was super friendly.

Lobby has free good coffee from a machine, espresso etc.

The room was super clean and had two tvs, one in the living room and one in the bedroom, easy to work and well run temp controls.

Bathroom offered just what you needed but was clean and updated.

I walked for three miles and hit Little Italy, Chinatown, SoHo and walked back all along the water with gorgeous views.

Highly recommend, great price

title: Overrated and strange service
text: Not a good experience overall and personally I don't get the rave reviews on tripadvisor. When I arrived I requested a kingbed instead of two beds and the receptionist very kindly told me he found me a good room with a free upgrade. Unfortunately - it turned out that this was a FREE DOWNGRADE as the room was 2/3 of the size I booked and paid for. To get a room properly cleaned is a performance; I asked for daily cleaning when I checked in, but no-one seems to have taken any notice or registered my request, without daily chasing -no cleaning. Big TV good, very limited channels - bad. Highlight was the coffee machine in the lounge, overall not a good experience.

title: Underrated - It is amazing
text: We were not sure where to stay during our vacation to New York. Traveling with an autistic child, you have to consider levels of noise, crowds, etc. After lots of research, we decided that staying in the WTC area would be our best bet so we booked a 1-bedroom suite in this hotel. Honestly, I think the hotel is underrated. I didn't see many reviews that reflected the OUTSTANDING level of service from staff: friendly, supportive, and, in our case, very understanding and accommodating to our child's needs.  Additionally, the hotel is very modern, clean, you find water dispensers everywhere. It is walking distance to  A LOT of attractions (Brooklyn Bridge, Battery Park, Wall District), plus all the WTC memorials, a shopping mall, and a subway station that has all the lines to take you every where. It was an amazing experience and I think it all started with the support from the staff in the check-in desk (Rajiv and Adonis) who were supportive and understood our need for a more isolated location and lots of privacy during our stay. I highly recommend it!

title: Great stay
text:
We stayed here for 6 nights in a double double room. Beds super comfy. If I had to be particularly picky, the bed for 2 sharing was a little small. Rooms could take a bigger bed for couples sharing. Room was clean and we had a fridge, microwave and we asked for a kettle which was brought straight to the room. Free coffee and water to guests which is a great touch. Free guest laundry on 12th floor but you need to book a slot with reception.   

Hotel within easy walking distance of several subway stations. Great diner called George’s a 2-3 minute walk away, O’haras pub over the road and plenty other eateries from steak to McDonald’s or Burger King within easy reach.  5 minutes to 9/11 memorial pools and the Oculus shopping centre. Thee is a 7/11 nearby and a target.

title: Excelente localização
text: Próxima de várias atrações e de estações do metro, facilmente se conseguia chegar ao destino escolhido. Zona muito segura com vários restaurantes e roulottes de rua para tomar uma refeição. Quartos confortáveis e com bom sinal de Wi-Fi. A limpeza não é feita todos os dias, a menos que o solicitem.

title: Great hotel near WTC and lots of transportation options
text: Highly recommend!! Took a quick, 2-day trip to the city with my teen daughter and this hotel turned out to be perfect for us. We stayed in a room with two twin beds and not only was the room much more spacious than other city rooms I’ve stayed in, it was clean, the beds were *super* comfy, and we had an awesome view. Floor to ceiling windows made the room feel more open and also provided a wonderful view of the cityscape. The location was great: lots of subway choices within a few blocks and also various restaurants nearby. The best perk about this hotel was the coffee/tea/water station in the lobby. Free, refillable bottles for purified water; variety of tea choices; regular coffee and also an automatic espresso machine. We stopped there each morning and evening! The lobby also has a lot of seating with various comfy chairs and little alcove areas. There is a bar/terrace on the 20th floor but we never made it there; however, I bet the view is awesome. The staff at check-in and check out was very friendly and professional and it was super easy to leave our bags in storage for the afternoon so we could venture around the city after checkout. Highly recommend and will definitely be staying here again!!

title: 1st time visitors
text: The hotel is very secure, employees were very friendly and helpful even when you have to text message them in the middle of the night to ask a question. Wonderful views, very close to the subway and many attractions. We will definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent!
text: I love the room, just enough for a couple staying a few nights! Great restaurants nearby! The view is great since they had wall size windows as was shown on the picture. I just wish we had the view of the 1 World Trade Center building, but it was a nice room, with comfortable bedding, pillow, towels, room temperature which was easy to control. It’s just the coffee maker didn’t work, but that’s not a big deal. Lobby had coffee machines, small lounge. And the 20th had great view of the World Trade Center. I had a great time with my wife.

title: Great place, staff doesn’t fulfill needs
text: My wife is pregnant and she wanted 2 pillows and a blanket, we asked 5 times over 3 days. That’s just embarrassing. And when they finally brought it we actually had to call again because the guy said if it’s not there in 5 minutes calll him. And guess what…. It never came. Crazy I know. Other than that I was a good clean decent hotel.

title: Husband's 55th Birthday Weekend
text:
We were wonderfully accommodated and assisted. The staff wqs superb, professional and kind. They went above and beyond, thus making our stay a lovely one. The room was decently sized and pleasant. The bed was comfortable. We didn't need to use the sleeper sofa. There were several amenities and other conveniences. There's a lot of excellent food nearby. Morton's, The Steakhouse is attached to and can be entered through the hotel. Other food spots are on the corner or a few blocks away and delivery from any cuisine is delivered quickly. The rooftop bar has one of the best panoramic views in the city. The bar has tapas. It would be nice to get a little more.  Breakfast, even something simple, possibly to go and dine-in would be great too. The space is delightful and the service was on point.
I requested a late checkout and it was granted quickly, with no problem. The stay was quite enjoyable and exceeded our expectations.

title: Buona struttura
text:
Buona struttura in un ottima posizione strategica.  Le camere sono confortevoli, pulite e funzionali. A parere mio,  mancano un paio di prese USB pove so può mettere in carica i propri dispositivi elettronici senza dover avere con sé mille adattatori.
Il personale è molto cordiale

title: Wrong hotel for the location
text: Once you enter the room/suite, it looks nice, but as soon as you sit, you will start noticing lack of clean couch, dirty desk, dirty coffee mug, kitchenette with no cookware, and no internet TV 😨. I am not impressed at all considering the hotel is closed to the financial district and the river, and steps from the WTC. I’m on my usual business trip and staying in a suite, but I will not stay at this hotel again.

title: Comfortable & welcoming
text: Room had a nice view and staff were very friendly! 20th floor had a rooftop patio and indoor lounge area with a beautiful view. I assume it’s a shared building along with Club Quarters with the same staff and amenities so that confused me a little but not an issue at all. Really nice experience, would definitely come back

title: CQ WTC
text: Great hotel and great views. Easy to move around the city via subway, cab, ferry, etc. I’ve stayed here a dozen+ times and enjoy it. Nice restaurants that are close and nice to be out of the midtown hustle.

title: Vacaciones en Manhattan NY
text: Viajamos a Manhattan para ver las amenidades de distracción, buen comer y lugares para comprar que el área ofrece. Seleccionamos este Hotel (tercera vez) por su localización, limpieza y seguridad que nos brinda. La presencia de agentes de orden público es extrema y nos permite salir sin temores y seguridad. Los empleados son amables y dispuestos a asistirnos para hacer de las vacaciones algo inolvidable. Si regresaré para que mis hijas  disfruten de esta área en un futuro no muy lejano.

title: THANK YOU
text:
I stayed last week with my sister. Had a great time. Staff so nice and friendly, the location (WTC) better impossible. Complimentary coffee at lobby and water in each floor is a huge bonus. The room and cleaniness absolutely perfect.
The only thing you can improve is to get a small fridge in the room. Other than that, I regret not hearing of this place before!!
I hope to come back to this hotel in my next trip to NYC.
Regards.

title: Great place
text: Great staff from check in to cleaning crew , everyone is always pleasant when we stay here , they are the reason we continue to stay at World Center Hotel and Club Quarters . We also recommended this place to friends and family

title: NICE AND FRIENDLY
text: Very nice and close to shopping and food and the world trade just a few steps front desk was nice and generous also fast with check in experience was great at this hotel would stay again balcony view was amazing and the restraunt on the 20th floor was nice aswell

title: Vacation
text: Absolutely great front desk staff! Great place to stay! Very convenient to any and all transportation. Room was very nice and squared away. Again, can not say enough about staff and front desk personnel.

title: Fine Property
text: A fine choice for the experienced NYC Traveler. The hotel is a business person's venue.  The location is a bit odd if you don't know the neighborhood, but the staff and facility is top tier. Don't expect room service or creature comforts.

title: Mr Kevin Jasper
text: Club Quarters was my best hotel stay ever. The amenities were perfect,staff were wonderful, room very comfortable (I slept like a baby, location awesome. I look forward to staying there from now on visiting NYC.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: I recommend this hotel to anyone staying in New York City for short or long term. Complimentary coffee in the lobby at all times, clean, and a wonderful staff to assist with any needs. The view from the room and the upstairs bar was incredible, with a great proximity to the Rector St. Oculus, WTC, and Fulton St. subway stations.

title: Poor service, useless WiFi
text: I’ve stayed on other CQ properties before and had no issues, but this time, the delays in being able to access my room along with total staff indifference and lack of apology to be frustrating and unacceptable. The WiFi, on the rare occasions when I could connect, was completely inadequate, even for simple tasks like checking email.

title: Nice View
text:
I had a nice weekend at the hotel in general.

Only thing I didn’t  like was the fact there was not towel for body in the bathroom, just for hands and face.

Definitely would come back but I would ask for more towels.

title: Terrific Stay
text:
Great hotel that sits adjacent to World Trade Center.  Easy access to Brookfield / PATH and Subway.

Hotel has a small fitness facility that we used daily, one bike, three treadmills an elliptical as well weights and a floor mat.  Small but got the job done

Coffee and water always available in the lobby as well as the hallways with takeaway bottles was convenient.

There is a rooftop bar we did not have time to use

Room 520 is a narrow but decently long corner room that has a desk, microwave, fridge, keuirg and kitchen sink.  Bathroom has a standup shower bathroom.

Overall very clean and reasonable priced would stay here again.

title: Great hotel with great facilities
text:
We stayed for 4 nights and everything was fantastic. Staff were very friendly and helpful, clean and fantastic room, free coffee and water bottles...
100% recommended. I would stay again if I ever travel back to NY

title: Extremely recommended!!
text: Great location!! Friendly staff, clean hotel with great views and a sun terrace to hang out. Easy access to subway and touristic attractions. Bars, restaurants and shops nearby. Coffee and water 24hrs.

title: Súper ubicación pero falto limpieza y atencion
text: Una muy buena ubicación con habitaciones súper lindas y la mejor vista posible. Lamentablemente la habitación no estaba muy limpia y no la limpiaron en los dos dias que estuvimos. Tampoco tendieron el sofá aunque fuimos 3 personas y solo había una cama doble.

title: If you love being ignored this is the hotel for you!
text:
The staff is highly unprofessional. They barely say Hi or greet anyone but they do happily go on about their personal lives to one another as you wait for their attention or walk by. They don’t smile to guests.
No explanations were given on anything. The wifi, breakfast or lack of for that matter, how the elevators work, no information on the neighbourhood, checkout, the deposit policy… nothing whatsoever. I listened to 4 other check ins to make sure it wasn’t just me.
“Hi. Name ? Card for a 100$ deposit. How many key cards? Room number is …” They ignore your request I asked to be away from families because I needed to rest. I flew here to see a specialist to get another opinion on my options. They put me by a family. Yay!
They will not even fake try making you feel at home or welcome. I spent 40 hours travelling to get there, 2 flights cancelled, 1 delayed, a missed connection, I arrived completely worn out and they made me feel even worse.

The TV was se t to wake up someone called James Witt at 5.45 am. It kept turning itself on no matter how many times I turned it off. The plug outlet is embedded in the wall so there was no way of forcefully shutting it down. No one came to fix it until 10 am. I received no apologies from anyone. I called and came down to ask for help and they kept telling me to wait in the room for the technician. Absolutely ruined my morning.
A/C does not stop blasting cool air until the temperature reaches 60°F. No way of turning it off either. You can set it to your preferred temperature and then it will keep turning on again and again loudly to blow warm air onto you.
Oh and you have to pay a deposit again even if you’re staying in the same room. And they say they will release the money after 7 to 30 days because that’s all we need, leaving money at a stupid hotel for ages. Most ridiculously stupid system I have ever heard of.
The bathrooms are disappointing, shower curtains are only okay at home or in a hostel. The carpet had more stains than I could count. 
The gym is in shambles, the peloton bike looks like it was found in the streets.
And last saddening detail they never ever switch off the lights in the hallway. Yes, they aren’t windows in the halls but motion detectors do exist. So you will have a lovely ray of artificial sunlight pouring in from under your door all night long. Saving Earth ? Why?
Finally they do not refund you or agree to rearrange your booking when your flight is cancelled or delayed unless you let them know at least 24 hours in advance which is pretty much impossible. So do not ever book a first night with them unless you love wasting money.
I am a generous tipper but I will not be leaving a penny this time.
Will not come back again. I do absolutely not recommend.

title: BROWN DIRTY SHOWER - NO COMMENT FROM THE RECEPTION
text: I was taking a shower in the morning & after 1minute the water gets brown & dirty. After I told that the receptionist, they didn’t do anything to solve the issue. Also the shower ist sometime not working anyway, so if you want to stay in New York & want to have shower - keep aware.

title: Awesome hotel in NYC
text: This hotel was amazing - great location and views, comfortable rooms. The staff were always friendly and helpful. The complimentary coffee, tea, and water bottles in the lobby were a nice surprise and every hotel should have these. The rooftop bar was also great and overlooks the 9/11 memorial fountains and WTC. Highly recommend!

title: Great location
text: Very pleased with our room and great views. The room was a good size in general with a nice shower room. 2 tv’s one in the bedroom and one in the sitting area. The tv reception wasn’t the greatest, but we wasn’t there really to watch tv. Overall a pleasant stay and I would consider returning as located in a good position and easy walking distance of most things.

title: Perfekter Blick auf WTC / Zimmer fehlte der Charme
text:
Wir haben 3 gute Tage im Club Quarters Grand Central verbracht.

Empfangen von sehr freundlichen Mitarbeitern verlief der Check-In ohne Probleme. Sehr angenehm empfanden wir auch die Mails vom Hotel vor unserer Ankunft. Unsere Ankunft im Club Quarters war exakt um Mitternacht. Man war bestens auf uns vorbereitet.
Die Aussicht war sehr schön. Nicht nur auf das WTC, sondern auch auf die Umgebung.

Die Einrichtung war nicht nach unserem Geschmack. Irgendetwas fehlte dem Zimmer. Vielleicht kommt das auch durch die schlauchförmige Ausrichtung. Das Sofa ist nicht mehr vorzeigenswert. Wir hatten das ausgeklappt und ganz schnell wieder zugeklappt. So richtig wohlgefühlt hatten wir uns nicht im Zimmer.

Von den anderen Hotelgästen bekam man dann etwas mit, wenn die Türen zugemacht wurden / ins Schloss fielen. Wichtig auch Hinweis, dass der Zimmerservice nur auf Wunsch des Gastes durchgeführt wird (was uns nicht störte).

Der 24/7 Service für Kaffee und Tee ist super und ja, diesen Kaffee kann man trinken.
In der 20. Etage gibt es leckere Cocktails zu vernünftigen Preisen und eine schöne Aussicht (gerade am Abend). Die Erinnerung an die 20. Etage nehmen wir gerne mit.

title: Don’t stay here
text: I am an executive that travels extensively. I’ve never stayed in a worse hotel. Upon entering my room, the sheets and towels were dirty, I then went to put my clothes away in the closet, and there was a water bottle full of urine, yes, I said urine, They then put me in another room and the sheets had blood on them and the bath was filthy and towels had stains. Absolutely the worst hotel I’ve stayed at in NYC. Don’t stay there.

title: Leisure week away
text:
Great location for lower Manhattan sightseeing and easy to get to the subway to travel uptown. Clean, good value, large room, free coffee, tea bags, carbonated and still filtered water and water bottles was great to have.  We were very pleased with the city view from our room, and if coming back to NYC in the future we would definitely consider staying here again. 
Only real complaint was that the air con system seemed very noisy, but we got used to it after a couple of nights.

title: Great location in FIDI, personal travel - 8 nights
text: Very clean and efficient hotel located directly south of the World Trade Center Memorials.  Rooms are not large, but very nice, clean . . you need to request daily cleaning if desired.  Great espresso machine in the lobby and K-cup machine in your room.  My only issue is that not all the listed tv channels do not work, had to watch the World Cup in Spanish as the English channel while listed did not work.

title: Great value for money hotel
text: I chose this hotel based on the solid reviews and the decent per-night price. I was not disappointed, the location is great for downtown, only 5 minutes from the nearest Subway stop. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. Room was average and the hotel in general is a bit tired looking, but you get what you pay for! Free drinks is a great bonus.

title: Assez bien placé, hôtel correct, une bonne adresse
text:
1ère venue dans cet hôtel : personnel le jour de l'accueil très sympathique et souriant, les autres agents les autres jours un peu moins. Chambres de l'appart hôtel de taille moyenne et bien isolées, cafetière/four micro-ondes ok mais pas de vaisselle (à demander à l'accueil), oubli de fourniture du linge pour le 2nd lit pliant et des cheveux trouvés sur la moquette+poussière. Lobby avec café/thé eau plate et gazeuse à volonté, à noter la possibilité de se faire des bouteilles d'eau plate ou gazeuse à emporter (plastique), quelques pannes d'ascenseur en 7 jours. Pas de prise USB dans les chambres (prévoir l'adaptateur donc) - Très bien placé à 3mn à pied de l'esplanade du World Trade Center mais à peine éloigné de l'activité Manhattan - Remboursement de la caution rapide (1 semaine), rooftop juste utilisé pour faire des photos mais vue plongeante sur le WTC.
Ça reste quand même une bonne expérience. Merci.

title: Good location, minimum service, no cleaning
text: Stayed here for 4 nights in September. About 10 minutes walk to the main subway stations so easy to get around. I request room service several times during the stay, they never came once. When it came time to retrieve my luggage during check out, after leaving it there in the morning, I waited almost twenty minutes for someone to help me, causing me to miss my train to Newark and having to take a taxi.  The front desk won’t help you with your luggage, they make you go to the back and wait for someone else to retrieve the luggage for you.

title: Nous, on s'y est beaucoup plu
text:
Oui, il y a des choses qui n'allaient pas : le chauffage qui fait du bruit quand il se met en route, le ménage tous les 3 jours (en mettant 2 serviettes propres au lieu de 4), pas de nouveaux savons, shampoings, confort canapé lit bien pour un ado seulement.
Mais, il suffit juste de demander ce qu'il manque, et on vous le donne sans souci.
Murs pas très bien insonorisés mais les boules quies fonctionnent bien.
Un superbe emplacement : devant le musée du 9 septembre. Proche du métro. Situation géographique géniale, dans un quartier propre, tranquille et safe.
Avions une chambre suite (1 lit double, coin "cuisine" et une pièce pour canapé lit).
Hôtel, draps et serviettes de toilette, Salle de Bain, coin "cuisine", moquette très propres. Bon accueil, machines à laver et à sécher le linge et lessive à disposition et gratuites sur réservation.
Boissons chaudes, eaux pétillante et non gazeuse à dispo dans le lobby H24.
Donc, oui il y a des choses qui peuvent déranger mais franchement, un bon rapport qualité prix pour New York. Sachant que c'était pendant les vacances françaises, que le dollar est cher et que New York est cher !
Pour avoir fait des heures de recherches et comparer plusieurs hôtels/géographie/etc, nous ne sommes pas du tout déçus même si encore une fois, et bien oui, il y a des petites choses qui ne vont pas.
Est-ce grave ?

title: Parfait
text: Très bel hôtel avec des jolies chambre et une belle vue (surtout sur le toit)! Une salle de sport est à disposition , il est situé près de locculus et juste à côté du wtc , je le recommande vraiment !!

title: Attractively priced but in need of TLC
text:
Attractively priced hotel near WTC but with limited amenities and in need of TLC. 
The prices are good for the location but the rooms would benefit from a refresh and solid clean. Hotel exterior and the windows also need care. 
What you see on the website is not what you get. Only premium rooms are shown on the website while most don’t have the advertised amenities. 
Hot drinks in the lobby and reusable water bottles are a very nice touch.

title: Great Stay
text: Very good experience from quick checkin, fast elevators, nice room, friendly staff. They have a lovely rooftop patio. The bed was very comfortable and the room had a Keurig and small fridge. Very nice location steps from the WTC Memorial.

title: Posto perfetto per visitare Downtown Manhattan
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato 5 giorni in una Double Room al 17esimo piano. Location perfetta per visitare downtown Manhattan e molto vicina alla metro 1 per visitare Uptown (pochi minuti di metro) ed il resto della città.

Camera spaziosa, ben arredata, letti molto comodi. Grande vetrata con magnifica vista sui grattacieli di Downtown. Se potete chiedete una stanza con vista sul World Trade Center Memorial.

Le pulizie non vengono eseguite tutti i giorni, ma se chiedete alla reception verranno fatte. Colazione non inclusa, nei dintorni ci sono un paio di Starbucks ed altri posti in cui si può fare la colazione. Di fianco alla reception c'è uno spazio bar con acqua (con bottiglie di plastica a disposizione dei clienti), caffè e tè gratuiti. Prezzi nella media di Manhattan, quindi alti. Consigliato.

title: Never again. It's the worst hotel I've ever been to.
text: The worst hotel I've been in my whole life. I stayed there for 7 nights. When I arrived at 8pm, they made me wait saying that they need to check my room before I move in (why, I don't know). 15-20 minutes later, I asked what's going on, they said all good and gave me room keys. I came in, unpacked then it turned out that the aircon wasn't working. So, they moved me to another room. Then, I found out that TV remote wasn't working. They told me they'll fix it but they haven't. My clothes didn't arrive from wash and press on time. WiFi was patchy too. Overall, it was a nightmare. Whenever I raised any issue, I was told it'll be fixed but it never was.

title: Ottima posizione
text:
Buon albergo in un ottima posizione. 
Stanze piccoline, funzionali e pulite.
Per essere in centro a NY anche abbastanza tranquillo a livello di rumori. 
Il personale è molto cordiale.
Questa struttura si trova in una posizione ottimale, a due passi dal World trade centre.

title: Not bad at all!!!
text: The hotel has great location but rooms has some rare smell 👃🏿, only water and coffe no snacks at all. No breakfast, was my first time in that hotel no body tell me how to manage the elevator and was very upset.

title: Comfortable hotel at Top location
text:
This hotel is well located in Downtown New York, right next to the 911 memorial. Lots of trains in the neighbourhood.

The room is small but cosy and clean. Microwave and refrigerator are provided in the room, which is very convenient.
Hotel also provide free water and coffee all day long.

Very friendly staff upon our checkin.

title: Hidden Gem in NYC
text: I lived in Battery Park City for 20 years recently moving down south.  CLUB QUARTERS on Washington St has become my home away from home when I’m back in town.  This hotel has everything you could possibly need and does it all with thought and simplicity. The rooms are small but perfect.  Exceptionally clean and well appointed.  The lobby is a plus with comfortable seating  and 24 hr coffee (this is NYC).   The extra bonus is the adorable rooftop with great views. The rooftop food service has not reopened yet on this visit since Covid but is due to open soon. Important as well their customer service is impeccable.  They go above and beyond.  Lastly but as important the location can not be beat! Water views , history, transportation, shopping you name it it’s all here. I highly recommend this hotel for couples families or  groups!

title: Great location
text: Ottima posizione, a 2min dalla fermata della metro Rector St e a market e ristoranti di ogni genere, staff impeccabile, sempre gentile e disponibile, la nostra camera era al 10° piano con un angolo cottura molto comodo, vista bellissima, molto apprezzabile il servizio lavanderia e la possibilità di prendere acqua gratis ad ogni piano

title: Rude  & lying receptionist
text: I was asked to provide a credit card when we arrived during check-in. The receptionist told me I had to deposit 130 $ with the hotel. As I have problems with my credit card, I offered to pay cash 130 $. The receptionist rejected it. When I asked why 130 $ money was worse than 130 $ on my credit card, he explained that actually, the hotel wanted more than 130$. When I asked why he lied to me in the first place, he didn't answer. Then I said I would like to get to my room as I had already paid for it. The answer was that I would not get the key to my room, and this was it. When I asked to speak to the manager, he told me he was the manager. Finally, when I asked for a person to whom the receptionist reports, he said he would be the following day, but he couldn't give me an exact time. As I was traveling with 10-year-old child, I gave him my problematic credit card, hoping that I would avoid problems and get a key in return. When I asked questions about the hotel, he ignored me and turned to the next guess. So I got a key, but I know nothing about the hotel, facilities etc. "Great service". I regret I made that choice.

title: Vacation
text:
Clean, free drinking water, very helpful personal
Location is very central to One World Center, Ground Zero and oculus. Lot of restaurants and bars nearby and Hudson River in walking distance. Nice place to be

title: Reasonable cost for a great suite
text: My husband and I came to NYC with a good friend.  The suite was perfect!  We each had our own room, space and TV, but shared a bathroom, kitchenette (with fridge, sink, and microwave) and a table.  The space was spotless.  Beds comfortable and A/c worked so well.  They had free coffee in the lobby AND free filtered water.  All staff were professional and friendly.  Our views were fantastic!!  It was very very quiet.  It is very close to several subway lines.  The area has many coffee shops and restaurants within walking distance.  AND the price was excellentQ

title: Great stay
text: Recently stayed here for our family trip!! We had a great time, no issues checking in or out. Staff was friendly. They have coffee pit in the morning and a nice sitting lounge. Our rooms were clean and decent size.

title: Summer Visit to NYC
text: This is our fifth stay at the Club Quarters near the World Trade Center in Downtown Manhattan and each experience exceeds the last. The staff are amazing, especially Spencer at the front desk, and the location is unrivaled with regard to seeing all that New York has to offer. The rooms are well designed and the views from this hotel are breathtaking. There is no other hotel that we would consider staying at for our NY visits, which are frequent as I am a native New Yorker now living in Florida. When we stay here, I truly feel as if I am coming home. Our next trip to Club Quarters is already booked!!

title: Great Location, Views and Free Water
text:
This was our family vacation where we stayed for 8  nights. The hotels location was excellent and close to many amenities like aubway, pizza centers, amazonGo and Westfeild shopping center. I really like their free reusable water bottles.  We had a balcony which was great and the view was a bonus.

The Beds and Pilows were comfortable and we slept good. Staff were friendly and ready to help with our requests.

I used the downstairs working space and the rooftop area to work from the hotel for a couple of day and it was mostly quiet and I was able to focus and get work done. The rooftop views were amazing. 

The coffee bar had various teas and coffee - I really liked the lemon lift and espresso machine.

Great hotel to stay and work

title: Avoid rooms connected to lift core
text:
Hotel was nice and clean, great location for 3 day base in NY. Rooms on the small side but not really an issue. Didn't realise the rooms with a view required an upgraded fee, we booked with booking.com and this wasn't apparent as it wasn't an option.

We were in a room which shared a wall with the lifts and the noise from the lifts were ALL night. It was annoying and very disruptive to sleep.

title: Attention
text:
Ce qui n'est pas annoncé sur le site lorsque l'on réserve : il n'y a pas de service de chambre quotidien, l'hôtel n'accepte pas de cash et débite votre carte sans vous aviser, il n'y a pas de frigo dans les chambres simples, le personnel n'est pas aimable et ne réagit pas à vos réclamations.
Déçue. A éviter.

title: Great location
text: This was perfect for us. It’s not a luxury hotel so don’t expect frills but it was an absolutely perfect location - quiet, near many subway connections and right next to the 9/11 memorial which we had a view of from our window. Rooms are a decent size. There was no breakfast when we visited nor was the bar on the 20th floor open. It’s just a viewing platform up there albeit the view is great. Only coffee and water downstairs but we were recommended George’s round the corner for breakfast which was great. Good wifi. We only had one clean in 5 days but to be honest that’s fine for us. Get the feeling this hotel is still finding itself again after COVID but for location we thought it was a very good choice.

title: 30 year anniversary trip
text:
We had an excellent 7 night stay for our 30 year anniversary!  It was quiet, comfortable and near several metro stations. Our last stay was in Times Square so we definitely liked this area better! 

We booked a suite which was very spacious and had a beautiful view of the memorial pools and downtown Manhattan. I thought the bed was going to be too soft but it was dreamy. We slept well every night. 
Staff was super helpful and friendly especially Spencer. 

We’ve traveled a lot during and after Covid so the lack of room cleaning is a norm now. I don’t personally mind because I don’t need them in my room every day. I texted every morning for clean towels and coffee refills and they were there within 20 minutes each time. 

The rooftop terrace was very enjoyable.  We took our own wine up but having the bar open would have been very nice. 

We would definitely return.

title: Superb location but disappointing services
text:
The hotel is very well located (great view of the Memorial), the rooms well equipped and the staff friendly.
But the services are totally lacking (self check in/out, cleaning and coffree refill only on the 3rd day, no breakfast due to Covid - a bit of an outdated reason) and we did not get the room we had requested although we booked it 5 months in advance: instead of twin beds, we had 1 standard bed and 1 sofa bed that we had to unfold and make ourselves after we had requested the sheets. We were told we got an upgraded room...

title: Spacious room but poor services
text: My wife and I stayed at the Club Quarters World Trade Center for 6 nights in late-June. The room was spacious with a balcony, and the location is superb, convenient to all downtown attractions and easy access to all public transportations. However, the hotel’s service is to be desired. There is no daily room cleaning. It must be requested specifically. The lock of our balcony door was broken. We reported and maintenance was crew sent, twice, but cannot be fixed. Nothing happened since the second fix, no call from hotel staff, nothing. We also gave up in requesting fix. Therefore, for 6 nights, we were sleeping in the room with the balcony door unlocked. Fortunately, nothing happened.

title: Would stay again
text: It was great for our needs and better than expected. The location was on point, as our activities were mostly on this end of Manhattan. Check in is done at a kiosk in the lobby and you text staff if you have questions or needs during your stay. While other reviewers were put off by this, I liked it. I texted the front desk a few times and got quick responses. There were people at the front desk, too, and they were very friendly. Our room was a queen bed and a pull out sofa. The sofa bed was lumpy, but my kid didn’t mind. My other kid packed a sleeping bag and there was plenty of room to make a pallet on the floor. One of the reasons I booked this room over others was the square footage. This was the largest room I’ve stayed in in NYC. It also had two closets, two TVs, a fridge, and a microwave. The view from our corner room overlooked the Memorial Pools. We drove in, so I called ahead to ask about parking. The person at the front desk told me about a couple of options and gave pricing. We chose LAZ Battery Parking garage. It was an easy 5 minute walk to the hotel. The hotel does not have a restaurant or bar at this time, but there were many places that were very close. We wanted a quick breakfast and grabbed something at Cafe Bravo around the corner, a couple of mornings. Their breakfast sandwiches were really good. The 20th floor terraces are a great place to relax and enjoy the view. The wallpaper was peeling at the seems in a few places, but the room was clean. There were also water filling stations on each floor. I’d stay here again.

title: Good place to stay
text: The location was excellently, staf was nice, elevators are fast and you have tap water at every floor. Al 20th floor you have a great view but the bar is close there ( you must come with your drink). The metro is near.

title: Good location and nice view
text: Our room was spacious based on a NYC standard and quiet. Staff was friendly, and check-in and check-out was easy. Our bathroom had some long hairs on the floor, so that's the only reason for the four-star, not five-star rating. I would stay here again, and I would recommend the hotel to friends and family.

title: the right hotel in the right place!!
text: if you love downtown ,and do not mind traveling uptown ,this is a great place to stay!!! easy access to any subway station excellent views from the upper viewing decks.a lot of nice restaurants near by.

title: Spacious and comfortable
text: We were quite pleased with the amount of space, comfort and quiet room. Compared to other hotels in NYC it outshines all we have stayed in. The staff were efficient and knowledgeable. Having access to chilled water bottles was excellent.

title: Couldn't be worse!!!
text: My room was a sweat box with no way to control the ventilation or temperature.  I was told hotel staff needed to make the temperature adjustment.  After over 30 minutes, someone finally arrived to tell us that the AC was inoperable and no other rooms were available.  They said that they would send me a fan.  After four additional calls and over another half hour, they sent up a heater!  At this point I decided to shower to cool off-- only to discover I had two conditioners, no shampoo, and a drain that did not work properly.  I have spent over 48 hours trying to connect with Kevin Chen, the manager with the authority to issue me a refund.  I have left messages with staff and on his voice mail (multiple) to no avail.  The evening staff and the day staff (Sam) both agreed that the only way to right this situation was to issue me a refund, but that needs to come from Kevin Chen--- who has not connected with me.  I also explained my situation in a text to an automated customer service text (212-577-1133).  The automated text said it would like to resolve this; however, I have not heard from them again.  Is this a service industry?!  Not only did I have a horrific experience with my stay, the customer service has been equally deplorable.

title: Experience in One World WTC club quarter hotel
text: We arrived the Club Quarter Hotel in WTC Manhattan. Our experience has been delightful. We were attended by Marsha Ann  who checked us in, but also took her time to pamper us. She excelled in hospitality.

title: BEAUTIFUL NYC HOTEL
text:
An absolutely beautiful hotel,with outstanding staff, beautiful rooms right in the heart of the financial center
Close to the wonderful brookside mall with stunning views across the Hudson river to new Jersey. Also absolutely beautiful views from the hotels 20 floor viewing area
Also a huge thank you to Kevin who made us feel like kings during our stay when I'm in NYC this is the only hotel I stay in. A 4 STAR hotel with 5 STAR staff
Sincerely
Thomas and Nina Oconnor

title: Ótima localização e voltaria a me hospedar
text:
O hotel fica próximo ao memorial 9/11, One World Trade center e distrito financeiro o que já facilita conhecer um pouco dessa área e pontos turísticos facilmente. A vista é impecável e ainda tem terraço disponível aos hóspedes.
A água filtrada e gelada é cortesia e o café (café, leite com café e chá) também durante todo o dia. 
O hotel se preocupa muito com as questões de contato e Covid e por isso não há serviço de quarto (essa única parte negativa pois hoje em dia a maioria dos hotéis tem limpeza pelo menos).
Não tivemos uma boa recepção quando chegamos pois estávamos com muitas malas e ao pedir ajuda simplesmente mandaram pegar um carrinho no depósito (do tipo se vira). Mas a estadia num geral foi muito boa e o preço compensou. 
Por fim, havíamos pedido um quarto com vista e nos colocaram no 2° andar. Só depois de reclamar que mudaram nosso quarto.
Avaliando tudo, eu voltaria a me hospedar pelo custo benefício e localização.

title: Amazing hotel
text: Great room view of the 911 reflecting pool friendly stay at check in close to everything the view from the 20th floor deck was absolutely amazing we are definitely planning another trip to NY and staying at the world center/ club quarters hotel

title: Great location but POOR service
text:
We have recently returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. We had a wonderful time in New York but were somewhat disappointed by our experience at this hotel. 
It's location is great. It's in a really quiet area very close to World Trade Center and within walking distance of the Statue of Liberty. The hotel itself is modern and the facilities are good. We were mainly disappointed by the service received overall. 
After 15 hours or so of travelling through time zones we arrived to check in at around 5.00 pm (check in was 3.00pm). I could sense something was wrong as things seemed to be taking too long. It became apparent that rooms weren't ready. The hotel was 'at capacity' which confused me as surely we were part of this capacity? The receptionist suggested an hour wait which was totally unacceptable. After a discussion or two a room was found and we ended up waiting for around 15 minutes. During this time, and over the next day or so I witnessed many guests have the same issue and I'm pretty certain we didn't get the room we'd booked. 
Also, I've been to many city hotels so I'm aware that house keeping isn't always a given. But at this hotel you literally have to take your own 'trash' out and request clean towels or extra toilet roll (bit embarrassing). The hotel seems to suggest texting these requests? Confusing. Anyway, I had to ask reception 3 times for toilet roll and towels before I got any. I found little things like this and running out of coffee really annoying as life in New York is so fast paced. I expected better. 
Overall, we had a good stay and things could've been worse I guess. My advice would be to stay if you get a good price.

title: Highly recommend
text: Will repeat, great neighborhood, lots of security, clean, organized and accessible to restaurants and public transportation. The view of the World Trade Center is a plus. Last but not least a quiet, peaceful place to rest at night. Carlos PR

title: Great Stay
text: This was our second time staying here.The staff is pleasant,attentive and helpful.The rooms are clean and beds are comfortable.Location is great and close to many sites to see and enjoy. The 20 floor Terrace is a great spot to enjoy your breakfast with views to the 911 memorial fountains.Can't wait to come back in the fall again.

title: There are better hotels
text: I was not a fan of this hotel. It is maze-like, hard to find your room and hard to get the staff to help you if there is a problem. My key card didn’t work or wasn’t set up properly to have the elevator let me off at the right floor and it was really frustrating to have to keep going to the lobby to fix this. The bathroom was the size of a closet and the room was not great at temperature regulation, turning very hot and even after someone came to cool it off it did not work.

title: Wir kommen wieder!!!
text: Die Lage ist unschlagbar. Das Personal unglaublich freundlich, das Hotel ist sauber, man bekommt gratis Trinkflaschen mit Wasser in jedem Stockwerk. Die Dachterrasse ist atemberaubend, so eine Aussicht auf Ground Zero hat man nirgendwo. Wir kommen definitiv wieder!!! Danke für die wunderbare und unvergessliche Zeit!!

title: My team loved their stay!
text: I booked a block of rooms for a company event last week. Working with the sales and customer service team was easy. They were super communicative, professional, and helpful. While I didn't stay at Club Quarters myself, my team members who did stay there had nothing but good things to say. One notable point was that it seemed "new." That tells me that everything looked chic, clean, and worked right! I was also surprised at how inexpensive the rooms were, given its great location. Our team will definitely be staying here again for future events.

title: Great hotel in Financial District of Manhattan
text: This is my second time to stay in this hotel. The view overlooks the WTC. It is convenient to subways, attractions, restaurants. The room is spacious by NY standards. The bed very comfortable. The staff very helpful. The hotel immaculate.

title: Déçu
text:
Hôtel bien situé 
Face au mémorial , proche station de métro 
Mais chambre familiale très petite 
Un grand lit et un canapé lit pour 1 
Notre fils a dû dormir avec nous car impossibilité de mettre une ado et un enfant de 10 ans d’s canapé lit
Ménage pas fait de la semaine 
On vous donne des sacs poubelles et vous les mettez devant votre chambre 
Personnel hautain et pas aimable 
Globalement déçu 
Je ne le conseille pas

title: Hôtel très bien situé à taille humaine.
text: Hôtel très calme bien qu'il ne désemplisse pas. Plusieurs lignes de métro tout près et on peut aller prendre le ferry pour brooklyn en marchand environ 15 mn. Roof top sympa. Il faut savoir que le ménage n'est fait que sur demande.

title: Cheap and great location but TINY, not clean and beware reservation changes by staff
text: The good: for the location, the price is great. Bad: I booked a room for 3--one adult, 2 kids. Room was to have one queen bed and a chair that pulled out into a bed. Room only had a queen bed. When I went back to the front desk, they claimed I'd only reserved a room for one adult so was not supposed to have the pullout. When I showed I'd booked a room that clearly stated it was for 3 PEOPLE, yes one adult but 3 PEOPLE, they said they could give us a free upgrade but we'd have to remove our stuff from the first room and wait until housecleaning cleaned our new, upgraded room. When we returned to the hotel and were given our new room, it was NOT an upgrade, in fact, it was SMALLER than what I'd originally booked --tiny for 3 people--and on the same floor as the first room. Actually a DOWNGRADE from what I paid for.  Also, the toilet wouldn't flush well and had a nasty yellow ring around the edge of the seat.

title: Très bon choix !
text:
Personnel extrêmement agréable et aidant pour planifier nos visites. 
Localisation au top. Et surtout un endroit ouvert en permanence pour prendre un café et se connecter avec des iMacs, génial en plein jet lag!

title: PHENOMENAL CUSTOMER SERVICE
text: I have stayed at a ton of hotels, and I have never received better customer service than I did at this hotel. My best friend and I booked here for spring break as a little getaway. When we arrived our bank gave us a difficult time paying for our room. Spencer went above and beyond to help us. I work in customer service, and I wish I could take him home and hire him. He is a phenomenal asset to this hotels staff, when we were scared and worried he did everything he could to help us even though there were other clients he had to help in the meantime he did not give up on us. I have been to New York many times, and I’ve never experienced such a kind soul who is so willing to help others even when it is not his issue or the hotels issue. Spencer I send you the praise of a 1000 voices, you are the greatest employee I’ve ever encountered in a hotel. If you ever move to Georgia, find me for a job. I do want to mention the other staff working that day, while I spent most of my time with Spencer the other staff was amazing too. The allowed us to use their restroom and relax in the lobby while we waited for a bank confirmation. They were kind, and patient with us while we worked out our problem. Overall this is an amazing place that I highly recommend trying it out if you’re coming to NY. The location is wonderful, the staff is wonderful, I can’t speak highly enough about this place.

title: You won’t do better anywhere near the price point
text:
Intersects at the sweet spot of affordability and plush. I’ve stayed at many hotels in NYC previously for work including CQ and later stayed here for over a month waiting for my new apartment.  The hotel is well designed, modern and somewhat minimalist. 

everything  is  clean, and fairly cushy and the  views can’t be beat if you get a 9-11 memorial view room. Even if you don’t get one of those both  of the roof decks have  amazing views of both the  financial district and Brooklyn. 

the  staff is much more attentive and accommodating - a rarity in Manhattan - than any of the larger type chains. Arnold, at the front desk was awesome as is the manager Kevin.

title: Club Quarters WTC
text: I loved this hotel. Great to have some cupboards and a hob/fridge to prepare at least basic meals no cutlery or crockery but Duane Reed sorted that water and coffee on tap and of course the most fantastic location second stay here and no hesitation in coming back

title: AWFUL HOTEL!!!
text: Wouldn’t recommend to stay here at all. Room not cleaned at all over my week stay… covid seems to be an excuse to not clean any rooms in their building. Had to switch rooms twice… plus sockets broken, tv broken, window doesn’t close properly. Basically a broken room. 4 star standard was not met at all… 2 at best… but good luck trying to get explain the lack of quality to the staff

title: Disappointing
text:
Definitely not a 4 star hotel.
Room will not be cleaned before 4 nights of stay.
The “touch less” experience of checkout and check in, makes it a completely impersonal staff. Lacks in general maintenance.
Rooms are noisy and have unpleasant odors.

title: Best NYC hotel stay so far
text: We loved everything about this hotel. The location is excellent with the WTC, the Oculus, subway stations, shopping and restaurants all nearby. Our room was clean and comfortable and we loved the amenities especially the rooftop lounge and terraces. The staff members were friendly and accommodating. We’ve stayed in several NYC hotels and this has by far been our favorite.

title: Get-away
text: My Family and I came to NY to visit the various museum and just to get away. The hotel was excellent, we will be visiting this particular hotel and trying other CQ's if every in another city or wherever one is. So I rated location average because I like to unload and park in the hotel parking. This hotel doesn't offer parking and the one they refer you to is about 2 blocks away not very far but a inconvenience for my family and I because I was the other adult with 4 minor children. So, of course I didn't want a ticket and couldn't leave them in the hotel while I park.  But that was the only issue.  Staff friendly and actually smiled and the smile was genuine.

title: less than mediocre CQ hotel
text:
Unfortunately had to stay on business twice at this hotel within the last 3 weeks.
The first time I was assigned room #1617, which has the size of a broom closet( not possible to open the suitcase without having to move the chair...). After huffing and puffing, the less than accomodating frontdesk staff changed it to a slightly bigger room.
This time ai was assigned a room, which was either still occupied or not cleaned yet.
After having contacted the, yet again less than accomodating, frontdesk, the clerk asked me why I went to that room? BECAUSE you gave me the key and the card with the number on it... again with a lot of huffing and puffing I got assigned a room on the 9th floor. BEWARE of floor 9, the entire corridor stinks of sewage, and when I asked the cleaner she confirmed that it always stank...
Not a hotel to recommend, rooms are very small, frontdesk staff are arrogant, hotel not very clean and service inconsistent

title: Excellent Hotel
text: I recently stayed here while visiting Pace University with my son.  The location was awesome, the views were amazing, and the staff was very polite and helpful.  I got the family room, it was a great size and the beds were very comfortable. I will be staying here for all my visits to Pace!

title: Excellent Stay
text: Staying for a prolonged period between apartments. Hotel is excellent, friendly staff and clean, comfortable rooms. Great location with bars, restaurants and three subways within a few blocks. Thoroughly recommended.

title: Unexpectedly good
text: I took an very inexpensive staycation for two days (I live in NYC -and got a very low rate for hotel week. Ha don idea how nice the hotel was - staff was great- 0 right near some great places to eat and Starbucks on corner - nice roof lounge. Spencer was great on front desk. I'd stay again

title: OUTSTANDING - as always!
text:
This is our hotel of choice when  we are visiting New York City from the United Kingdom.  We have stayed here many times now, and do not consider any other options when we are planning our trip to the Big Apple. 

Here’s what we like about the hotel:
1.  LOCATION:  It’s located in Lower Manhattan, and overlooks the National September 11 Memorial and Museum.  Rooms on the higher floors of the hotel will afford fine views of this national memorial, across to the soaring heights of the One World Tower.  We love this location as it’s a relatively calm and peaceful spot, away from the frenzy and noise of a Times Square Location.  It’s very close to a number of subway stations, and within  easy walking distance to many sights any visitor is likely to include on the sight-seeing itinerary:  Wall Street,  the Charging Bull sculpture, the Oculus, Battery Park (for ferries to the Statue of Liberty), Chinatown and Little Italy, the South Seaport complex, and the Brooklyn Bridge.  The rest of Manhattan is just a subway ride away.
2. ROOMS AND HOTEL FACILITIES:  The hotel offers extremely comfortable rooms at very reasonable prices.  It offers a variety of room options, including  cosy and compact club  rooms   for the budget-oriented  travellers, standard rooms offering a very good level of comfort, superior rooms (some have a terrace, others have a view of either the city or the National Memorial), and one-room suites with additional seating area and kitchen facilities including a sink, microwave and coffee maker.  Our room, on the 18th floor, was the latter type.  It was  very spacious, comfortable, very clean and fresh, and with superb views across the National Memorial to One World.  For all rooms, bottled spring water is available from dispensers near the rooms, as are ironing boards and irons.  In the bar area downstairs, a coffee machine provides hot drinks to hotel guests.  The hotel has good wifi for connectivity, and rooms have plenty of power sockets for charging devices.  When we stayed in December, COVID-safe procedures were being carefully followed; room servicing and change of towels were by request only; this was more than acceptable. Social-distancing was required, as was the wearing of masks in all public areas.  The doors to rooms had a COVID-safe sticker across the doorway to confirm to guests that the room had been serviced safely and correctly.  We felt very safe and secure here, during this difficult COVID period.   As expected, the hotel's 20th floor restaurant was not open, but there are a myriad of fabulous places to eat in the hotel's immediate vicinity.
3. THE STAFF;  We were warmly welcomed by check-in staff,  Such a welcome always creates a comforting feel to guests, ensuring that they are respected and cared for.  Customer Service Manager Kevin Chan was on hand to ensure that his operations team was working efficiently and smoothly, and to provide first hand information to his guests.  His knowledge of the local area, and of New York City in general, is outstanding.  If you need directions, help with restaurants, sightseeing, getting a COVID test, finding a spot for a late-night pizza, he is your person.  Thank you for the care and attention you gave us during our stay.

We will be back, without a shadow of a doubt.

title: great staff
text: The hotel is clean, convenient, and the staff is very helpful and very nice. The room is basic with everything you need. The room is not large but very compact and utile. I liked the set up.  The pet-friendly attitude was the best! We were very happy.

title: Overnight Stay
text: My husband, daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 1 night. The location in the financial district was ideal. We were able to walk to One World Observatory, the 9/11 museum and the Van Gogh experience with ease. The room was clean and comfortable. The view from the top floor was spectacular! The only negative was that the people staying in the room next to us were extremely loud in the middle of the night (opening and closing doors loudly several times and speaking loudly).

title: Average hotel with Excellent staff
text:
We stayed 2 nights in this hotel last October before our Bermuda cruise. We visited New York once before but stayed in upper Manhattan. We felt this location was quite and more convenient for us. 

The hotel was less than 200 m walking to 9/11 memorial museum and the World Trade Center. There are many cafes, restaurants and  supermarkets within walking distance. 

Our stander room was very small and basic with comfortable bed, and a  coffee machine. There were no safe or mini fridge which was very disappointing. The free wifi was fast and reliable . 

Bathroom was small and old but very clean and had all the amenities you need. 

The hotel was very clean, the daily house keeping service was stopped due to the pandemic but you can call the reception if you need anything.  Room service was stopped too but you can order food from a partner restaurant or other restaurants and collect your food from the reception when it reached. 

All the staff in the reception were excellent, helpful and very friendly.

title: Staff is rude and not worth the money. Go to a Holiday Inn instead.
text:
This place is not worth the price at all. Our new years eve family vacation at this location was a terrible idea. 

Runita is incredibly rude and treats guests poorly. Dawn was no help at all. They do not do daily housekeeping but their site says they do. iThe main staff are obviously disorganized and not prepared to deal with the amount of guests they receive. There is no coordination between them and it shows. regret choosing this place. 

The hotel smelled like weed and we communicated that security, but that did nothing. You're better off a holiday inn.

title: Great Place to Stay
text: Definitely like the hotel. location and staff. Always can get cup of coffee or tea. Wish there was a breakfast area with some fresh pastries , sandwiches and fruits. It is possible that COVID did change some things and more would have been available if not the COVID.

title: Not a four star hotel!!!
text:
Eneste positive er beliggenheden.

Receptionisterne er ubehøvlede.

Vi har 10 overnatninger, og er 2 voksne og en teenager på 16.

Opredningen er ikke egnet til en person over 10 år. Der var ikke redt op til 3. mand., da vi kom. Vi ringede  til receptionen og gjorde opmærksom herpå. Vi fik leveret dyne og lagen og måtte så selv gå i gang med opredningen. 

Her på 3. dag har vi fortsat ikke fået håndklæde til 3. mand.

Der er ingen rengøring. 

Vi skal selv tømme skrald. Der er ingen poser til toiletspand, og der er ingen toiletbørste.

Toiletartikler fyldes ikke op.

Vi har for at gøre det hele nemmere selv indkøbt toiletpapir.

Kaffemaskinen virker ikke.

Så alt i alt…. Beliggenheden er god, mens servicen er elendig.

Tænker, at man egentlig bare har lejet et værelse med bad, og det er det.

title: Nicely priced and very clean.
text: Our room at this hotel had splendid views of the 911 memorial. There is a floor to ceiling window, and part of it can be opened an inch or so, for some fresh air. Comfortable bed and very clean room and bathroom. The shower was great: good water pressure, and easy to control the temperature. Room has coffee/tea making facilities and a small fridge. No breakfast, but we enjoyed breakfast at George's, 5 minutes away. The rooftop lounge has great views, and evidently used to have a bar but they have closed the bar because of Covid. The "touchless entry" seemed a  bit strange to us (we are older people, in our 70s) but it worked fine: you put your credit card in the machine and the machine spits out a key for you and a receipt with the room number on it. Having said that, there are usually one or two people at the reception desk and they were helpful to us, by calling a taxi for us.  I would stay here again; we enjoyed it. Oh, and the room was reasonably spacious for New York.

title: Amazing Staff
text: First time to New York and a co-worker suggested Club Quarters in Manhattan. Perfect location. Rooms were small and simple. The staff was friendly and helpful. Runita, Dawn and Sam at the Front Desk were so nice and helpful. The staff made traveling to New York easy and memorable. Definitely staying here next time.

title: Unmittelbar am WTC
text: Jedenfalls zentral gelegen. Ein sauberes Hotel mit gepflegter Ausstattung und freien Trinkwasserautomaten. Näher zum WTC geht nicht und von der Terrasse auch herrlichen Blick darauf. Leider gibt es kein Zimmerservice, was wohl den üblicherweise kurzen Aufenthalt geschuldet ist

title: The perfect NYC hotel
text: Amazing stay. Affordable and luxury experience! Can't beat it! They have a 24/7 coffee and water/sparkling water on tap in the lobby. The rooms are a great size for the city. Highly recommend this hotel!

title: Amazing stay
text: Amazing hotel, staff was EXTREMELY helpful and knowledgeable about the area and where to eat. The room that I had was great with the microwave, refrigerator and stove. Very comfy for a NYC hotel which are normally small and cramped.

title: Not Worthy of 4 Stars
text: Check in experience was overall bad - took 3 hours to get a room. The room was pretty dirty - there were stains everywhere, it felt really old, and the shower curtain had red stains on it (pretty gross). It just felt like a stay at a 2 star hotel where you don’t feel comfortable walking barefoot through the room since you don’t know what might be there. Definitely not a 4 star hotel.

title: Excellent stay!
text: Definitely was satisfied with my stay at this hotel. Was checked in immediately and staff was extremely accommodating. The room was very clean, we had all of our needs met and any questions that we had were answered immediately.

title: Great Room with a perfect view of Trade Center Memorial
text: This was my second visit to the Club Quarters World Trade Center hotel. I plan to use this hotel for my bi-monthly trips to New York as the rooms are spotless and the views are great. Staff is very friendly and helpful also.

title: Second time is a charm!
text:
I am so thrilled that I returned to Club Quarters Wall Street. I first stayed here for 3 nights in late May. My visit was solid but with a few minor kinks. In fairness, the city was just reopening from Covid and the weather was horrendous (pouring rain and unusually cold). 

I returned for 3 more nights in October and WOW!!! The hotel hit it out of the park. First of all, I splurged on a family suite (2 adjoining rooms each with their own bath)  Having an exterior-facing room that faces East, North or South makes a huge difference. I love the floor to ceiling windows (they even open a crack for fresh air!). 

Club Quarters is not a luxury hotel but the location is excellent (one block from the 9/11 memorial and Oculus WTC - super convenient to the PATH station and access to NJ), the hotel feels modern and clean. It is a larger busy hotel that seems to attract groups and global travelers. The hotel has a comfortable lobby and two extraordinary rooftop terraces. 

I highly recommend this hotel for singles, couples,families and or groups. 

The bedding was very nice - crisp white sheets with a comforter and excellent pillows. Many rooms come with a mini fridge, sink and microwave oven. The shower is basic - I appreciate the hand-held feature. 

The rooms are very quiet. I was across from the elevator and could hear anything from the hall. The HVAC system is very quiet and easy to use. 

As of October 2021, due to continuing Covid restrictions, there is no daily housekeeping service. The staff goes out of their way to quickly send additional supplies as needed (clean towels, trash pickup, coffee refills, etc. )

I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to returning.

title: Just ok
text: Bathroom light had to be replaced twice.  Finally just replaced entire fixture.  TV went out 3 times.  The smell of marijuana was so overwhelming my first two nights there.  It was so awful.  That did get better my last two nights

title: Good value, excellent location at the WTC location.
text: Great hotel within easy walking distance to the 911 Memorial, Subway stations, the World Trade Center and the Oculus, (WTC) Train station and shopping center.  Also, check out Eataly. The hotel was clean with excellent service.

title: Big Apple Weekend
text: I travel a lot and this was my first stay at a Club Quarters. From making the reservation to checking in and through the entire stay my experience was exceptional. The staff was professional, and extremely friendly, ready to help in any way they could. The rooms were not huge but most certainly clean with amazing views. The location is adjacent to the 9/11 Memorial site is excellent if you want to be on the south end of Manhattan. Easing walking distance to Little Italy, China Town, and Battery Park. I would highly recommend this property for as a great property for a leisure trip.

title: Six Foot Tall, You Have A Problem
text: The World Trade Center Club Quarters earn a 5 star review in all aspects from location to service. The only problem encountered were the short twin beds.  If you are anywhere near 6 feet tall, you must curl up in a fetal position just not to fall off the mattress.   Perhaps a little longer twin would be appropriate?

title: Great spot for visiting the city, if you can subway.
text: Nice location, lovely staff. Pretty quiet, though the doors are in pairs so if the people in the other room are going in and out a lot you'll hear it. Every room seems to have a balcony, and again if people are out on theirs next door you'll know. But it was never a problem for us. In room dining is done through Butler, which they give you a qr code for, and it was pretty fast and pretty good quality. Lots of subway access nearby as well as shopping and dining options.

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: Can’t say enough great things about this hotel,  cleanliness, comfy bed, free purified water and sparkling water, kiosk or app check in and out, location, and cheaper than any other hotel I stayed at. Oh and the rooftop patio!

title: Tiny rooms and very humid bathrooms
text:
The rooms are the size of closets and the bathroom smells of humidity 
The noise from garbage trucks will wake you up at 5am 
The value is good so I guess you get what you pay for. 
If you have not eaten by 11pm, then you will be out of luck

title: Modern, sleek and inviting
text: Great stay!  Very modern efficient check-in and checkout.  Pleasant helpful staff, exceptionally comfortable bed, two water choices w/refillable bottles.  WINNING!!!  Great location downtown with steakhouse next door! Lots of shops and stores nearby for essentials and gifts.

title: Decent for a short stay
text: The hotel has 4 elevators but only three were working. If you are staying at the lower floors than it’ll take forever for the elevator to come because it literally goes all the way to 20th floor before going back down. It’s the same for all 3 functioning elevators. As for the room, it was really small unless you upgrade for a bigger size. The shower head pressure in room 1117 was really weak. Even the water pressure from the sink was stronger. The bed was a little short and I’m 5’8. If you’re taller, expect your feet or legs to be hanging out. One day, the elevator smelled like pee. Overall, I don’t think I’ll stay at this location again.

title: Best Little Hideout in Manhattan
text:
We are an older couple and this was our 2nd extended visit to CQ, at WTC. We were here to visit our wee Family who live around the corner so this location was excellent, so central to subway, Brookfield Place, the Oculus Hub/Westfield, supermarket, Parks, WTC etc The staff here are THE BEST, extremely helpful and always fun. The rooms so efficient and clean. Bottom line... this place is an utter treat. We will be rebookng next October. Thankyou Team 
With kind regards from two very,VERY satisfied Kiwi customers.

title: A memorable experince
text: As a first time visitor to NYC, staying at Club Quarters (WTC) is highly recommended as it's very close to the subway station (4 stops away from Penn Station if you're looking to travel to NJ or different boroughs of NYC), The staff is wonderful and welcoming and the rooms are very clean! I had also requested my hotel room to be facing the World Trade Center and the view did not disappoint! I would definitely stay at this location again!

title: Good location. Rude front staff worker (Spencer)
text:
Convenient location and well maintained. 

This review is primarily for Spencer (front desk employee) who found the need to come up all the way to the laundry room just to ask if i had a reserved time slot .  I said yes. Then he asked what my room number was. This felt unnecessary but apparently Soencer will ask everyone who uses the laundry here.

title: Very clean, Friendly staff, Close to Brookfield Place/Financial District
text: Rooms very clean, staff very friendly and helpful, and close to Brookfield place/financial district/world trade center office and shopping locations. They only require masks for unvaccinated guests, which I did not prefer, but staff wore masks and everything seemed to be cleaned thoroughly between stays to ensure COVID-safety.

title: Staycation
text: I live in New York City and decided to do a mini staycation with my family. It was great to experience the city as a tourist. The location of the hotel was perfect as you had access to everything. Very clean and comfortable. The decks are amazing!!!

title: Amazing!
text: The entire staff was very helpful and accommodating while my wife was recovering from surgery. They went above and beyond to fulfill any requests. Marsha-Ann, Kevin, Roger and so many more made us feel at home and cared for.

title: Club Quarters NY WTC
text: I stayed on an extended stay a month. I had been to Club Quarters World Trade  Center for work for short trips but already liked the hotel. But on an extended stay not to have one single issue is very rare. The staff was polite, accommodating and incredibly helpful. Providing soap for the clothes washer, an extra bed on the last day, or coming to a noisy neighbors to ask them to turn the volume down, very timely and politely was amazing. I had a great experience, and am impressed.

title: Great stay!
text: Decent sized room. Clean, has everything a hotel room should have. Friendly and helpful staff. Good location, close to financial district, two stations within 2 minutes walk. Liked the water fountain with reusable bottles and free coffee and tea.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Clean, convenient and comfortable with a friendly, attentive staff. Quite affordable, too.The hotel is easily reached by mass transit as there are several adjacent subway lines. It’s also a very short walk to the Hudson River with views of Statue of Liberty, the Oculus, and the Freedom Tower.

title: MUY BUENO
text: Estuvimos en junio 2021, la habitación tenía un  buen tamaño para 2 personas y contaba con una vista espectacular. El hotel cuenta con una terraza que te permite disfrutar de una vista hacia el World Trade Center. El hotel se encuentra en una ubicación que te permite movilizarte  sin problema alguno por cuanto a pocos pasos encuentras estación del metro El servicio muy bueno y la atención del personal muy cordial.

title: Gem hotel near WTC memorial
text: This was a great hotel within blocks to the WTC memorial and offered wonderful personal service while providing a safe, clear place to stay. They offered refillable bottles with chilled water readily available that helped survive NYC in summer

title: Over-promising & under-delivering
text: This place would be a 2.5, maybe 3, if they were more honest about the amenities and also what you actually get for upgrading a room.  I got a "superior" room with mini fridge and microwave, but it had a giant pole in the middle of the "living" room and an alley view. Nothing superior about it.  Also, they claim to have free laundry but you have to book it days in advance.  Yes, there's free water but you may have to go up or down a floor to find one that has cold water. Same with the tap in the living room, you can get sparkling water, but it's warm. The rooms also need a bit of TLC, my room had a few carpet stains and didn't look any where as modern as the photos on the website.

title: Nothing Special
text:
Locate two blocks from the reflecting pool, CG offers a mid-level convenient hotel.

Lobby – small desk with two video check-in terminals. Check-in process was painful. I checked in on-line the night before. I arrived and the on-line was not registered. Two more stops before I had the key and room assignment.

Elevators – two sets of two. Key required to activate the floor, but once the panel is activated you can go to any floor. Again, a major process failure with respect to security.

Room – Think euro-sized, small. King bed barely fits in the alcove near the window. I thought I would knock the TV off the wall each time I went to close the drapes. Desk, a closet, an ergonomic desk chair, a sitting chair, no safe. Bathroom on the same small scale, some hair products and two sets of towels. Small walk-in shower with a combo hand-held spray. Water pressure negligible. A/C loud as  a jet engine. A Keurig with a few K-cups. Very basic. On a positive note, the bed was extremely comfortable and the four pillows maintained their form the entire night.

Amenities – There is a coffee machine in the lobby that may have the world’s worse coffee. I am not sure how to describe how bad it is, take this as a do not even try it. 

Staff – They try to be friendly, but housekeeping is extremely snippy. 

Check-out – I did this on-line and it actually worked. They saved the best for last.

Overall, it was a try-for. It wants to be something, maybe a boutique-y Euro-spot, but it failed on so many levels.

title: Not Nearly as Good as Other Reviews Claim
text: We checked in for a 1-night stay before heading to JFK. The reviews posted in my opinion are way too complimentary. Our room, which I had upgraded to 2 twin beds for extra space was still very small, even by NYC standards. We have stayed in many NYC hotels over the years. Our window was a small sliver of glass tucked in a corner. The view (which others have  raved about) in our case overlooked the back of the adjacent Marriott's service area for deliveries and trash pickup. The reception area and hallways were tired and with little space to move.

title: Good hotel, good location.
text: Hotel is very clean and in a great location (right next door to World Trade Center) with a friendly staff. If you’re planning a visit to One World Observatory and/or the 9/11 Museum, definitely consider this hotel. There’s also a Starbucks next door as well. :)

title: Very nice location and stuffs
text: Me and my wife stayed at this hotel for two days. Very great location and well cleaned. We enjoyed our stay with great view of world Trade central. Definitely we will back. The stuffs are very very friendly and helpful. Overall my experience was very wonderful.

title: Wonderful hotel in NYC
