text: I always stay at Club Quarters when visiting NYC! This is my home away from home. Woudn't stay anywhere else, period. Wonderful views, great staff, cleanliness is impeccable, on the subway line, and near top restaurants and shopping. Cannot beat this location!

title: The Place to Stay Downtown
text: Great location and quality property in downtown. Hidden gem of the location is the overlook of the World Trade Center complex from top floor restaurant area. Rooms were clean and well appointed. Trip was a mix of work at the NYSE and tour of World Tarde Center.

title: Club Quarter Hotel, World Trade Center New York City.
text:
We enjoyed our stay with nice clean room, with great view of World Trade Center and Down town area. Specially thank you to the wonderful Friendly, Helpful Front desk staff and MASHA ANN the Manager.
Definitely we will keep coming back to stay here.

title: Very pleasant experience! Recommended.
text:
Great experience! Customer service is VERY good. I'm very satisfied with the service we received. The ladies and gentleman whom were in the front desk, were always willing to help, very polite and smiling. I felt very welcomed at all times. The rooms were cleaned. We only found a sock under the bed but not a big deal. The rest of the room was tidy and cleaned. Unfortunately no breakfast service offered at the moment due to the pandemic, however there are plenty options around to look for breakfast. 
We had a very good sleep, no issues at all. The beds were very comfortable and the A/C worked fine. The hotel deck is very nice and also, the hotel surroundings. A lot of security around also. I loved the fact that the hotel is pet friendly. I totally recommend it and will definitely stay here again.

title: The staff were really nice and helpful and nice.
text: Will stay again and again as the location was excellent in every way. The internet was a bit under the weather but then it served it’s purpose throughout my stay and don’t let me forget the fantastic staff. They are all very friendly and helpful.

title: Great experience at Club Quarters Hotel!!!
text: My experience was great. Check in and check out was very quick and easy. The room was in excellent clean condition. Very comfortable beds and excellent staff attention. I will definitely return!!! Love it

title: Location, Location, location!
text:
This hotel was more than what I expected.  First, it was right in the middle of the 911 Memorial.  I could see the future plot where tower 5 was going to be built right from my window.

The room was very clean and comfortable.  Also, the staff was friendly and helpful when we asked for great restaurants in the area.  She suggested a great place for breakfast and it was outstanding.

We were able to walk to fantastic sites:  Statue of Liberty viewing, Trinity Church, Wall Street and The 911 Memorial.

I highly recommend this hotel and a bonus is the 20th floor deck of this building for viewing the 911 reflection pools!

title: Excellent hotel
text: Fast check-in, nice room. Very comfortable mattresses, clean bed, great view from the window. Great relaxation on the terrace. Special thanks for the clean water. thanks to Marsha-Ann manager for help and patience.

title: Excellent
text:
I always wanted to stay this Club Quarters so I did at last! :)) We've stayed this hotel on May 22nd through 24th 2021. booked the room with kitchen sink microwave and refrigerator. 
Bit more price but It was worth it . The room was on the corner with big windows. 
loved it very much Cleanness, size of the room comfortable bed. Mattress was firm which I love it Bath room was big enough and yes clean!! 

The receptionist were very professional. It was busy many people were waiting for  either check in or for something else but they've managed it great! with smiles.
I have stayed at many hotel in NYC but so far this was the best. 
  
Only one thing .. an elevator! We had to wait for close to 7-8 minutes for elevator.
There were 3-4 elevators with high tech which is you just use your card key then lift takes you up to where your room is. Somehow an elevator was stop at 4th floor for more than several minutes then went up again instead of coming down to lobby .
Mean time we included other people were " Oh no! " lol with sigh .
It's probably from so called a computer grid or whatever call it.   Even machine makes mistake:):)    next day it was okay. 

Location was great for site seeing . eat out or for anything walk in distances. Yes it is safe!  

Over all it was great hotel. I highly recommended. 

Thank you for doing an excellent job!

title: Not so bad, but never again
text:
The hotel is in a very nice location minutes walk from the world trade center￼. 
Check in was very easy and smooth and actually the person who checked me in was pleasant￼
Accommodation  was already paid advance￼, 
For one day , The next day I came downstairs to inform them at the lobby that I Extended and￼ paid online for another one night￼ .
The front desk guy on that shift (named Arnold) asked me to put new hold on my card for this extra night (
Incidentals￼ )!
I explained Politely￼ that there is no need to do that because I already did that for the day before, and it doesn’t make any sense anyways because there’s no minibar in the room , basically there is nothing that I can consume.
And it was SHOCKING To hear his Hospitable feedback￼ ￼ 
“This is the rule and if you don’t like it you can find another hotel￼”!!!!!!!!!!!

Well I have no idea where that came from
BUT Thanks to Arnold’s  brilliant hospitality skills I moved to another hotel the next day￼.

It’s a Clean basic hotel but shocking caliber staff￼ (not all of them of course) ￼….

title: Do NOT stay here, stay anywhere else.
text:
I will never stay at this hotel again, especially after they refused to honor a refund after promising me to do so before I left the grounds. 

Firstly, when I checked into my room, the wifi did not work. When I told the front desk, they attempted to put the blame on me and my devices, but agreed to move me to another room. The TV did not work, the chromecast did not work. Not a great first impression, but things happen. 

They "upgraded" me to another room (one with a fridge). But funny thing, when I moved into the room, the fridge wasn't working. I told the staff, they said that they will check in the morning, which makes sense as it was a bit late, but that I'd be charged for having a nonworking fridge for the night. One of the wall outlets did not work, so they said to just move any machines that I needed to use to the one working wall socket. The TV here had the same issues with dropping chromecast, but at least the wifi worked in this room. 

There were fresh coffee stains left on the table and night stand, and one of the pillows smells strongly of axe body spray. I was able to wipe away the stains with a very quick hand wipe, which alarmed me that even the surfaced had not been wiped down whatsoever. The Keurig machine still had used pods inside. I felt so paranoid that this room hadn't been cleaned one bit and had to leave. 

I noticed that even though they "seal the doors" for cleanliness, but if you just open the door and close it, the seal doesn't break at all, it looks the exact same as if it were just put on the door. 

They DO NOT clean their rooms, and despite their "text concierge" assuring me that I wouldn't be charged the fee as I literally fled, they decided to back track the moment I followed up. Maybe some of the rooms are cleaned, but not in the room I stayed. I think the fact that they lied to me about refunding me was the worst part. They are not a trustworthy hotel. I cannot recommend this as a place to stay for anyone.

title: Zero hospitality
text:
So, one thing that I recently discovered while staying here is that you can call yourself a hotel + charge hotel prices but not offer housekeeping? Essentially, if you stay for less than 7 days, they will not clean your room. I found this so odd!

So we had multiple issues here. The TV did not work in our room, twice, so we moved three rooms. Apart from that, on check out, I left some items in the room by mistake which they could have easily informed me about rather than essentially keeping for themselves.

When I called them only a few hours later to ask why they didn't let me know, they were not bothered and seemed unaware that this had occurred. I had family staying in the same hotel who were also not contacted about this.

I've sent emails for the past week, and am yet to receive a reply from them. So, if you're doing a quick, short stay - this option is fine as it's got a decent location. However, if you expect any help from their end - I would suggest some place else!

title: All around winner for WTC area
text: We stayed at this hotel while our apartment was being moved. It was such a pleasure because the room with mini fridge and microwave had a good amount of space for myself, my fiancé and our dog. I was able to work during the day with no issues. Short walk to food and shopping at Brookfield. Or target/Whole Foods nearby. Everyone was beyond friendly and helpful. Anytime we needed more cups or tea bags, towels or sheets, it was only a phone call away. The front desk and building staff were all easy to talk to and made our experience so nice. We didn’t want to check out!

title: Never again.
text: Where do I start , well first thing when you get into the lobby it smells so bad and the workers there don’t acknowledge you unless you look like you don’t know what you are doing and then they told us to do check in on kiosk and continued to talk. And then when getting on the elevators many people were in the lobby trying to get on them but the policy is 2 people or 1 family but even with policy many people still got on with me and my husband with no mask or big families and workers in lobby never said anything. Ridiculous. Now everything was clean but it states that the room was to be cleaned every day but nobody ever came in our room to clean and it was very obvious with trash accumulation and no new sheets. Another thing is that the tv works terribly. We would go on Netflix or YouTube and 3 minutes into watching something it would go back into the Home Screen. It was a very terrible experience with the tv. Another issue is the bathroom, it is extremely small and the shower head was leaking so water went all over the floor. And there is no room service whatsoever and the reason I chose this hotel is because it claimed to have room service! And I called the front desk many times and it never was answered so I had to go all the way down to ask if they had room service and of course they were just talking with nobody in the lobby so it’s a bit confusing why the phone was never answered. And in the middle of the night security went to the room next to us and was extremely loud and completely ruined our night ! Would not recommend

title: You Get What You Pay For
text: Expect a bed to lay your head in and not much else in the way of hospitality or amenities. Front desk staff are less than helpful, restaurant is closed. Rooms are spacious at least! Location is fine but not the best.

title: Perfect!
text: Perfect place to stay! Close to everything...  a lot of places to park around. I give a 4 just because there’s no breakfast and stores around are expensive. Staff are very polite and friendly . Room was vey clean !!!

title: Great service and cleanliness,  staff was helpful  and professional
text: will definitely be back when I come back to New York City I really enjoyed my stay and was treated with the upmost respect and professionalism. It was my daugh T was 26th birthday  and her first time in New York and she was happy aswell. Thank you so much!!!

title: I just found my premier accommodations
text:
Quality through and through! I was pleased with the precautions implemented and upheld during my stay. Staff were professional in attire, attitude, and manner. 

The view from the 20th floor patio is ABSOLUTELY breathtaking!!!

title: Would not stay again
text:
My flight home was at 8 pm and they refused to store my luggage. Then they lied to me and said this was a city policy, which was a complete lie since other hotels store luggage, even during Covid. The front desk person sarcastically told me to carry my 10 pound bag with me all day. They made me pay $30 to store in room until 3. If they were clear about this when I booked, I would have stayed somewhere else.
P.S they bathroom have a mold and dresser had some bags with garbage inside!

title: Great hotel and awesome view.
text: The room was really clean and our view was right across from the South Pool at WTC.  The room was very clean. The room size was spacious, however I am not sure how much this room would be in regular season but for when I stayed there it was very reasonable.

title: Talk up for urself make sure u get what u suppose also what u 8ooked
text: If want water in 8tl make sure u call ahead if dnt want to use the fountain. 8ed was super room clean temperature only at 79° shower low Pressure toilet had to hold to flush dwn. Location was great. No smoking 🚭.  25 ft from 8uilding or get a fine on ur 8ill.

title: Amazing!
text: I’ve stayed here off and on for the past 3-4 months, and every time, it’s a fantastic experience. The rooms are so great, I love having a private balcony, and the mini kitchen area has helped me stay on track with my healthy eating. I highly recommend this place as I will be staying here again and again!

title: In the heart of the World Trade Center!
text: I had an amazing stay here because everyone was so helpful. I loved how the hotel was taking amazing measures to keep their customers safe. I felt safe - not to mention it was extremely clean and quiet. Great location in the Wall Street and WTC area. Nice and clean room with a good size bathroom with great walk in shower.  Friendly and professional front desk staff.  I had a perfect stay.

title: The entire crew made my experience beyond excellent
text:
I was blessed to stay at the Club Quarters Hotel in Manhattan NY @ 140 Washington Street November 8th - November 9th confirmation #9202761104354. I am giving all the information because I meet so many people that I've since forgotten the names of the staff that were so nice to me. It was four of them (magnificent four) A very sweet lady who checked me in with blonde hair but I can't remember her name. A pretty black girl that I think handled like security, cool Asian guy maybe his name was Kevin and the over night audit black guy that I think name was Arthur. I was going through a lot but I pride myself on optimism and the hope that kindness will some how make a way. It paid off because my stay at the Club Quarters was excellent. The entire staff were so friendly and really catered to my individual needs. I had moved from Atlanta to New York just the day before and was being mistreated in my situation by a really awful person. I was down by definition but not in spirit. I had prayed that God would surround me with angels and he did. The entire staff were so warm and loving, funny and charming professionals. I have tattoo art on my face so I get profiled a lot in my day to day life especially in Atlanta even though I've never been to jail and pride myself on being a benefit to the human race. I dealt with none on that nonsense with these good people. They treated me with the up most respect. Often times if I'm walking down the street or sitting somewhere having a coffee people will come and talk to me. So I had met a few people on Christopher street in the village and then got approached by another coming out of 711 and they all followed me back to the hotel. Their spirit felt good and I'm a friendly person who was pretty along at the time so I said to myself why not. The staff never judged me or them, we never caused a problem and they never treated us like we did. We simply had a good time and my spirit was lifted. I honestly thank God for them, I'll never forget it. I've been all over the world and stayed at all kinds of places but this experience truly stood out. Thank you so much for the staff and the Club Quarters for having the knowledge to employ such a wonders team of beautiful individuals. I hope one day we meet again, hope this isn't tacky but my Instagram is @darrellworld2020 if I can do anything for any of you or the company don't hesitate. If I have any grammatical errors I apologize I'm doing a million things at once but I had to get this review done.    

Darrell

title: Always an excellent experience
text:
I have been staying at this location frequently over past few months. It is always a pleasure to come to a clean room with amazing view and amenities. The staff is great and makes me want to come back always.
Christos always greet warmly, and  helps multiple requests, clearly putting his customer's request as priority
The location is very good, and its commendable on how they have modified the services during covid-19 and are taking all the precautions. It is under rated hotel and i am pleased with my stay.

title: Cozy location, helpful staff!
text: This hotel is kind of hidden but in like a good way. There wasnt as much traffic as you would have heard if it was on a main road. The staff super awesome. Kevin helped me with all my crazy problems with a smile. He definitely went above and beyond which made my stay so much better. The beds are ok. The hotel itself was really clean and beautiful. The roof top was beautiful! Definitely a nice area to sit at. Overall a great hotel to stay at!

title: Excellent
text: Excellent place to stay at in the city!! I cannot recommend this hotel enough! Super nice and friendly staff, the room was perfect! The location is amazing, and the price is great! Make sure you check out the 20th floor and visit the garden view as well as the view of the world. It looks right over the city and the ground zero memorial! Seriously such a perfect place. We will never stay anywhere else when visiting NYC.

title: Ottima posizione
text:
Camere carine e di una buona grandezza, questo non è scontato a NY.
Il letto è molto comodo e bello grande. 
Anche la camera da bagno è di una buona giornata. 
Ho apprezzato particolarmente la doccia, il getto d'acqua era ottimo per fare la doccia, questo non è scontato negli Stati Uniti. 
Il personale, per quel poco che ho avuto a che fare, è cordiale e disponibile.

title: Underrated Hotel
text: The views from the rooftop were incredible. The hotel follows all COVID-19 safety guidelines. You can check out contactless either on your phone or in room TV. Excellent location. I feel like this hotel was a hidden gem. We got a great price for our room and this place met our expectations. Guest services was amazing. Needed new batteries for the TV remote and was able to text them instead of calling. They responded so quickly and were incredibly polite.

title: Weekend Trip
text: I absolutely love this hotel! Always have a great time/stay here and the staff is lovely. Would definitely recommend for any sort of stay! The room was great, as well as the view. Last but not least, it’s the perfect for location for business purposes and or pleasure purposes, as it’s a few blocks from fidi offices and the train station.

title: Great hotel great location
text: I advise anyone to stay here. I felt safe, it was clean, room was perfect and any mistakes made they corrected it. Way better then I thought and I will be back. The staff was especially great and made me want to come back even more

title: Amazing Hotel Stay (Great Hotel For Business Travel)
text: Club Quarters World Trade Center was great for business travel. The hotel is very clean and safe for Covid-19, the staff was great, and the view from my room was good. I always use this hotel when I have business in NYC.

title: Piccolo ma ottimo
text:
Piccolo hotel tranquillo e nel cuore di wall street.
La camera abbastanza spaziosa per lo standard di NY e con i comfort abituali.
Ho avuto la fortuna di ricevere la camera 1214 con piccolo balconcino. Il traffico della strada non si sente, ma degli ospiti che sbattono la porta purtroppo si.
Bella vista dal rooftop al 20imo piano, purtroppo ristorante e palestra chiusi  per il Covid.

title: A wonderful gem..
text: I only stayed one night but it was a wonderful one night. From the check in (Christos was amazing), to the accomodations, everything was great. The room was clean, modern and comfortable. I liked that the hotel was technologically forward. The room key that the elevator would recognize and bring you to your floor (without touching the floor buttons), and the streaming services(using your own personal accounts) and information on the television were very welcome. High speed internet and the ability to use your phone as a room key are some other welcome features of technology. It's a wonder why many other hotels don't EVEN have streaming services on their televisions, not to speak of the other technology features this hotel has. The bed was comfortable and I certainly slept well. The water pressure in the walk in shower was exceptional. There are some amazing views from the 20th floor sundeck, overlooking the WTC area and memorial fountains. I didn't take any photos of the room, but what you see online is pretty accurate . I did take a beautiful nighttime picture from the 20th floor sundeck. As far as location, if you need to be in the WTC/Financial area, it's perfect. Within walking distance of the WTC memorial, the Oculus, the West Side waterways, Brookfield Mall, Financial District and more. I certainly look forward to my next stay 🥰

title: The stay of my NYC dreams
text: When I first arrived to the hotel, I was blown away by all the precautions they were taking in regards to COVID. I'm a nurse and this was a huge plus for me. Almost everything is hands free, including the elevator and hotel room doors. There was hand sanitizer and social distancing signs everywhere. When I first arrived I had a beautiful room but there was no view. I don't usually ask but the front desk staff was so nice that I figured I would see if there were any rooms with a view available. I wasn't expecting much but boy was I in for a treat. It's been on my bucket list to stay at a NYC hotel with a view and I can safely say that that item is checked off. Having laundry available, being able to text the front desk for any of my needs, and only allowing one person/family in the elevator are other positives for this hotel. Just wanted to give Marsha-Ann a shout out for being such and amazing receptionist. Thanks for everythign!

title: Nice Boutique Hotel
text: Nice hotel.  Many good things to be said.  Generally clean, good location and view and in normal times good dining options.  Few bad.  No sink inside bathroom.  No safe.  No security bar on door.  These are not major issues.  Good value for the cost.

title: My ABSOLUTE FAVORITE NYC hotel has finally reopened!
text:
I can’t say enough wonderful things about Club Quarters, WTC location.  From the moment you walk in, you’re greeted by genuinely nice people who enjoy their jobs.  If they can accommodate your request, they absolutely well.  So many times we’ve gone to check in and found we had been upgraded several times over.  

We’ve never had any issues in the many times we’ve stayed.  The amenities are incredible (especially before Covid).  They included a sitting area with an Espresso machine, snacks, a fridge stocked with sodas, a wine hour, loaner iPads, closets on each floor stocked with extra soap and shampoo, a gym, loaner IPads.  The list went on.  There are even free washers and dryers with detergent and Bounce!

Please do book direct.  The rates are cheaper and you can join their Rewards Program.  Stay 2 nights and receive a Night on the House.  I’d like to thank Kevin, Christos, Michael, Arnold, Dawn and the lovely Marsha Ann for making our last visit perfect.

title: Ogni volta...
text: ...che andiamo a New York prenotiamo in quest'albergo: centralissimo e comodissimo. Il terrazzo, ben attrezzato, offre una vista spettacolare. Il prezzo è ottimo considerata la struttura e la posizione. Consigliatissimo!

title: Posizione punto di forza della struttura
text:
L'hotel si trova in una delle zone più conosciute e centrali di Manhattan ovvero il World Trade Center. La nostra camera era molto pulita con un'ottima vista. I rifornimenti di acqua e caffè grauiti tutti i giorni sono stati molto apprezzatti. Staff disponibile a soddisfare tutte le nostre esigenze. 

Per colazione vengono offerte barrette e frutta nella sala comune ma consiglio di mangiare almeno una mattina nella saletta al ventesimo piano per godersi un ottimo skyline ed una colazione a prezzi tutto sommato onesti per quello che viene offerto

Cosa non mi è piaciuto: la stanza per 3 persone non proprio comodissima in quanto era presente un divano letto vicino al letto matrimoniale che una volta aperto riduceva di molto lo spazio agibile.
Camera non proprio grandissima per 3 persone.

title: Week Long Business Trip
text: Terrific value and amenities. Enjoyed the complimentary individually cooked and served breakfast very much.  The afternoon happy hour was enjoyable and the Club Quarters living room features was great for gathering.  Rooms were very well appointed and the views amazing. Staff were very helpful and professional.  Rooms allowed for both good working area and place to relax.  Enjoyed the microwave and  refrigerator for bringing in your own food and not having to eat out every day.  I will definitely be back.

title: Excelente
text:
El hotel tiene una ubicación inmejorable! 

Esta a 2 cuadras de una estación de metro y con muchísima seguridad en las calles para caminar a cualquier hora del día o noche.

El personal es súper amable, atento y siempre con la mejor disposición de ayudarte si tienes alguna consulta. Incluso pedimos cosas por Amazon y ellos te las reciben y resguardan hasta que regreses.

Algo que nos hizo optar por esta cadena fue que el impuesto municipal/estatal de 23 USD por noche en ésta cadena (que no puedes evadir en ningún hotel/hostal y hay unos que se elevan hasta 45 USD por noche) te incluye snacks, frutas, nueces, café, té y refresco todos los días! Inclusive tienen PC en el lobby para que puedas imprimir (sin costo) algún documento que sea necesario. Otra amenidad incluída (que fue una sorpresa muy agradable) es que en el piso 12 tienen autoservicio de lavadora/secadora para disposición de los huéspedes sin pagar un sólo dólar adicional.

El cuarto que nos asignaron tuvo un tamaño excelente y bien distribuido; nos asignaron uno con vista increíble al monumento 11/9. La limpieza: ESPECTACULAR. Todos los días que limpiaron quedó impecable todo y un sólo papel o centavo no te tocan. Hasta la cama y almohadas eran increíbles para descansar 😅

Definitivamente, en un futuro no dudaría en hospedarme en éste hotel o en la misma cadena.

title: Beyond expectations!
text: Spent 3 nights at the hotel on family holidays, I must say that the view was really amazing! Jaw dropping! Very close to the metro, daily happy hour (between 5 - 6), red and white wine complimentary, m&m's, peanuts, Apple, coffee and soft drinks anytime. The room was good enough for 3 of us. Although I must say that Ronaldo (Ro Barber) guest experience manager was extremely kind, polite and keen to help! Thank you Ronaldo for looking after my family! If you need anything, make sure to look for him and surely he'll be happy to help! Spot on!!! I was very pleased my entire stay at the hotel!

title: Muy buena ubicación del hotel
text: Si viajan 3 personas, busca otra opción de hospedaje, es bueno si viajan 2 ó 4 personas. Excelente ubicación del hotel está a unas cuadras de un un super. Obvio del world trade center, estación del metro. Estas pagando por la ubicación.

title: Amazing View at Amazing Price
text: What a great room with a great view with a price!!!!! Very friendly staff!! My room was on the 7th floor over looking the 9/11 memorial, as a firemen it was more than i could have hoped for in a hotel room, very moving.

title: Ottima posizione
text: Ottimo hotel posizionato direttamente al memoriale delle torri gemelle e da dove si può raggiungere tutta Manhattan comodamente con la metropolitana. Camere abbastanza grandi per la regione. Ristorante sul tetto con terrazza dove si può ammirare un bellissimo panorama sui dintorni. Pasti à la carte anche per la colazione.

title: Great Customer Service
text:
I stay regularly at this hotel when I am in NYC and really have a great customer experience with them. The hotel manager, Krystin G., is very professional and has put my needs as a customer as her highest priority. She is a pleasure to work with and her leadership filters down to her team. 

Ro Barber who is the guest experience manager for the hotel is top notch. He remembers my name and makes my experience there very personal. With so many guests in all the time, it's impressive how he can remember so many people and he always has a smile on his face, a kind demeanor and is always willing to my my stay the best that he can. I appreciate that kind of service and am never disappointed when he is at the desk to greet me. 

The location is wonderful and the amenities are pretty good. I recommend this hotel and I look forward to my trips there.

title: Love this hotel!
text: This is my go-to place for work trips. Used to love in nyc, and this is one of the better places in the area. Rodrigo, specifically stands out in his exceptional customer service, kindness, and attention to detail. He made me and many other guests feel very “tended to” in that he asked how your day was, was there anything else he could do to make my stay better. I love this place. Will always stay here. Rodrigo makes this place better! #Promotion

title: Extremely Polite And Knowledgable Team
text: I love staying here. Everyone including the environmental staff are so helpful, polite and fun. Hotel is super clean and I love the complimentary wine and snack hour. I would definitely recommend anyone to stay here. It’s like home away from home. Cozy might I add.

title: Location.  Location.  Location.
text:
We were lucky to get this hotel on a bargain and didn’t know what to expect, but were pleasantly surprised.  Rooms are nice, nicer than most NYC hotel rooms.  It’s evident the hotel has been recently renovated and particularly the bathroom still showed blemishes on the walls and floor.  When we left, the lobby was being cabled but these renovations never got in our way and just showed there’s investment on the property.

The great thing about this hotel is location.  It’s less than 5 min walking from Wall St, the 9/11 Memorial, Trinity Church, St Paul’s Chapel, the Charging Bull and a few other NYC landmarks.  It’s a 10-15 walk to Brooklyn Bridge, Battery Park, and the Ellis/Liberty Island ferries.  It’s surrounded by at least 5 subway stations (WTC, Cortland St, Rector St, Wall St, and Fulton St) which means you have options when moving all over the city at any time.  There’s great restaurants nearby (Morton’s Steakhouse is on the same building and Bill’s Bar & Burger next building down to name a few).

We really enjoyed our stay and recommend anyone looking for a very good option in the Financial District to give this hotel a try!

title: Great value downtown near everything
text: Stayed here over Valentine's Day weekend. Great location. Close to the Freedom Tower and Century 21 department store. Lots of little shops and bars around. If you stay check out the Irish pub at the end of the block. Also, the wine and snacks in the lobby were a welcome surprise. Christos at the front desk is fantastic. Personable and accommodating to every need. Will stay again!!

title: Tourists on our city
text:
We decided to take a weekend to enjoy the Fidi—Financial District of downtown NYC. We booked a room at Club Quarters World Trade Center, which is within walking distance of the Trade Center. 

The hotel is clean, new and comfortable. The wine party in the club area was a nice bonus as was the coffee/tea and snacks all day. The rooftop bar has incredible views of the reflecting pools and World Trade Centre.   

The rooms are spacious (for NYC lodging) and clean. We enjoyed our stay and felt refreshed. I would definitely recommend this location for anyone coming to NYC

title: Great Place to Stay and great location
text: CQ WTC is a very good hotel to stay in NYC downtown. Especially Ro Barber is really helpful. He really takes good care of guests and ensures our requests are addressed in time. Great job and thanks alot.

title: Great option in Manhattan financial district
text: I use this hotel regularly at the world trade center location.  Always clean, great service, comfy rooms and close to everything.  No frills, but nice rooms, decent restaurant, and free snacks and wine in the lobby each evening.

title: NYC weekend
text: We’ve stayed here twice and have not been disappointed. The location is great for visiting the WTC location and all of the memorials nearby. Within walking to great places to eat. Nice to walk along the river. We’ve visited Trinity church and Saint Peters for services and walked to both.

title: Vista spettacolare
text: Ottimo Hotel. Ottima posizione. Dalla finestra vista spettacolare sui grattacieli e sul Ground Zero. Ristorante in terrazza al ventesimo piano. Abbiamo fatto ottima colazione ma molto cara. Nonostante ciò lo consiglio vivamente. Zona tranquilla.

title: I spent the night at Club Quarters!
text: Easily, the BEST Club Quarters that I have visited. The location is spotless and the club lounge is wonderful. Unlike other Club Quarters Hotels, this hotel kept the lounge stocked during the weekend. Most do not stock the lounge, saying that it is "the weekend".

title: Convenient hotel
text: Was a nice hotel. Rooms are small which is expected. Snacks are only out sometimes which was disappointing. Twice our lighting went out in our bathroom so we had to call Maintenance but they fixed it promptly I must say. Tv remote barely worked and the app on the phone was terrible and wouldn’t work for anything.

title: 3 night stay...
text:
Stayed in a king room facing the Freedom Tower and the memorial... Beautiful view.

Staff was very friendly and room was very comfortable.  Free wine tasting 5-7pm, free coffee in the lobby and reasonable breakfast prices on the 20th floor makes for a great deal!

title: Another great stay.
text: Always a great stay at the Club Quarters World Trade Center!  I can count on this hotel to have a great stay for my business needs as well a quick couples retreat.  The staff are always welcoming and accommodating to my needs.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: The advantage of this particular CQH is it's proximity to the World Trade Centre with its museum, the subway, restaurants and of course O'Hara's Irish bar! Only a short walk also from Wall Street and Battery Park.

title: One of the best hotel experiences I've ever had in New York
text: I have stayed in New York many times for business, and I have just gotten used to rooms being shockingly small and often outdated. When I traveled with my wife, I warned her several times not to expect anything big, because I had assumed that even in 4 and 5 star hotels, this was just the norm for NYC. Not so at Club Quarters. We were upgraded to the suite by the incredibly kind and responsive staff, and it was one of the largest and most modern rooms in NY ive ever seen. Equally amazing, we only paid $120 a night. I have stayed in rooms easily 3 times that amount that were a fraction of the size and with none of the amenities. A wonderful experience.

title: Best Hotel Stay In NYC So Far
text: You are not going to get a better place to stay in NYC for the cost. The staff, area, rooms, service, cleanliness, and restaurant was all amazing! I would give the hotel six stars if I could, especially considering the cost. Great value and I will be back!!

title: Quick weekend in the big apple.
text: For a short business trip or a getaway weekend Club Quarter is a great option for accommodation. Practical, comfortable and close to the places you wanna be. An option you can not miss when planning your next trip.

title: Insect Bites
text: I stayed at this hotel for two nights for business travel on December 17 and 18, 2019.  When I went home my legs were covered with itchy and painful bites.  My doctor confirmed they were insect bites!  I will never stay there again!

title: One night stay at Club Quarters
text: I came to New York for an interview and this was the preferred hotel by the company I was interviewing for. I stayed here for one night. Amenities were good, everything was clean and fresh. I liked the room. It is appropriate for Business travels and provides special arrangements for Business meetings on request. 10/10 would recommend this place.

title: NYC/Business
text: Conveniently located, very helpful staff.  Great fruit/snacks/munchies to refresh!  Wine happy hour is a bonus.  Almost any service you could want is a short walk away.    Easy access to airports.  Shooping, Oculus, TJ MAXX, Marshalls, Century 21, 9/11 venues around the corner.

title: Best place to stay downtown
text: I have stayed a few times at this hotel besides the excellent service accommodated my needs. There is wine at 5, coffee bar with snacks. very convenient valet parking was easy to check out and get my car within minutes. I am also am a first responder at 911 and to get the view I get from the room is spectacular and touches my heart knowing that New York City pulled together to make this very solemn place beautiful and this hotel supports that and its location. I will be staying at this hotel for many years,  let me reiterate that. Every time I'm in Manhattan this is the place to stay.

title: Would stay again
text: Comfortable and adequate. Convenient location close to transportation, shopping and memorial. Friendly and helpful staff. Made use of the the yoga equipment and in room videos. Would definitely recommend and will be staying again.

title: WTC "World Trade Center" 9/11.....
text:
Hôtel  bien placé et au calme au pied du cimetière, mémorial du 11 sept. Plusieurs lignes de métro, 10/15 mn à pieds du bateau pour la Statue de la liberté. 
Personnel agréable et à l'écoute et compétents. A visiter le Resto au 21eme étage. Des encas sont proposés gratuitement toute la journée et du vin de 17h à 18h  de quoi se détendre après une grande balade.
Les chambres sont spacieuses et lumineuse....

title: Very nice stay and staff!
text: We really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were nice and clean. The only thing we felt was the bathrooms were what you would expect at a lower budget hotel and very small. In general, we love staying at club quarters.

title: Weekly Business Trips
text: I stay at Club Quarters WTC almost on a weekly basis and it’s like a home away from home. I’m currently meal prepping and can bring all my food from home and refrigerate them and heat them in my room. The service provided by Ronoldo and Albert is exceptional. The bend over backwards to make my stay great.

title: Breath taking?
text:
The room was lovely and clean, had free sweets can's of pop free fruit it was a really nice hotel.
Great view of the Twin Towers memorial  garden from the resturant!
Fantastic Hotel all round, would definitely return in the future.

title: Freedom Tower - Club Quarters
text: My company puts me up here, it’s a great location. You can walk over to the Freedom Tower and Museum in minutes. Plenty of places to eat and shop. Subways are close so access to mid town is easy. Highly recommended

title: Recommended near WTC
text:
Good location, close to the Twin Towers memorial.
Breakfast are not included, but snacks and drinks are provided. We did get to enjoy that :)
Our room was quite small, but it had everything necessary (incl. iron and ironing board).
The hotel has also a laundry room, where you can wash your clothes if necessary!
24/7 Gym looked nice (even through there was no time to use it).
Top terrace and a bar with s fantastic view.
Definitely recommended.

Disliked · 
The shower curtain had a distinctive odour, which consequently made the whole room/bathroom smell :(

title: Great New York Hotel!!
text: Loved our view! Nice sized room! Great location! Close to red and yellow subway lines.  Loved the water filling stations and free drinks/snacks. Parking prices weren’t bad at $51/day rate. Friendly staff.

title: Great Hotel at Great Location with Great Staff
text: The family spends a week or two in NYC every year, so we have visited quite a few hotels. Club Quarters at the World Trade Center was the best! Check-in (one of my pet peeves) took two minutes tops. The room was spacious (for NYC) and well-designed. Full cable on the large TV was a nice extra. Every single employee we met was super friendly. Best of all was the location. WTC was two blocks away. Fulton subway station is about 4 or 5 blocks away, meaning easy and cheap access to anywhere in the city. I promise you will be happy at this hotel.

title: Friendly team, clean rooms and a great location.
text: This is a great location where you are greeted and supported by a friendly, professional team. Only 2 mins from the World Trade Centre memorial and the Westfield Occulus shopping mall. Conveniently located for the subway and also for walking up up to Soho or even Central Park if you fancy some exercise.

title: Amazing Dray, amazing staff, amazing hotel !
text:
I had the best time ! I’ve stayed a few times in NYC, and This hotel is by far the best !! The staff is amazing (special shout out to Christos and Ronaldo!!!), service is excellent.
The coffee /tea /goodie bar is full all day, and everyone is so kind ! 
Truly awesome stay ! 
PLUS !!! Free wine at 5pm for all guests ! Whaaaaaat!? 
Thanks to all of you, your smiles and kindness made it all amazing  !

title: Great experience.
text: We had a great time and could walk or hail a cab to anywhere we wanted to go within 20 minutes. We enjoyed the wine nights and coffee and snacks that were laid out and available to us in the morning or afternoon. The rooftop view was insane!

title: Great for Business
text: This hotel is great for business trips with great views and decent food in the restaurant on the 20th floor.  Happy hour downstairs with wine tasting is a nice touch.  Hotel is close to the subway for those heading to mid town and beyond.

title: Quiet boutique hotel...
text:
Stayed here for business and it was nice... I arrived early and could not get into my room early, which is standard. Reception staff was warn and welcoming. Room was nice but typically small for a NYC boutique hotel. The batteries in my room's smoke detector died, so it was beeping. It took two calls to get someone to come and address the situation. Instead of bringing a new battery, the hotel staff member simply disconnected it and said they would fix it the next day....I was VERY concerned that my room would not be protected in the event of a fire.... but the hotel staff member motioned to another sensor in the hallway. Replacing the battery would have made me feel much safer, but they did not seem to think my opinion mattered.

I had dinner with colleagues at the hotel restaurant on the 21st floor (View of the World)... I have been there a few times before.... and within the last year, the menu has changed.... Small plates were good but very expensive for the scant amount of food --- and there was not a large selection offered. The desserts were very ordinary, yet expensive as well. The view of the new 911 building is magnificent.

title: First Class Touches Everywhere
text: We loved our stay here so much, we booked another night!  Staff is outstanding.  The views are incredible.  It’s the little touches here and there that make this hotel stand out.  Chilled bottled water stations, wine at 5pm, free washer and dryer, snacks in the lobby, guest request closets on each floor. Book direct and avoid the facilities fees.  I can’t wait to return.  Also close to several subway lines.

title: Small room, small beds, high price tag
text: Unfortunately the room is we are extremely small, tiny twin size beds, the tv didn’t work; high price tag. It’s in an awesome area, and they have free wine in the lobby 5-6pm as well as snacks and drinks al day long. It would be a nice place to stay solo.

title: Great value and hospitality in downtown Manhattan
text: The little things made this a great place to stay - chilled spring water, coffee, snacks, wine! - especially for a busy weekend of sightseeing and fun with friends.  Great location for lower Manhattan and easy walk to the subway to get uptown.

title: Downtown Gem
text: The Club Quarters Hotel at the World Trade Center offers a great room and ample amenities at a reasonable price. The staff went out of their way to make my stay as comfortable as possible, and the endless supply of snacks and good coffee were greatly appreciated. All-in-all, a wonderful hotel in downtown NYC.

title: Great place to stay
text: The staff was friendly and accommodating, especially to first time visitors to the city. The coffee and snacks wee a great respite after a busy day in the city. Nice and close to the WTC and Wall Street

title: Great hotel with great view!
text:
It was a great experience in ny! The Hotel was great, our view was awesome! The service in the hotel as weil. We look really forward to come back. Very close to wtc and wtc memorial. Just 2 minutes to subway. 
We really enjoyed it!

title: Great Location
text: Great location, helpful and attentive staff, small but clean & efficient rooms.  For FIDI, fair value for the money.  While I will miss my ol' fave on William, this is a nice replacement, ;and the view is considerably more interesting.

title: This place is the BEST!
text: I love this hotel.  Lots of great perks that other hotels don't have that are included in the price!  Kevin and his staff are wonderful and gracious!!  I tell everyone I know!  I love the snacks and the wine/beverages in the afternoon and the restaurant at the top is gorgeous and yummy!

title: Excellent Experience
text: I had an amazing experience at Clubquaters and would gladly give 7 stars if we could. Everywhere I turned, I felt welcomed, included, noticed and respected at all times. I always learned so much about the New York culture just by conversing with the staff who are so willing to share their life stories. It was my pleasure to get to learn about this wonderful culture through the eyes of the employees. My room was immaculate and so comfortable and spacious that you really would find it hard to leave.

title: Best hotel to stay in the Financial District.
text: This was our second stay in one 1 year. This time we went in Aug 2019. The weather was amazing. I always enjoy good service and I want to honor those that provided the good service. Ronaldo, Stephanie and Albert went above and beyond. I don't know if they remember me, but I will remember them. The view restaurant is also amazing. Every time I go, I always ask for a room in the 17th floor. Best floor ever. If you plan to stay in New York and you are looking for a historical place to stay. Look no further!!!!!! Oh did I forget to mention that they have a Morton's Steakhouse next to them and George's a perfect place to have breakfast in the morning. Remember to always ask for on of the best staff at the hotel...Ronaldo, Stephanie and Albert

title: Greatly exceeded expectations
text: Front desk was great, finding me an available room early and including a great view of the reflecting pool and freedom tower.    Room was just fine and breakfast was good and reasonable. Nice view from restaurant.  Unique place based on location, weather not great but experience was.

title: Great property, but had some minor issues
text: "Basic" room was nice size, modern, clean, but it had a "knocking" noise behind the wall (like some sort of water pump?) After first night, I mentioned it to the staff, and upon return, it was there. I returned to the desk and they did move/upgrade my room. The new room (suite) had two TVs, but only one remote, and the functioning remote did not work with the bed tv..hence another request at the desk, that WAS remedied. Still, a very nice location, good food, and convenient  to subways, upscale shopping mall and the riverside, including Ferry services,While I was there, they offered a free Wine party at 5 pm  for residents.... not bad!

title: Frustrating
text: Terrible booking service! Over priced. The front desk team don’t have a canal of communication between the booking team and the managers. Terrible, frustrating, until now I didn’t received the answer about the money they charged in my account without any reason. If you want to have a good time in nyc, avoid this hotel!

title: family time in NYC
text: The location worked well for us, right opposite the World Trade Centre it is easy to walk to all the Lower Manhattan attractions and easy subway ride to Midtown. Some great restaurants and shops round about. The staff were extremely friendly and  helpful.  24 hour hot / cold drinks and snacks, with wine time at 5pm was a bonus and made a nice atmosphere in the evening. Free launderette, refillable water bottles and a restaurant with fantastic views.  This hotel works and I would return and try other Club Quarters.

title: Awesome Stay
text: Clean nice and a great property. Amazing view from the suites of wtc as well. The drinks upstairs are unbelievable. The only reason why I have it as a 4 star rating, is that the entire menu at the restaurant changed. I wish I was able to get a burger for dinner and it wasnt small plates or family style only. Sorry for the big pink pic. It won't go away

title: confort, security and facilities
text: I traveled with my family, we were housed in nearby rooms,as  we had asked . The hotel  access to the laundry room, to the snacks in the meeting room and above all a very attentive reception staff. The area is not the most busy and well known but there is a new shopping center near by, a subway sation in the shopping, some restaurants around.

title: Old, cramped building, but convenient
text:
This building is old, cramped with thin walls. The room shapes are interesting/creative, and great views (highly depends on the room). The bathroom/shower were clean and ordered, however the toilet paper was really dollar-store cheap. There was only one shower towel. The mattress was clean, but old and too worn out. I understand the hotel is refreshing mattresses. 

If you're next to an elevator, you'll hear it all night. If you're next door to another room with a fertile couple, you could be listening in to a late night rump. Some doors are very close to each other, so you'll easily hear them slam. 

All of this said, this is not terribly expensive for what you get, and location to the World Trade Center memorial, but just be ready to switch rooms, in some cases. Most rooms are nice, but there have been a few exceptions to me. 

The restaurant upstairs is nice, as is the roof-top sitting area. Breakfast was really good, but a little pricey, not that this should deter you. Just don't order the $7 bacon on the side unless your meal just isn't filling enough. Service is great. 

Bring exact cash for the vending snack machines. Snacks downstairs are decent, and coffee isn't bad, either. 

Everything in the hotel is hidden on a floor, so just pay attention. 

Finally, don't forget your keycard to use the elevator. I always request two cards.

title: Mostly good
text: For the price and location it’s hard to beat. Rooms are small but comfortable. HVAC good. We have stayed at the sister hotel next door and the latter was better with a safe in room and more sound protection. We could hear every word of couple in room next door with paper thin walls. The snacks and chilled water in reusable bottles was a great plus.

title: Housekeeper Burst Into My Room While I Was Naked:
text:
I stayed at this hotel for about a week during a business trip to New York City.  The stay started off poorly the moment my assistant and I checked into our room. It smelled terribly of feces. We paid to upgrade to a different room which turned out to be very nice. It was very clean and spacious. Problems began to arise on day 2 of our stay. We had a ‘Do Not Disturb’ sign on our door, however housekeeping still took it upon themselves to bang on the door. I was a little annoyed with this, but decided to let it go. 

The day that we were scheduled to check out, housekeeping came banging at our door a full 2.5 hours before the required check out time (the do not disturb sign was on the door). I yelled out several times to notify her that we were still in the room. Instead of leaving, She actually opened the door and tried to come inside! Her opening the door ended up exposing me (who was fully nude and in the middle of changing my clothes) to about 5 or 6 guests who were in the hallway!  

I of course was extremely angry! I told her that we were not ready to check out as yet. I immediately called down to the front desk to tell them about what happen and also to request a late check out time of about 30 minutes.  The person at the front desk told me it would be ok and that he would notify housekeeping. The same house keeper came knocking at our door a few minutes later (about 1.5 hours before checkout ) and asked us again when we would be leaving. I informed her that we had requested a late check out. After 30 mins, my assistant went out into the hallway to get water. The house keeper saw her and asked again when we would be checking out. At this point we both started to feel harassed. 5 minutes after my assistant had a conversation with the housekeeper, a male came banging at the door demanding to know when we would be checking out. This was approximately 1 hour before the required checkout time! After that, housekeeping came to the door again about 30 minutes later to ask the same question! We felt extremely pressured and harassed to get out of the room.

We called for the bellman service (as we had a lot of bags to move). It took the Bellman 30 minutes to come to our room with the luggage cart. When we were finally able to check out, the front desk girl told me (very condescendingly) that I am checking out late. I was extremely baffled by her tone and remarks. I informed her that I had requested a late check out hours ago. She seemed hell bent on chastising me. She then took it upon herself to tell me that I checked out later than I had initially told them I would be. I told her that the Bellman was 30 minutes late bringing the luggage cart! I decided to bring up the issue I had with house keeping to her. She didn’t offer a single apology and frankly didn’t seem to care. I felt like she just wanted me to shut up and get out.

I felt extremely attacked and angry after that encounter.  Her attitude and disposition was so disgusting. What made matters worse is that I decided to call the manager to complain about the incident so that no other guest would have to face that level of embarrassment. I called twice and the manager never returned my phone call! 

Other terrible experiences we had at this hotel:

*Bellhop did not offer to assist us with our luggage. Even the front desk rep (hispanic female) saw me having a hard time trying to pull the heavy cart and refused to offer me assistance. I literally had to ask for help, even then I was told that I could do it myself!!!

*A different front desk clerk (black female) refused to acknowledge my assistant when she was waiting on line to ask a question!

I’m not sure what is going on with the staff and management at this hotel, but they really need to go in for serious training.  Our experience was deplorable!

title: Choose this One
text: Great place to stay if you need to access financial district or if you are site seeing for vacation. Staff was friendly and room was clean and modern. Oh did I mention the free wine 5-6pm daily. Yes, free wine!

title: Not spectacular but decent.
text: Nice and friendly staff in a good location but the rooms are much smaller than I expected.  The mattress wasn't very comfortable so it took a while to get to sleep.  The Club Quarters in Philadelphia was more comfortable and a bit larger however the overall experience was fine including great views on the rooftop restaurant .

title: Great room and location
text: A clean, modern hotel. Room was very comfortable for family of three. Overlooked the 9/11 Memorial. A king size bed plus a fold out sofa. Excellent shower. Ventilation in bathroom was lacking. Some modest snack and coffee are always available for free in the lounge. Very convenient location. Next to subway and right off the west side highway. No street noise at night.

title: Great location for downtown business
text: The CQ-WTC offers reasonably priced, clean accommodations catering to the business traveler. The views, especially from their 20th floor dining room, of the WorldTrade tower, buildings, 9/11 memorial and museum are spectacular. Only a block from a couple different subway lines and PATH trains, shopping and dining in the upscale Oculus center. The staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Excellent location and great service
text:
Hotel is near a lot of things particularly if you are looking to be near Financial District. Rooms were not large but comfortable. Very clean and had a view of the World Trade Center and Occulus.

Business facilities also available - meeting rooms, computers, printers etc.

title: Excellent Hotel to stay for family, business or personal
text: This hotel is located close to the world Trade Center. The view from my room was awesome. The Breakfast on the 20th floor (View of the World) did not disappoint. The staff was very friendly and accommodating providing me with the breakfast of my choice.

title: World Trade Center visit- extraordinary hotel!!!!
text: Room was lovely, comfy bed, nice staff, free coffee all day!!! Also snacks in the afternoon- the price was right- great location- easy to walk to everything-perfect space for all visitors to chill- staff was great

title: Amazing Stay, Amazing Staff!
text:
We sooooo enjoyed our stay at Club Quarters.  We made a trip to New York City for Thanksgiving weekend to watch the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade and do some sight-seeing and shopping.  Stayed in the Financial District at the Club Quarters.  

Amazing.  The staff was incredible.  From the very first contact by telephone, through our stay, to our departure... highly, highly professional and courteous.   There was a slight mix-up in our rooms, but was fixed by the staff.  

Clean, quiet.  Very conveniently-located to the 9/11 Memorial, subway stops, shopping, and restaurants, etc.  Valet parking (we drove to NYC) is $51/day. 

Highly recommend to all!

title: Great Stay
text: The folks at the front desk were outstanding, some of the best I've run into at a hotel. They were always very welcoming and even helped us coordinate rides to the airport. I love the filtered water they have on each floor for you to bring to your room. And the rooms were nice as well.

title: Thanksgiving in NYC!
text:
The customer service at this hotel is stellar! Marsha-Ann, the Guest Service Manager, truly went the extra mile welcoming us with a happy spirit when we arrived.
 My  family had decided on a last minute trip to NYC over Thanksgiving break. Initially we booked the smallest room, but we ended up needing something that would accommodate one more person. Being mindful that the Macy’s Thanksgiving Parade was scheduled for the next day and room availability was scarce, we were not very confident. 
 The front desk was busy with guests checking in/out. Marsha greeted us with a genuine smile. After listening to our plight she began searching on the computer and found us a wonderful suite that was spacious AND with a spectacular view of The Freedom Tower!! She truly exemplifies first class customer service. We will make sure to keep Club Quarters-World Trade Center at the top of our list for hotels in NYC. The location is fantastic, too!

title: Long Term Stay
text: I have stayed at the Club Quarters WTC for almost an entire year for business . The hotel is situated near several subways and is in a very walkable safe area ( Wall Street , oculus, 9/11 memorial ) . There is a delicious Mortons located downstairs along with a rooftop restaurant with beautiful views! There are also free wine happy hours daily , snacks along with free coffee and capp and my favorite the refillable purified water stations on all floors. However my favorite and most enjoyable thing about this hotel is the amazing staff that keeps this hotel running ! The front desk staff are always super friendly and personable! They made my year long stay feel like home and are always so accommodating! The maintenance staff are also very responsive if there ever is an issue. I highly recommend this hotel for businesses and leisure adult  travelers alike.

title: Amazing overall!!!
text: I highly recommend staying here. Amazing service , amazing room with view. Breakfast was delicious with great service. Front desk was friendly and professional. You are close to trains to go where ever you need too. Close to shopping area , restaurants and more.

title: Club Quarters WTC
text: I enjoyed my time in NYC and staying at the CQ WTC location didn’t disappoint. Check in/out was easy using the CQ app. The staff was professional and courteous at all times. My room was clean and was sized appropriately since I was a solo traveler. The location of this hotel put me in close proximity to many sites that any traveler to NYC would want to take in. I will definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends.

title: Would not stay again
text:
The room was did not feel clean - there was a mysterious wet spot on the ground upon entry, hairs in the shower, and brown water came out of the faucet once when I went to brush my teeth.

It took over 45 minutes for room service to deliver a simple mint tea after saying it would "be [to my room] momentarily" (no food or other items were ordered).

Persistent loud noises at night (maybe the pipes?) coupled with very thin did not make for a peaceful nights sleep.

title: Club Quarters-World Trade Center
text:
Great hotel -clean,new, nice free snacks .
Very enjoyable stay -price is great ! Location is good -not far from subways. Nice quiet area -felt safe. Bathroom very nice -. Bed very comfortable . Loved
The Grab n go breakfast from the restaurant -a great value at 7.95!

title: Good hotel
text: Nice, clean hotel near WTC and memorial.  TV was out and didn't get fixed until the next day, which was disappointing. Very comfortable bed, but I was in a room that was literally next to a utility room and was awoken several times by noise on the first night there. Solid hotel, with the only real drawback being Club Quarters Membership Program.  Membership did not provide any benefits while making reservations or providing extra benefits for your stay. Colleague who is not a member got exactly the same price and benefits as I did.

title: Tiny room ... frosted windows!!
text: So disappointed drove over 7 hours and arrived in our room to find it very tiny and the most disappointing part was we had no view of the city as the windows were frosted.  It is located in the heart of WTC and the room looked nothing like the advertisement.  It felt very closed in  without opportunity to look out a window. Felt like we were sleeping in a bathroom.

title: New York trip
text:
Great location with a great view of the 9/11 Memorial and World Trade Center from the 20th floor restaurant. Located just one block away from the 9/11 Memorial and adjacent 9/11 Museum and One World Observatory (new World Trade Center tower), this hotel is very conveniently located. The food at the 20th floor restaurant was a pleasant surprise, for not only its delicious food, but for it's breathtaking view of the World Trade Center and Memorial. 

The 24/7 Fitness Center was also very convenient, and the espresso machine and snacks in the lobby were a very pleasant surprise.

My only complaint was that our early check-ins were not all available.

title: Great place, friendly staff and service
text: Great location down within the financial centre, close to some great little restaurants and cafés. Lovely friendly staff and a nice room. The facilities down in the main reception were really useful for having a drink and a little snack. They were able to look after our bags on our final day so we could continue to explore the city. The Subway stations are very close by and it is so close to the 911 memorial, such an iconic location. We loved it and would definitely go back

title: Sauberes und grosses Zimmer
text: Ich war das 1. Mal in diesem Hotel und es hat mir sehr gut gefallen. Mein Zimmer war im 9. Stock und sauber und hell. Einzig was mir gefehtl hat war ein Stecker wo ich mein Handy laden konnte. In den anderen Club Quarter Hotels waren diese Stecker vorhanden. Musste mir dann halt einen Uebergangsstecker besorgen.

title: Poor service in the restaurant, other staff were great and room was great value.
text: Clean room polite staff but service in the dining room was appalling. We were kept standing 5 minutes before we were seated in an almost empty dining room then when we asked for coffee while we look at the menus were left to our own devices for another 15 minutes before we had to walk to the bar and ask for the manager to have coffee sent to us. The visit just went downhill from there with poor service and a lackluster attitude from the server. Needless to say my tip reflected the service and that meant we were not even wished as we left.

title: Home away from home
text: Our stay was great. Staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful from check in to beyond check out. Complimentary drinks and snacks in the lobby along with bottled water on every floor was a nice extra. Being able to check our bags when we checked out allowed us to leave our car with Valet and enjoy the entire day in the city.

title: Recommended
text: To be New York . Good room prices. Small rooms. Great cafeteria. Good staff. On 3rd party apps doesn't show the daily cleaning fee so investigate well before. Really good location , close to the world trade center and the metro station.

title: Great find on Manhattan
text: I thought that the location would be slightly less convenient. I was wrong. It is very convenient to shopping and mass transit. It is also much quieter than midtown. The facilities are uncompromisingly clean. The staff welcoming, knowledgeable, and genuinely interested in your stay. All in all it could not be better.

title: WTC Club Quarter - Ok for the price and location
text: This past stay, unfortunately, reminded me of how noisy the rooms could be at CQ WTC. I had an experience that mirrored some of the previous times I stayed here. Late night activities from Inconsiderate neighboring guests and banging of doors that late (mid-night to 3:00a in the morning) could easily spoil your sleep. The walls are very thin and transmit noise easily and the room doors bang  with every open and shut. Also, due to closely packed rooms on each floor with the narrow corridors, noise is amplified. The staff are very courteous and the hotel is clean. Its location is very convenient if you business in lower Manhattan. The amenities are  also good. It's just the noise, especially if you're a light sleeper

title: Great Hotel!
text: Rooms are clean and offer everything you need.  Did not hear any noise from neighbors or in the halls.  Very cordial happy hour - an extra nice offering were the snacks available in the first floor lounge.

title: 2019 New-York stay
text:
The hotel has a great location. 
Indeed, the hotel is very close to the  metro station and different stores and restaurants. My room was clean and comfortable. All kind of snacks, coffee and tea, offered during the whole day which is really interesting. The reception staff members were nice and helpful. The check in has been done really fast, and I’ve been given the opportunity to enter my room before the normal time. After a several hours flight, it has been really appreciated. I would recommend this hotel for a next stay in New York City.

title: Great location
text:
Was our second time at the Club Quarters World Trade Centerp we love the location, the rooms are very clean and comfortable 
The staff are very friendly always helping if you need anything 
We recommend

title: Wonderful view with excellent service
text: Couldn’t have asked for a better view or location in NYC! Service was great and location was close to everything. Views from the restaurant were superb along with the service and prices. Definitely would recommend.

title: Hidden gem in the Financial District
text: Storybook views in pristine room. Staff was uniformly welcoming, professional and accommodating.  Don’t miss the View of the World Terrace.  The balcony overlooks WTC and Memorial; photos you take from there will look like you are in front of a green screen.

title: work and pleasure in Manhattan
text: This hotel is very well located in downtown Manhattan, an area that is becoming more attractive even outside working hours because of many touristic attractions and shopping opportunities. Good restaurants are also available at waliking distance, including Eataly.

title: great location and good service
text: Really good find. Perfect location and staff were super helpful. Very pleased with our stay. we had an issue with noisy room first night and the staff moved us as soon as they were aware, without us even asking.

title: Good Overall
text: This was a good experience. The location is excellent, room adequate and staff is extremely helpful. Excellent food choices in the area from fast food to fine dining. The hotel is in a good location whether on business or vacation.

title: Excellent Hotel in great location
text: We stayed at this hotel at the beginning of a long weekend that included time in NYC and out in Westhampton. The check in, the room, breakfast service - everything was well above what I have experienced in other NYC hotels at this level. Exceptional value for the cost! Very convenient to a luxury mall, subway, Battery Park and World Trade.

title: Nice, clean and staff is super friendly!
text:
If you want to stay at a hotel overlooking The World Trade Center (911), this is the place. You may get a view of the Hudson River, the Memorial and everything uptown.

The lobby is compact but they offer free coffee, tea and treats on the first floor.  The bar/restaurant on the 20th floor has incredible views.

We were greeted very well by the front desk by Sergiu. He told us to have drinks and something to eat at the lounge and we didn't venture far from the hotel because most of the places close after business hours in this neighborhood.

Ro, Mathew Sergio and Spencer told us where to go and we followed their advice. Cabs and the subway are nearby.

We will return.

title: albert in the bar is the best!
text: i cannot stress this enough! he helped make my stay so phenomenal. i will 100% visit this location again based solely off albert! the food and drinks were great, just based off alberts suggestions ! thank you albert!

title: Super Lage!
text: Vorab: Die Lage ist super! Direkt am One World Trade Center von wo aus man mit allen Linien vom Oculus aus überall hinkommt. Oder aber zu Fuß zum Hudson River, Wall Street usw. Die Zimmer sind sehr klein aber sauber. Die Mitarbeiter an der Rezeption immer sehr freundlich und bemüht. Das Frühstück mit 50 Dollar viel zu teuer und nicht gerechtfertigt! Dann lieber außer Haus frühstücken! Die Snacks, das Obst und der abendliche Wein in der Lobby dagegen ganz nett und wurde gerne genutzt. Für unseren Trip war es in Ordnung, mit 1.500€ für eine Woche dennoch zu teuer.

title: Nice with perfect lication
text:
We are couple visited new your staying couple of nights in club quarter hotel. It was really nice room space and hotel location was perfect for us.hotel stuff were so friendly and helpful.the only thing that wasn't comfortable was our room view,it wasn't a big deal. However, hotel gave us several additional offers as a compensation for that. This was really nice from them.

Highly recommended for couples and smalll families.

title: Very Nice and Super Friendly!
text: Everyone at the World Trade Center location was super friendly and very helpful. We got into Penn station and had to make a deadline a couple of hours later for a surprise party on the Upper Eastside, so I was worried about having time to check in and change before hand.  Layla had our room key in her hand waiting for us and Kristin had advised us on the best route. We actually arrived 15 minutes before the next person in our party so it definitely took the stress off. Stored our bags for us as we were checking out a couple of hours before our train left and the observation deck was awesome!

title: Good hotel at special locations.
text: This is a very good hotel at a special location; Downtown New York at WTC (memorial). The room we stayed was more than basic. We could have a room with WTC view for $25 more, but choose not to do it. Because in New York you live outside and we were there for one night. Hotel has a great rooftop which has free access for hotel users, great views!!!

title: Review of Guest Service Manager- Marsha-Ann
text: It takes a person with a certain personality and people skills to be in the Business Marsha-Ann is in. She single handedly made my trip 10x better with her amazing attitude & charisma. Shes the best!!

title: I love this location
text: I love this location. Free snacks and wine from 5PM - 6PM a nice touch. I was a little confused by the two lobby thing going on, but everyone who I interacted with was lovely and personable. Rooms are clean and modern. Wish the prices were a bit lower, but this is NYC.

title: Very convenient location. Amazing staff.
text: Look down at the reflecting pools. Look up at the Freedom Tower. Great bar on the 20th floor. Have Dominic make you one of his famous cocktails. We had room 709. A corner room with exceptional views and lots of space. Kevin, the front desk manager, was awesome and helpful. We love this place. In the heart of TriBeCa. Walk to Battery Park. Play Mini Golf at Pier 25.

title: Good lovation
text: A good location for this hotel, right next to WTC ground zero. Good room with a nice bed. Quiet. Liked the bar every afternoon at 5 pm. Free Wine and snacks. Nice staff and customer oriented. A small gym but ok.

title: Club Quarters
text: The valet parking is a little expensive but I arrived at 2 am and did not want to drive around for a garage so it was worth the money. Rooms are very clean. Great staff. Accommodating on early and late check outs if business related (depending who is at the front desk). Great location. Recommended. It was my third stay at this hotel.

title: Meh
text:
I selected this hotel mainly for its location, everything I wanted to do was close. 
The subway stations, sites, shopping, restaurants okay. 
The hotel overall was good. 
What I didn’t like, the resort fee (which I must’ve missed in the details) was 20 US dollars a day so that “free” stuff you think you’re getting fill up because you’re getting charged for it. 
We requested additional pillows not once but twice and never received any so I thought I’d check out the guest closet on our floor (which is where I’m to find these things) it was empty. 
The room was quiet in regard to outside noise but I could clearly here the coughing and snorting in the room next door. 
What I will say is I probably would not book there again but I’ve stayed in worse.

title: A long weekend at the First weekend in October
text:
This was amazing hotel we had a great time and the staff vert polite and friendly 
we had a great time  fairly pried. Great location it made our weekend  in New York 
fantastic  worth a look in  the room was very big and restaurant very good and all nice and clean

title: Stay Here for Exceptionally Good Experience
text:
Great location for 9/11 Memorial & Museum, as well as Battery Park (for Statue of Liberty & Ellis Island).

Outstanding front desk staff-for check-in & out, questions, and all around pleasant. 

Free holding of luggage before and after check-in times (so gracious about that).

Free drinks and snacks in delightful lounge area, 5-6 p.m. Just what some weary tourists needed

Modern room, bigger than expected; sweet bathroom with new shower; super clean; safe (must use room key to access elevator); comfy bed.

Refreshing water stations (bottles provided!).

title: Great location
text: Best location in downtown. The room was a little small compared to regular rooms but it’s understandable based on the location. We loved our stay there. I recommend this hotel, especially if you have never been in NY.

title: Good location, clean
text: Very good location near subways. Great roof top bar. Excellent amenities. Ease of check in. Clean and modern rooms and property. Recommended for business traveler. Friendly front desk also in direction as a first time NY visitor.

title: generally very good chain, problems with this room
text:
I have stayed at Club Quarters for years, and they are generally clean, conveniently located, fairly priced, free of annoying nickel-and-diming of guests for wifi, in-room coffee, and such. This property was all that, with the addition of a good-sized room and bathroom for the price, especially for NYC. I stya at them a lot and will do so again.

As for this property, I hope management checks room 503 for the mattress, which was so badly collapsed on one side as to be uncomfortable to sleep on. The wake up-call came with a cheerful message announcing that today was May 15, 2016. Probably no one has checked that mattress since then, but please pay more attention and bring this up to the standard of your other properties.

title: Great Bargain and good location
text:
By New York City standards this is a great hotel and great location dependent upon your activities while in Manhattan.  If you're interested in the 911 Museum and World Trade Center area, this is an awesome location.  The rooms are comfortable and the hotel provides filtered water, snacks, coffee, etc both in a public area downstairs and coffee machines in the room.

Comfortable beds and bedding along with clean and somewhat spacious rooms considering this is New York City.  Lot's of restaurants and bars within easy walking distance.  There is an outdoor viewing platform on the 20th floor adjacent to the restaurant and indoor or covered outdoor seating in the restaurant with a view towards WTC 1, Liberty Park, etc.  Food is good as was service the night that I was there.

I would definitely stay here again !  Employees were all friendly and cheerful.

title: Business trip NYC Downton
text:
Describe the service you experienced: Was great! Helpful at checkin and checkout. 
Tell us how you liked the room: Suits my needs perfectly. I like a quiet room with a good view. I also like to exercise in the room. Met all my demands.                                                                                                                                                                 
Talk about the location & amenities: TV not great doesn't connect to my fav channels
Say what you liked best & least: Wish food choices were better.

title: Excellent.
