text: Everything was fine except for the wait for the elevator. The wait was very long at one point. I don't know if all of them were operating. All of the staff was very helpful,  no matter what the request was.

title: Decent but not worth the price unless you can negotiate down
text: Not the four star hotel it makes itself out to be. We were grateful for the support of staff in navigating membership pricing and  changing rooms. Excellent location and views but the rooms are a little beat, the bathroom wasn’t totally clean, and we were sleeping on two twin beds pushed together to form a king with a noticeable difference in height and a large crease down the middle of the bed. Neither in-room phone worked and the room service system was confusing and could not be navigated without calling to the concierge (but again, neither phone worked). Room service is through Seamless but can only be ordered through the TV, apparently, but the menu/instructions don’t indicate that; so we were using various apps and websites to no avail.

title: WILL RETURN
text: Nothing too much trouble for the staff.. Always informative and helpful.. Room and all areas of the hotel were spotless and if you don't do skyscrapers then this 20 storey place is absolutely spot on.. Keep up the good standards

title: visit to NY office 10/8-10/10
text: Front desk reception was very courteous, and made you feel at home.  Staff on the roof top (bar/restaurant) was friendly and professional.  The guest room was cozy, clean, and quiet.  Great location, walking distance from the office.

title: The best deal in lower NYC
text: Nice accommodations, great staff. Cannot beat the price given the value. The restaurant is high up with great views and moderate prices. Service could be faster but very nice overall. If you need something at this hotel, just ask the young, responsive, friendly and effective staff.

title: NY Business stay
text:
Everything was very pleasant.  Loved the yoga mat in the room.  The shampoo and soaps were fantastic.  Was a bit of a maze to get around but all was good. 

The bed was great!  IT was the best night sleep I've gotten in a long time!

title: WOW!
text: Very clean, very convenient, great price and great location!! I was overall just really impressed with the stay. Little snacks provided daily and small breakfast options! Nice showers, hot water and just overall great place to stay!!

title: Great location, nice rooms, great value for money, very competent and helpful staff
text: We had a great stay of one full week. The staff was very competent and super-helpful. Especially, Sergiu but also his colleagues at the reception and the house keeping team stood out. Thanks again. The location downtown is very good, too. The subway is only a few steps away, Soho and Nolita with all the restaurants are close, and midtown is only 20 mins by subway.

title: Nice hotel
text: Good location. Clean. Friendly staff.  Happy hour, snacks & pop offered in lobby area for guests. Great view from 20th floor restaurant. Water bottles & filling stations in each hall, great to grab on your way out for the day.

title: NY trip
text: Room was clean, and hotel convenient to downtown area.  Check in kiosk never seems to work when I stay at the downtown location.  One drawback is the ice machine is located on only 1 floor! Snacks in lobby were great.

title: Beautiful WTC Memorial Park View
text: I booked a King room which I was very happy with, and upon finding out that it was my birthday, the desk manager upgraded me to a suite over-looking the WTC Memorial Park. The room was lovely, the view amazing. I've stayed in a CQ before when there was one in Wall Street and was very satisfied. The room is clean, bed is comfortable, bathrooms are nice, desk to work on and plenty of outlets. Only complaint is the noise from the neighbors going in and out and slamming the door at midnight.

title: Great location, classy hotel
text: Friendly staff, clean, great location for my first time to NY - loved that each room comes with a yoga mat! Easy access to walk all around Manhattan. Quiet rooms, basic breakfast items available. Close to the World Trade Center, with lots of dining options nearby, and also a quick walk away from the water.

title: Un barrio distinto
text: El hotel esta a unos 10 minutos caminando del metro Oculus donde hay forma de trasbordar con varias lineas de metro. Tiene un supermercado a dos calles que creo cierra a las 11 pm. Lo que fue fatal  es que mi habitacion daba frente a la habitacion donde guardan cosas para limpiar y golpean la puerta sin parar. Me comunique a la 1 am y la recepcionista me dijo que me pusiera tapones

title: Une pépite cet hôtel
text:
Nous venons de séjourner 1 semaine dans cet hôtel : son emplacement est idéalement situé. Rooftop donnant sur Ground zéro, à côté de la station cortland/WTC, à 5 mn à pieds de Wall Street, et à 10 mn de Battery park. 
La literie est bonne ! La chambre, spacieuse. La salle de bain est très correcte. Un sèche cheveux à disposition, ainsi qu'une cafetière dans chaque chambre.
Le personnel est très sympathique et très serviable. Nous avons demandé s'il était possible de téléphoner la veille de notre départ pour confirmer notre navette et l'employé l'a fait pour nous. Top!
Sinon, l'hôtel met à disposition un snack l'apres midi avec des m&m's, des crackers ainsi que des sodas et du café. Ca fait partie de la taxe de séjour que vous payerez en repartant (1 semaine pour 2 = 152 dollars). 
Une salle de fitness est également à la disposition des personnes séjournant à l'hôtel mais nous ne l'avons pas testé car plus de motivation après la marche quotidienne à NY. 
Nous recommandons vraiment cet hôtel.

title: Good hotel, good value for NYC
text: Good hotel and good value for WTC area of NYC.  Spacious room and good climate control.  Free bottled water is a nice plus.  I also liked having a living room with flat screen TV in addition to the main room with bed.

title: Lovely hotel right next to the World Trade Center Memorial
text: This is a very nice hotel within walking distance to a number of restaurants and it overlooks the World Trade Center Memorial.  Staff was very nice and they do have luggage storage available if you need to check out but have more exploring to do.

title: New York! New York!
text: A very nice hotel, in a nice neighborhood, close to several atractions. The room was clean and very confortable. The restaurant in the roof top has a wonderful view. Everyday the hotel offers an happy hour very nice.

title: Hotel Stay 9/1/19
text: It is always such great pleasure to stay at this specific club quarters. The hospitality, and amenities are superb. Ronaldo, is amazing as always, goes above and beyond of what we ask. Love this hotel

title: Top of the World View was worth it!
text: Fabulous experience for my business trip.  It was a full week and staying at the Club Quarters was very comfortable. Restaurant was fantastic and staff was super friendly and always helpful. Healthy snacks refillable water bottle and happy hour name only a few of the reasons I will stay here for personal travel.

title: Great Location - Wonderful Staff
text: This hotel is in a great location, within walking of many attractions - 9-11 Memorial, business offices, restaurants and parks. The staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are small but nice for business travel. Lots of outlets for your phone and computer. They have your safety in mind as well, you can not use the elevator without a room keycard.

title: Pricey but good location
text: The hotel and the restaurant were both priced high in my opinion. The room was clean and staff was friendly and efficient.  Great location although there are many options in direct proximity. You should not have a minimum on the characters in a review.

title: Great customer service
text:
First night at this hotel was not that great, loud noise from the street (2nd floor window on Albany street, unlucky), toilet made weird sounds, and lack of toiletries. Upon notifying these issues via email, we were moved to a much better room, where we could enjoy a quiet sleep and properly serviced room.
5 stars for promptness and care for customers.

title: Nice hotel in the heart of NYC's downtown, WTC district
text: We stayed here for our wedding, which was a simple, small ceremony at the nearby NYC City Clerk's office.  Ronaldo (sp?) checked us in and was kind enough to upgrade us to a nicer room with a balcony, so we could enjoy our special day even more.   This kind gesture gave us great memories and also a place to enjoy a small "reception" on our balcony, which had a nice backdrop of downtown.  The hotel's rooftop restaurant also made our morning breakfast nice, with a peaceful and scenic overview of the WTC Memorial & surrounding area.

title: Great Hotel
text: This hotel has everything you need.  Great clean room, comfortable bed, nice shower, keurig in room afternoon snacks and 5pm wine and coffee in the lobby all complimentary, helpful staff, refillable water stations and best of all I had a balcony the size of a terrace.  The price was great too! I'll definitely be back!

title: Very convenient for short business trip
text: As my office is in lower Manhattan area, the CQ, WTC provides great convenience for short trip. Just 3 minutes walk for me to reach office. Great view of the city if you are lucky to have a room with a view. The wine hour and availability of fruits and snacks are added advantages which are not very usual in NYC.

title: Great Property, Friendly Staff
text: Excellent location.  Clean and updated rooms.  Friendly and knowledgeable staff. I have stayed three times at this property during business trips and location was very convenient for my meetings downtown.

title: Great Value
text: Room was quite small but typical for the area. It met all my needs and was nicely furnished and very clean.  I also enjoyed the complementary drinks, fruit and nuts offered during the day in the lobby/lounge area and others mentioned they appreciated the wine after 5.  The Staff were top notch which was the icing on the cake.

title: Club Quarters WTC
text: The Club Quarters near the World Trade Center is a fine hotel. It is close to the subway and a few restaurants and is fairly quiet at night.  The rooms are clean and comfortable. They provide free snacks for guests.

title: Perfect hotel
text:
Stayed 5 nights. The hotel is situated across the road from liberty park with views of the 9/11 museum and world one. Easy to access Battery Park, Staton Island Ferry and the Subway. On  arrival we were treated very efficiently and had been given an up grade to a suite. The room was great plenty of room, big comfy bed, kitchen, 2 TVs very clean. The bathroom had a shower which had lots of hot water. In the lobby they have a living room with free coffee, tea ( if like me you prefer Yorkshire tea take some as hotel only do earl grey) snacks, fruit and cold canned drinks, these were available all day and evening. They also have between 5pm /6pm wine o’clock plenty of guests arrived for this. Didn’t try the restaurant but did go into the bar area on 20th. Also the outside terrace on 20th was great. 
Would I stay again definitely Yes.

title: Splendido hotel nel cuore del Financial District
text: Abbiamo soggiornato qui per 9 notti a cavallo tra agosto e settembre. Posizione molto comoda vicino al World Trade Center e alle stazioni della metropolitana. Camera spaziosa con vista diretta sui grattacieli del District. Splendida anche la terrazza panoramica all'ultimo piano. Unico appunto: alla reception non tutto il personale è stato gentile allo stesso modo. Ci sentiamo comunque di consigliare la struttura.

title: All the little extras
text: The furnishings are pretty basic but this hotel ticks all the boxes on the items that are important to me... comfortable bed, great location, friendly super efficient staff, excellent breakfast , good dining , fridge in room etc

title: Muy contentos
text:
Nuestro viaje a NY ha sido fantastico y una de las claves ha sido el hotel.
La habitación muy confortable y con muy buenas vistas.
Esta muy bien situado, al lado del WTC, zona tranquila y estación de metro muy cerca.
Un detalle importante tambien a tener en cuenta es que durante todo el dia en una sala de estar junto a la recepción hay fruta, snacks, cafe....para poder tomar.
El personal muy amable.

title: Bad and not safe
text: Honestly, I did not have a good experience. When we arrived there was no soap or anything and the bathroom light didn't work half the time and the tv did not work. Then there was a really sketchy situation happening a few doors down from us and long story short the staff didn't come up to check until I called them 3 times. I finally called the cops because I felt very unsafe. Horrible situation and I would not stay there again. They gave me a free night for the one sketchy night, but why the heck would I go back to a sketchy situation again? Seriously, my safety was threatened. I hope the person who was calling for help is okay....

title: Great place to stay
text: This place is a hidden gem. The rooftop bar and restaurant was second to none with a view of the 9/11 Memorial. Kevin Chan the manager was great. Very helpful and accommodating. The 5 pm complimentary wine was perfect

title: Wonderful stay
text: Accomodations were five star! I was greeted  very kindly and the snacks and wine were great. The view on the 20th floor restaurtant was exceptional. The rooms were cleaned daily and promptly. Overall it was a very nice experience.

title: Comfortable hotel in convenient location
text:
This hotel is in a perfect location, adjacent to the World Trade Center Memorial and the new One World building.  Easy walk to Battery Park for trips to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, and close to subway stations, shops and restaurants.
The staff were friendly and helpful.  Rooms are comfortable and a decent size compared to the typical cramped NYC hotel room.  We visited in early July, when temperatures were in the mid 30s centigrade, and humidity 80-90% - so we were very grateful for the efficient air-conditioning in our room.  Communal areas, e.g. elevator lobbies, were hot and stuffy however.
The restaurant on the 20th floor has an outdoor seating area with fabulous views over the WTC memorial pools.  Breakfast is expensive, and the (slightly cheaper) continental option is poor value for money, with little to choose from.  However it's worth having breakfast at least once just for the view!
We were initially given a room on the 5th floor with a tiny window onto an internal courtyard, which was dark and dingy.  However the reception staff moved us on request to a much nicer room on the outer side of the 15th floor, with floor to ceiling windows.

title: Great place to stay at!
text: Nice hotel. Great lobby area with free coffee/tea and snacks! Unlimited fruit, nuts, M&M’s day and night! Fast elevators, friendly staff. Great location with easy access to many different landmarks. Highly recommend.

title: Awesome Hotel & Service!
text:
I just stayed at this hotel a week ago and the hotel and the hotel staff couldn't have been better!  It is the little things like the free snack bar and drinks and the sun terrace on the top floor that did it for me.  It was beautiful.  The restaurant is great too and again the views are wonderful.  I recently stayed at the Millennium Hilton right near by for $480 a night and it wasn't even close to being as friendly and nice as Club Quarters.  I will be returning many times as my son is attending Pace University.  I will never stay anywhere else!  Great value too!  

There was an incident with a guest checking out last Monday morning who was completely in the wrong.  The manager, Kevin took a lot of verbal abuse that we all had to witness.  He did everything right.  He handled the situation like a pro.  I am so sorry you had to hear those words, Kevin!  You are an awesome man and didn't deserve how you were treated.  The hospitality business is so fun sometimes!  I'm right there with ya!  Thanks for the Uber too!  You and your staff rocks!

Tanya, Vermont

title: Great experience
text: The hotel is located right in front of WTC. Location is perfect and in between several metro. Facilities are within the hotel are outstanding. Rooms are well clean, beds comfortable, staff is friendly.

title: Nice room great restaurant
text: I liked the tidy small room. I loved the restaurant and its view. The price at checkout made it worthwhile even if I had to take a taxi uptown for my business meeting. The workspace allowed me to work remotely just like I was in my own office.

title: Maravillosa estancia en el Club Quarters Hotel
text:
Muchas gracias a todos los trabajadores del Club Quarters Hotel y especialmente a Lucrecia por su amabilidad y hacer de nuestra estancia en NY un lugar maravilloso,
Nos veremos nuevamente el próximo año, 
Manuel y Maria Ángeles

title: Highly Recommended
text: There is complimentary coffee, tea, soft drinks, fruit etc. in the lounge area on the ground floor(not just the crappy stuff you usually only get in the rooms). There is also wine daily at 5 00 pm. Great

title: Amazing! Felt like home
text:
We had a wonderful stay at the hotel during our trip in NYC. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and attentive. We were provided with a list of local recommendations to make our visit to NYC felt more unique.

To keep our glowing review short, here are our favourite things about the hotel:

1. Fantastic location
2. Free wine at 5pm
3. A 24/7 water station with free coffee, snacks and sodas
4. Good gym
5. In-house DIY laundry facilities to wash and dry your clothes (free!)
6. Clean and spacious room

We will definitely return to CQ next time. Thank you for taking care of us and adding to our wonderful experience in NYC!

title: Excellent Hotel and in a beautiful area.
text: The view was awesome. Nice rooms and very nice happy hour. Not very happy with the service of the restaurant. Front desk was very polite. Next to New Towers and the restaurants . Plenty of train station and next to ferry.

title: Mi hotel en NYC.
text: Desde todo punto de vista el servicio apuesta al más alto nivel para que los huéspedes disfrutemos al máximo la estadía sin sentirnos avasallados ni presionados. De todos los hoteles que estuve es en el que más cómodo me sentí.

title: Good for business/solo traveller and couples
text: The staff was polite and courteous. They allowed me early check in. I booked a Standard room as I was travelling alone which was quite spacious and clean. The view from floor to roof windows was really good. I liked the rooftop bar and restaurant. The hotel was easily accessible to subway which was the best part.

title: Fantastic position, Excellent service
text: Excellent Hotel, Helped me organise surprise for my sons birthday.  Upgraded our room to a king bed when realised I was sharing with my 16 year old son! Lovely helpful staff, clean and beautifully chilled.

title: Great location near the WTC
text: Really appreciated Front Desk gentleman who helped me with best subway option to get to Times Square.  May be a little tricky to find the first time using Maps, so just ask questions!  Welcoming front desk staff--Loved the snacks.  View from rooftop lounge fabulous!

title: Reasonably Clean...
text: ..., about all the good I can say. Claustrophobicly small rooms, worn carpets, out of date furniture and unhelpfull and not well trained staff. I have been in NY every year for the past 14 years. This has bern my worst stay so far.

title: Overpriced and need refresh
text: Arrived at midnight and ended up on the room above the rubbish exit with no option to open an already smelly and damp room. Shower not anywhere close to 4 stars hotels. No locker, bright light saving bulbs that gives the feeling of staying in a storage room. Only the bed was ok.

title: Staff were excellent.
text: Good room for its value.  Wish the bathroom could be upgraded. Other than that it was great. Wish there was a microwave. I believe some suites may have had but because there was none in our little suite it would have been nice to have a communal microwave.

title: Fantastic
text:
Stayed at the Club Quarters World Trade two Friday’s ago, great views and service!  Thank you Dawn Clark for helping to make our trip to the city phenomenal!  Attached is a pic from the restaurant!  
Would certainly recommend.

title: Great Location in Lower Manhattan near many things of interest
text: The location of this hotel was absolutely wonderful if you want to have greating eating close by...Morton right next door.  Also great location for 911 Memorial and BAttery PArk and Ellis Island.  Subway close by as well as a great shopping and food area across the street within easy walk.

title: Nice rooms, but there is always something disappointing with the rooms
text:
I've stayed here four times recently over the past three months and every time I have had an issue with the room.

The first two times the heating/cooling in the room wasn't working properly and I either froze or was so hot I was sweating constantly.

Last time the bathroom was so badly laid out that any time you tried to use the commode you ended up with the sink poking you in the side so hard it left a bruise.  Oh and the bathroom door didn't shut either so your shower steam ended up in your room.

And today, this takes the cake.  There is a lovely window, opening onto bright sunshine but it's shaded over for some random reason so that even with the blinds open you can't see anything outside your room. Welcome to your own personal shoebox.

I've been a loyal customer for some time but sadly this is the last time I am staying in this hotel.  It's just not worth the money.

title: Should Be Better!
text: We have stayed at Club Quarters several times in the past and have always had very good experiences. This time, not so much. Sadly we couldn't get a room with a One World view. No safe in the room, the shower drain took forever to drain, no tissues in the bathroom-they were in the bedroom...and only 2 bath towels. The restaurant on 20 has that incredible view of One World but the service was really lacking this time. Last but not least, the volume control did not work on the TV remote or at the TV.

title: Pésimo servicio en excelente ubicación
text: Recomiendo ver precios en hoteles de la zona y evitar este hotel porque este hotel está muy mal gestionado. Es caro, porque además del alojamiento cobran por unos snacks básicos, más gaseosas y agua libre durante el día unos USD 22 por día. Está junto al World Center Hotel y como están siempre están rotos los ascensores, éstos se comparten entre ambos hoteles, colas eternas para subir o bajar de la habitación. No tiene caja de seguridad en la habitación ni heladera. Está de moda su roof top por lo que sólo se puede asistir con reservas, hechas con mucha anticipación. Cierran a las 22 hs por lo que los huéspedes casi no pueden disfrutar de esa vista privilegiada de NYC. Tienen muchos eventos privados, por lo que jamás pudimos tomar una cerveza en el roof top. Horrible. La limpieza de la habitación deja mucho que desear, Estuve una semana y no sacaron una mancha en el baño. Las habitaciones de precios medios y bajos no tienen vista.

title: My NYC home
text: Great hotel, I stay there whenever I have to come to my office. It’s like a home away from home! Service has gotten better with each stay. Especially love the wine hour! Not sure what else to say— just try it!

title: Nice
text: I requested a room on a high floor with one world trade view since it was my husband's birthday and I was told we'll get that plus a balcony.  But room was on 8th floor and ,no balcony.  So I was disappointed.   Everything else was quite nice, especially the happy hour

title: Muy buen hotel
text: Excelente atención del personal, limpieza y servicios. Muy buena ubicación. Repetiría sin dudarlo. En el lobby del hotel siempre se dispone de agua, café y snack. Al dos calles parada del metro y a 200 m del memorial

title: Another great stay!
text: Rarely am I disappointed when staying at the CQ Hotel. A quaint room on the ground floor that has coffee, wine (specific times), seating area that’s great for a meeting. Restaurant upstairs is a plus.

title: Another great stay!
text: I look forward to my visits to Club Quarters to relax in between my conferences or just a quick stay in the city.  I walk in and greeted by Ro (who is very  polite/professional), got a  great room and ordered room service.  I love the comfortable atmosphere.  Another great stay!

title: Great place to stay!
text: I really liked a lot of the amenities here like the reusable water bottles and cold water machine on each floor. Sparkling water on tap in the lobby was super awesome too! Free wine @ 5 everyday. Only reason I’m not rating it a 5 is because the walls in my bathroom were a bit dirty and really need to be scrubbed. Other than that, would totally stay here again!

title: Good hotel for the price
text: I stayed here for a week and the staff was accommodating to my needs from start to finish!  I arrived at 730am to the airport and went straight to the hotel; the room wasn't ready yet but they were able to hold my baggage until I got back.  When I did, they had already gone through most of my check-in so there wasn't any hassle at all.  The lounge is also a nice thing to have when you come back, it would be nice if the food and drink was available a bit longer in the evening but as long as you have a fridge in your room it wasn't a problem.  The room was well appointed and clean, and the housekeeping staff were also attentive to a few extra requests I had, too.  I definitely will put this place at the top of my list the next time I come to visit!

title: Great trip
text: Great stay, location and staff. Rooms are small but efficient. I'd rather save on the cost of the room rather than have all the fancy furniture and space that you never use. Get out and enjoy! The World Trade Center is literally across the street.

title: Great Hotel in Lower Manhattan
text:
We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. Apparently World Center and CQ are the same. We booked World Center Hotel and got a room in CQ Hotel. I did not see any difference. When we arrived a girl at the front desk was very nice and helped us with everything we needed. I think her name is Leila. Sorry If I misspelled it. Room was big enough for 3 of us. Also,they brought up a crib for a baby which was bigger than ours. 
Location is great !  Steppes away from a subway, Wall Street, Ferries to the Liberty Lady and other Lower Manhattan attractions. Roof top view is spectacular day and night.
One little hiccup, valet parking took around an hour to bring the car back. Its not on the hotel, since its a third party who does it.
Besides that,we liked the place very much and would return anytime

title: Very happy!
text: The rooms and hotel staff was excellent. Much bigger than I expected and so close to 9/11 memorial. The rooms were perfect. The staff was nice our entire stay and the valet was quick. I would absolutely stay again!

title: A great place to stay
text:
We had chosen a superior room as it slept 3, and were surprised to find it included access to the free snacks and hot drinks in the lounge, plus wine at 5 o’clock if that’s your thing. 
The check in and out were the fastest we had all trip. There was free tea and coffee in the room, along with a small kitchenette.
A great location for visiting the South of Manhattan on foot

title: Cramped, good location
text:
Room was tiny, bathroom small, one washcloth in a room booked for 2, one bedside lamp didn't work.
Great location, 2 blocks to river; restaurant outside seating on 2nd floor looked down on World Trade Ctr memorial.

title: Great Location
text: We loved staying at Club Quarters.  So convenient to 9-11 Memorial, Battery Park, Financial District (Wall Street and The Bull) with easy access to the subway to get to other areas of Manhattan.  The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean.  We would return to Club Quarters in the future.

title: Good Service, and excellent location
text:
Overall I really did enjoy my stay here. The thing I enjoyed the most was the service. Let's start with the front desk, where one of the receptionists, Ronaldo (I believe that's his name, had dreads) was fantastic. He had a list of venues for night life in the city, neatly organized based on what you were looking for and printed on paper. I can honestly say that his customer service and subtle mannerisms exuded nothing shy of professionalism. Now when you go upstairs to the rooftop bar, you got Dominique, one of the bartenders working. I can say that he made me and my friends feel nothing but welcome, was a great conversationalist, and knew how to do some amazing twists on conventional cocktails. These two staff members definitely went above and beyond. 

In terms of the hotel room:
Bathroom - 7/10
Bed - 8/10
Views - 9/10
The hotel itself is great because of its proximity to everything. The subway is so close, the harbor is within walking distance, and that view on their topmost floor of the World Trade Centre is amazing! In addition they also offered free wine at 5 o'clock everyday in the lobby which was a great touch! 

I will be returning to New York again and will definitely be staying at the Club Quarters WTC!

title: Great location
text: Stayed at QC for the first time and can’t say enough about this place... room was super comfy and spacious... for NYC. The free bottomless snacks and five o’clock wine were an added bonus. Staff were helpful... and the location! We sat in the restaurant overlooking the 911 memorial park... it was breathtaking.

title: Excellent
text: Great view from our spacious room on the 18th floor. Excellent location close to the ferries to Brooklin, New Jersey and Statue of Liberty. Shopping center whith food court in walking distance. We appreciated complimentary coffee snakcs.

title: Great location
text: This was a great location for me for a work trip. Small room but I was not in it much.  Nice amenities (coffee, snacks and beverages throughout the day).  Friendly staff. And the rooftop restaurant and bar was really nice to have!

title: great place to stay
text:
Stayed for a week in late May.Hotel is in an excellent location.Room was much bigger than expected with everything you could want for a good holiday.Staff were always friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble.

I would stay here again as it was easy to get to all the main attractions either by walking or subway.

title: GREAT place to stay, GREAT location and value for money.
text:
The hotel's location is very close(walking distance) to the tourist spots like the 9/11 Memorial, One World Tower, Oculus WTC, PATH train and MTA subway. 
The hotel has a nice lounge where you can stay while waiting for your check-in time. Check-in time is 3 pm but during our stay, there were not able to check-in us on time as a compensation for the inconvenience they gave us $50 complimentary GC for their "View of the World" restaurant in which we appreciate because we are really planning to dine-in their the next day. Also, they have a lot of complimentary in the hotel like snacks, sodas, coffee, water in the lobby you can grab some anytime you want. They also have complimentary wine between 5pm-6pm.
The rooms are big enough for the two of us and it has a floor-length window for the city view. he beds are comfortable, there is no bathtub only shower.
View of the world restaurant in the rooftop has a great view of 7/11 Memorial as well as One World Tower so check it out, We dine-in during breakfast and the food is good.

title: Holiday in New York
text: The perfect Hotel for a trip to NYC. Next to the 9/11 memorial and Battery Park. Many subway-stations next to the hotel bring you to midtown. The staff is very friendly and in the lobby you get free coffee, drinks, water an apples.

title: Alternative accommodation in NYC - marginally acceptable
text: An excellent location and that's about it.  Check-in experience was not positive.  Requests for room type and floor preference was not honored despite long lead time.  Housekeepers are not attentive; did not get additional towel and shampoo despite numerous requests.

title: Great location
text:
Great location. However the room service and the restaurant dining menu can be improved. Kids eating options are limited. Lift is slow. 

There is a gym which had all the amenities. Fantastic view of the world trade centre.

title: Great location
text: The hotel is located just steps away from the world trade center and Battery park. Many restaurants close to hotel The staff was very helpful and we noticed when a staff member passed the coffee?snack area they made sure it was clean and stocked. The water station to fill your bottles was a great idea as well

title: Most-Enjoyable Stay
text:
My three nights at Club Quarters Workd Trade Center was very pleasant. The room was clean, I appreciate the environmentally friendly option of keeping the linens and towels from being changed daily.
The Happy Hours were enjoyable, staff friendly, views and location optimal!

title: Great restaurant
text:
Great place to be the team at the restaurant is so amazing !
Jeffrey , Adriana took it of us and the dinner was amazing and the manager Stephen was very nice keep coming to our table and telling us if everything was great ! Just love it and a place to come back

title: Less than expected
text: We weren't given the room we had paid for.  Asked for a rollaway at 10 pm and it took nearly two hours to obtain.  Restaurant breakfast buffet was in a nice room and was a good deal.  Front desk staff were friendly.

title: Small rooms...but Super Cool Place!!!!!
text: My hotel was the Club Quarters Hotel at 140 Washington St.  I had a great room on the  18th floor with a sweet view of NYC, but not of the Freedom Tower or the 9/11 memorials.  The room was very tiny but that was OK.  The bathroom was nice and the bed was nice BUT, there was a noise like a dog barking in the cooling system in my room.  That bothered me a bit but I was only there one night.  The view was great and the thermostat controls are by your bed on a computer type pad built into the wall.  There were plenty of outlets and it’s a nice place….I did hear pretty loud my neighbors doors closing late at night……. The soap and shampoo were the best and having 4 elevators was nice!!! (it looks like there are only two but there are four if you open the door to the other side). Check in and out went smoothly and what a great location!!!!  This is a nice priced hotel in the Financial District!!!!  Close to everything!!!  Freedom Tower and memorials are so super-close.

title: Our trip to CQ New York
text:
We been very happy staying at that hotel. There is a perfekt service provided, we can recommend the wine hour from five pm. Also the rooms are good sized and well cleaned every day.
There is an amazing view from the roof bar

title: Mancata restituzione caparra di 400$
text:
Ho soggiornato dal 27 Giugno al 5 Luglio presso questo hotel.
Al momento del check-in mi sono stati trattenuti 400$ sulla carta di credito come deposito cauzionale. Alla fine del mio soggiorno, durante il check-out avrei dovuto pagare un importo di 150$ relativo alle tasse extra dell'hotel.
Conclusione: i 400$ sono ancora bloccati dall'hotel e mi sono stati prelevati altri 150$.

Imbarazzante che un hotel del genere gestisca in questo modo i suoi clienti.
Dopo più di un mese non ho ancora ricevuto indietro i soldi che mi spettano. E nessuna risposta dall'hotel.

title: Unhappy
text: The room needs to be upgraded badly and thoroughly cleaned. It is convenient to my job and for the most part the staff at the hotel is friendly. Contrary to the reservations staff which is horrible. Also being a club member means nothing

title: Downtown NYC
text: Room was a bit small but very comfortable.  Service was excellent throughout hotel. Great views from restaurant. Wine happy hour is a nice touch! Not as touristy as midtown which we loved. Nice amenities!

title: Excellent Accomodations
text: The hotel  is conveniently located  within a 2 block walking distance to my work location. When I arrived on 7/11 I was informed my reservation from a week earlier was not canceled, I was going to receive a non cancellation fee  and I was my current reservation was now at the Wall Street location. Fortunately I had the prior cancellation confirmation with me as well as the new confirmation for Washington Street. The clerk was extremely helpful, corrected the errors and gave me a room with a beautiful view of the fountains and freedom tower,

title: Très bon hôtel bien situé
text: Très bon hôtel, situation idéale, à deux pas du Métro et à 10 minutes à pieds de l'embarcadère pour visiter la statue de la liberté.Juste à coté du mémorial du 11/09 et d'un grand centre commercial "OCULUS"

title: Perfect hotel
text: Perfect view of ground zero....small room but just what we needed to sleep at night. The free coffee, water in every floor, soda and snacks is what made our stay even better!! We can’t wait to come back

title: Some ups, some downs
text:
First of all, it’s confusing. There’s the World Trade Hotel and Club Quarters and two receptions and two sets of elevators. What this is and why it’s like this I don’t understand. Some stuff can be shared but then there’s blocked door access on other floors.

We checked in at 5:30 pm and our room was not ready. First time this has ever happened to me. The girl working there was kind but her line of ”it’s been a busy day, it’s completely full and there’s a lot that needs to be done before the room is ready” didn’t help. That’s the business you’re in - the hotel business - and all hotels are expected to make rooms available to paying customers on time. She should be trained better.

Our cot was also not ready. Finally got help after chasing twice but the excuses and customer service we got trying to get it was also not impressive. Staff were too chill about it. 

Room was very nice, balcony was cool though needs to be better cleaned (cigarette butts, grime, etc) and view was great. Didn’t get enough new towels every day though.

They did have a laundry mat on the 10th floor (I believe) though which was a great surprise and a big help. Nice and clean in all with a big lobby and close to the 9/11 memorial.

title: Club Quarters WTC
text: I will always choose club quarters when I travel to Manhattan for business. The rooms are decent and for the price considering all that is included, can not be beat. The snack bar is a most welcome sight after a long day of travel, and the 5 pm wine service is a great way for solo travelers to get a bit social before venturing out for a meal. The view of the WTC memorial from the View of the World restaurant is truly something to behold. The staff go above and beyond in their service to accommodate all manner of travelers.

title: Great Financial District Hotel
text: Nice small rooms at a great price.  Some family friendly, some perfect for one traveler.  Across from World Trade Center, close to subway and Battery Park.  Amenities are good, with a nice sitting room off the reception area.

title: No Television
text: Our television stopped working after 4 hours - 3 attempts were made to get it working but it stayed inoperative for the reminder of our stay.  I emailed the manager (Krystin Gimpel) requesting a bill reduction - no reply.

title: Great place to stay in NYC in a great downtown location
text:
We spent 4 nights here in a one bedroom suite with our two kids - the room was absolutely perfect for us with plenty of space considering its location.  Right next to the 9/11 Memorial and so close to the ferry's too.
Staff were friendly enough and were happy to receive courier parcels on our behalf, rooms was clean and well maintained, wifi worked reliably and best of all were the free drinks and snacks and happy hour.
The only negative was that there was a bit of sound transfer since our bed was so close to the door/corridor given the layout of the suite and having noisy guests enjoying the NYC nightlife next door, but this wasnt really the hotels fault.
Would stay here again if I wanted such a downtown location!

title: A comfortable weekend getaway in Big Apple
text: We felt welcomed and comforted by the staff and provided with an excellent service. Located literally two steps away from Ground Zero and tourist ports to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, our well packed weekend getaway fulfilled its promises. And when you come back to a cozy, welcoming nice little corner for the well-deserved rest ... there is the Club Quarters Hotel, who complete the day with their excellent services. Even to catch our flight back we were pampered with the comfortable and luxurious cab (at least for our standards) for which you pay regular fees. Thank you for your services, we will definitely return for our next weekend getaway in the Big Apple.

title: Poor maintenance & noise from hotel guests
text:
1. Room should be allotted only after the management has checked if it is in a proper shape
2. There should be sign boards on all floors asking hotel guests not to talk loudly and disturb other guests.

title: Excellent hotel to stay in NYC
text: A perfect solution if you want to stay in a hotel that is not in the croweded Times Square, that has spacious rooms and great view on the World Trade Center. The only con is the noise from the air condition during the night.

title: Bad experience staying in this hotel
text: Not recommended staying in this hotel room service worse, especially no towels after the room make up need to call them asked for the towels, takes forever waiting for the luggage from storage room, tv didnt work

title: POOR SERVICE
text: Toilet broke and I finally had to fix myself, housekeeping was non-existent and there was always an excuse.  Great location and views BUT if you want service, cross the street to the W Hotel. A couple of nice front desk people but there hands were tied.  Too much finger pointing

title: Excellent
text: Wonderful hotel with a great staff. I have my one year old here with me, and everyone is so kind and helpful. I particularly want to mention Sergio, who has been amazing on so many occasions. He goes above and beyond, and it is very much appreciated. The view from the rooftop is spectacular, so if you stay definitely take a trip to the top floor.

title: Exceptionally great hotel in NYC
text: Easy check in & out, clean & nice room, impeccable service throughout the hotel & restaurant personnel, wonderful views of the city. Reasonable price for NYC hotel in a nice area close to World Trade Center.  Highly recommended!!

title: Great view, great hotel!
text: Perfect service and location. Fantastic restaurant with a magic view over Ground Zero. Complementary wine at 7PM! Will absolutely go back, and it´s close to great Eataly!! Little hard for the taxidriver to find//

title: Fantastico
text: Questo hotel è molto carino. Siamo stati molto bene. Il ragazzo alla reception, Sergio, è stato molto carino e gentile. Sempre disponibile per darci consigli e indicazioni. Il posto è su downtown ed è comodo per andare a Brooklyn e statua della libertà!

title: Internet and tv service horrible!!!!
text: Internet suck very bad and the tv service horrible didn't work 1/2of our stay  we have little Flys  in the room I don't know  were they come from  , after a walking and sunny day you come to your room tired and watch tv, but nooo tv all the time , not even  to cast my phone to the tv, really disappointed but room was ok, view was very nice and clean.

title: Unbeatable views!
text: I have just had a wonderful one night stay at the Club Quarters Hotel WTC. My room on the 19th floor had an outstanding view of the 9/11 memorial with doors that open to the outside (pretty rare in Manhattan) and it was such an experience to hear the waterfall that cascades down the memorial's black hole (thank you Michael for the room with the million dollar view!). Also enjoyed the wine hour and the free snacks available at the ground level lobby lounge. Oh, and even if your budget does not allow you to stay at a room with a view, go up to the 20th floor terrace and you will be pleased. Gorgeous views there for all guests! I totally recommend this hotel and will definitely return!

title: excellent location
text: small hotel excellent location right next to 9/11 memorial, Brookside shopping, Oculus....with downstairs coffee snacks available 24/7 and roof top restaurant with view....staff tries to accommodate all needs and services....this is not a luxury hotel and does not pretend to be but definitely good for business and cost conscious travelers

title: Disappointing
text: Location wise, it was very convenient. Hotel looks nice. Front desk staff were not helpful and was not friendly. Room looked nice but there were stains on the sheets. Room was extremely hot. I was charged $50 more on top of resorts fee that ended up costing another nights worth just cause we checked out 30 mins after 12, which I asked the night before what the latest check out was and was told 12:30. Extremely disappointing!

title: Great stay at Club Quarters WTC
text: Very nice property with great rooms and an amazing observation deck. Courteous and very helpful staff. This property offers a great value for the cost. I use Club Quarters WTC for the majority of my overnight stays in NYC.

title: Nicht empfehlenswert!
text:
Wir sind nun schon das siebte Mal in NYC und dieses ist unser bislang schlechtestes Hotel. Sofern das extrem günstige Super 8 in North Bergen, dass wir in unserer Zeit als Studenten immer gebucht haben, war sauberer.
Das Club Quarters WTC liegt sehr günstig. Aber das ist auch schon der einzige Pluspunkt. Unser Zimmer ist dreckig, alles ist siffig und abgenutzt. Flecken an den Wänden, auf dem Teppich und Schimmel in der Dusche. Der Service ist ebenfalls nicht gut.
Unser Tipp: lieber ein paar Dollar mehr investieren oder weiter suchen!

title: Great Location!
text: Loved the location and the staff and the hotel restaurant on the 20th floor has great food and an amazing view! Be sure to check out the views evem of you don't eat at the restaurant  they welcome you to look.  There is also a sun porch with exceptional views on the 20th floor.

title: Perfect location next to the World Trade Center Memorial
text:
Hotel is in the Financial district but has access to many of NY amenities like subway access, the Occulus center Fulton Street amenities 
A place called Eataly 
This was a great choice based on the price I paid and location 
The hotel also has a great app to do online check in and check out plus open your room door with your cell phone app

title: Fun. Convenient. Great value
text: A clean comfortable room in a convenient location. Walking distance to all subway lines going all places. Convenient morning breakfast and fun evening wine in the lobby. Very safe neighborhood to walk back to after dark. And a great value. I'd stay here again!

title: Amazing staff, Spectacular view
text:
We stayed at this hotel for a couple of nigths and I have to say the people at the front desk are the nicest people, especially Tatti! During our check in we had many questions about our booking and they addressed them all extremely politely. 

When we saw our room, we were mesmerized by the view of Financial District. 

We stayed in a standart room and I have to say those standart rooms are very spacious compared to the other standart rooms in Manhattan area. 

Snacks are avaliable on the ground floor from morning to evening for free. There is a coffee machine as well. Be sure that the snacks are amazing! 

On the top of the hotel, there is sun terrace that has a really nice view of Financial District. Additionally, on the roof there is a restaurant called View of the World and you can dine dinner while seeing 9/11 memorial and new WTC complex. 

In summary i really loved this hotel and I would love to come back and visit this hotel very soon with my friends or my family. Everything has been amazing! Thank you  Tatti for all your help!!

title: 5 Stars!
text: We absolutely loved Club Quarters.. Wonderful staff, comfortable suite, amazing views, and excellent location!! The complimentary snacks were a super plus for the kids. We will most definitely return!!

title: Great location to WTC
text:
Very nice hotel close to WTC! Coffee and snacks are available for free, and wine at 5 PM.
Clean rooms, great service! There are many restaurants around the hotel, shopping center is in walking distance!

title: Average Hotel to Stay
text: This hotel was okay, but nothing to write home to mom about. The elevator situation is not very customer efficient. Always took a long time to come and hot once you step inside. I will say the staff is wonderful. They were very friendly and would do anything to make your stay as good as it can be. For that reason alone, it's worth staying at this particular hotel. It's close to the WTC, which is very nice!!

title: Good price
text: HVAC cannot keep up with the warm weather, especially in common areas.  A used plastic knife is left on the floor, meaning vacuuming was questionable.  A significant crack in the sink and therefore water was leaked to the towers that was stored under.

title: Couple travel
text: ideally located south of Manhattan. Friendly welcome. Nice restaurant terrace with a view of the 9/11 memorial. Lobby with unlimited drinks, fruits, cereal bars. Wine tasting, white and red, at 5 PM. we were in a suite consisting of a bedroom, a kitchen and a living room

title: Wonderful experience
text: Great services.  Staff was friendly and knowledgeable.  Rooms were spotless and comfortable. Lounge had goodies and beverages all day.  Restaurant has great food and an incredible view.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

title: Great Location and Amenities!
text: This hotel was great! Room was clean, staff was friendly and amenities were great. There was free onsite laundry, free snacks in the lobby, onsite restaurants (the rooftop restaurant was affordable but Mortons was really pricey), unlimited free water, in room coffee and tea, and my room has a great view of the 9/11 memorial!

title: Perfect stay @club quarters world trade
text: Perfect place to see things, metro station nearby from were you can go any were. Rooms were clean. Breakfast with an amazing view was great. Free wine between 5 and 6. And you can take little snacks, coffee or thee for free.

title: One of My Best NYC Experiences
text: I usually stay in midtown Manhattan, so I am accustomed to a view of a brick wall. Not so here. I had a fabulous view of the East River peaking out of valleys created from gorgeous art deco buildings with roof top terraces. And the CQ own rooftop is wonderful. I went there for dinner and enjoyed a fairly reasonable meal with a totally unbelievable view of the 9/11 memorial. You can get a decent to-go breakfast there as well, but as previous reviewers said, get a room on a top floor, as the elevator can get overwhelmed. I was on the 14th and it was great. Quiet, with a comfortable mattress and gorgeous bathroom. May be my go-to hotel in the future. Usually hotels in NYC for me have been experiences to endure. This one was an experience to enjoy.

title: Great stay at the Club Quarters, WTC
text: My stay at the Club Quarters WTC was perfect! I had previously booked a room at another hotel and it turned out to be underwhelming to say the very least. I remembered that I had previously stayed at the Club Quarters WTC, so I hopped in a cab and went straight there...and I had a wonderful stay. This hotel is clean, modern, and offers plenty of perks. Ro at the front desk hooked me up with a beautiful room with a great view! I have learned to always book at a Club Quarters Hotel when visiting New York!

title: June NYC Business trip
text: You may as well go for the Breakfast included option unless you're headed out early. You'll need a bit of patience at busy times waiting for a lift. My advice is get a room on one of the top floors. At least you won't be faced with a packed lift when it arrives

title: Great location and value
text: Relocating from California, staff is great, amenities awsome.  I'm in the process of doing totally free washes in guest laundry.  Kevin, Rolando and the other front desk folks are all super friendly and efficient.

title: Our FIRST choice of hotels when visiting New York City!
text:
This comfortable mid-range hotel is now our first choice for accommodation when visiting New York City from London.  We've stayed here many times now, and have never been disappointed.  Here's why we like it:
1.  Rooms are very reasonably priced.  We generally select a superior room, as they offer very spacious accommodation at affordable prices.  New York is not usually known for its spacious hotel rooms, so this is a bonus for any stay in this city.  The hotel also offers cheaper Club and Standard rooms; these are not minuscule by any means.
2. The rooms are light, bright, well equipped and extremely comfortable.  Our corner room on the 15th floor had windows on two sides; it afforded great views of the 9/11 memorial and Museum, and  the One World Trade Center tower  looming skyward behind it.  Views aside, the room was spotlessly clean and neat, with a contemporary, relaxed feel.  It came with a microwave, coffee maker, fridge, and various pieces of crockery, glassware and cutlery, as well as a desk and comfortable sofa from which you could enjoy the beautiful view.
3.  Like most Club Quarters hotels (and there's a number of this chain in New York City), it offers a few little extras:  reusable water bottles with spring water on tap, complimentary drinks and snacks in the evening, and speedy wifi.  There's irons and boards available from a closet on each floor.
4.  We love the location of this hotel.  It's slightly removed from the frenzy of Midtown Manhattan, and thus presents a much calmer approach to accommodation in the city.  That said, it's not in a cultural wasteland, as there are significant New York City sights at  its doorstop. The hotel overlooks the 9/11 Memorial and Museum and the One World Trade Center Tower.  The stunning Oculus, Wall Street, and Liberty Park (for the Statue of Liberty ferries) are short walks away.  Nearby is Brookfield Place with an abundance of eateries and retail outlets.  But like most of New York, everywhere in the city is really accessible by the subway network, and the hotel is only a short walk from a number of subway stations and lines.
5.  The hotel has excellent accessibility to Newark Liberty International Airport via the PATH train which connects Newark - Penn Station directly to the World Trade Center.  The connections to Kennedy International take considerably longer, but are possible. 
6.  Where the hotel excels, and probably our major reason for choosing this hotel, lies with its outstanding customer service, delivered by its people.  Staff are welcoming, friendly, professional and efficient, and extremely knowledgeable.  Customer Services Manage Kevin Chan deserves and accolade. His help with everything, from sights, restaurants, and onward reservations at another Club Quarters hotel, was exemplary, and is exactly how other hotels should be dealing with their clients. 
See you on our next visit to New York City.

title: Excellent Staff + Service + Location!
text:
Great overall staff and service. 
Guest Services Manager Marsha- Ann was very welcoming and accommodating . She will guide you on the areas best activties. 
Location is perfect for walking around the World Trade Center + Battery Park.
Hotel has the best complimentary amenities (snack bar, drinks, wine o'clock at 5pm, bottled water + more)
Rooms are great for a few nights of city life!
This all being said from a local New Yorker! 'Nuff said.
Enjoy!

title: Great place!
text: Our family stayed here when visiting NYC.  Rooms are so compact and efficient but feels like a bigger space.  They had everything we needed.  The kitchenette was a nice help. It was also a great amenity to have free bottled water available all day and snacks available at certain times as well.  The bed was super comfortable as well. Enjoyed the location as well.  Highly recommended!

title: GREAT Hotel, Location, and the Employees are AUTHENTIC...especially Kevin at the front desk
text:
Great location, and the employees there understand how to be authentically hospitable.

Check-in was a breeze, and Kevin was so nice and we had a nice brief chat!  And the room was clean, very good size, quiet, view was nice from inside as well as from our spacious/comfortable patio that overlooks the New World Trade Center!

WiFi was solid and easy to get on, bed was very comfortable, bathroom shower was nice, and the bathroom amenities were pleasant.  TV system was cool with the simple ability for me to connect my device (iPhone, and iPad) and display my content there...and it was east to login to our Netflix account a take in a movie.  The normal TV content guide was not user friendly, and some of the stations had the sound lagging behind the actual content.

Location is great, and I really enjoyed restaurants in walking distance to WTC...such an amazing rebirth of this area and NY...the area is so peaceful!

title: Great experience.
text: Friendly staff, clean and beautiful room, privacy to parents traveling with a child. Complementary drinks and fruits. In loby as well as water bottles in every floor. I would love to stay there again.

title: Great Stay, Fantastic View
text: We stayed 8 nights in a one bedroom suite and were lucky enough to be in a corner room on a higher floor with a fantastic view facing the WTC memorial, it was especially spectacular at night.  The room had a kitchenette with microwave, fridge and coffee machine (which we could not work out but the free coffee in the lobby was great!)  We used the kitchenette for breakfast and some snacks, it was very basic - only crockery & cutlery so you cannot really 'cook' but fine for keeping a stock of snacks for hungry kids.    Our 2 kids were on the sofa bed and the room easily had enough space for 4, we all had a comfortable and quiet nights sleep, although we would have liked an in room safe.  The location was great, quieter than mid town but a few different subway lines close by & an easy walk to Battery park for the ferry cruise to Statue of Liberty.  The snacks and free water was a great extra (although I guess that is what the resort fee covers), we had drinks at the bar on the 20th floor but did not eat at the restaurant, we also went to wine at 5pm a few times and that was great after big days of sightseeing, the staff were all very friendly and helpful.  Special thanks to Krystin who helped us with enquiries before we arrived and for the welcome gift in our room & Ronaldo who was always smiling and welcoming.  It was our first visit to New York and we all really enjoyed our stay at Club Quarters World Trade Centre,  we would definitely stay there again!

title: Acceptable minimum for WTC location
text: Fine hotel just south of WTC. Staff pleasant and friendly, rooms equipped standardly, and service normal. Nothing stands out except for the price of the place, but to be expected for location. Wouldn't recommend but wouldn't actively avoid, either.

title: Excellent Location-Great Staff
text: Our most recent stay was our third visit to Club Quarters World Trade Center and we encouraged four family members to book as well since we were all going to be in New York for a family gathering. The other two couples were skeptical of the choice until they arrived. All were thrilled with the location and amenities. The only disappointment, according to one family member, was not having a safe in the room. We love the location and appreciate the wonderful staff, especially Ronaldo who was welcoming, helpful, and gracious.

title: Surprise fee added at end of stay
text: At checkout, the hotel tacked on a previously undisclosed facilities fee of $21.72 per night, on top of the published room rate and taxes, for reservations made via an aggregator, in our case Booking.com.

title: canadian
text: very good hotel, would like to book again in future, also introduce to friends. nice area, very friendly concierge staffs. the other good program is the snack bar, very handy for guests. thank you for treating us well.

title: Ad un passo da tutto
text:
Per farla breve vi dirò i pro e i contro di questa struttura . 
PRO : 
-posizione : ineguagliabile... ti affacci sulle piscine del MEMORIAL , comodissimo a tutto perché sotto i vostri piedi c’è un enorme HUB dei mezzi pubblici che praticamente ti portano ovunque in Manhattan ( compresa la linea A che arriva direttamente dal JFK ) 
- servizi : c’è acqua gassata e liscia freschissima sempre a disposizione dei clienti 24/24 . Inoltre puoi trovare stuzzichini vari 
-tranquillità : si trova in una strada secondaria e fuori dal traffico ! TOP 

CONTRO : 
CAMERA : il terzo letto è terribile ! Un divano letto scomodissimo di pessima qualità oppure ti portano un letto richiudibile di qualità terribile . 
Se non prendete la camera con vista sul Memorial la vista è su un cortile interno tristissimo ! QUINDI CONSIGLIO DI PRENDERE LA CAMERA CON VISTA SU MEMORIAL ! 
Abbiamo prenotato una camera per 3 e ci hanno portato 2 set di asciugamani !!! Inaccettabile per un 4 stelle del FINANCIAL DISTRICT 
ma il consiglio più grande : NON LASCIATEVI FREGARE DALLA QUESTIONE ANGOLO COTTURA !!! Non esiste ... è un forno a microonde e una macchina del caffè ! No acqua , no stoviglie .... spendete meno e prenotate una camera , tanto è la stessa cosa !!!!

title: Everything was good
text:
We have stayed in a number of Club Quarters hotels and have always found them to be comfortable and in good locations. The one at WTC was no exception. This was the first time we have stayed in this area when in NYC and it was a good choice. The financial district still has plenty to do at the weekend and it’s an easy walk to 3 or 4 subway stations enabling you to get elsewhere in NY very quickly.

Check in was efficient and we were soon in our room on the 5th floor. Room size was reasonably good for NY and although the bathroom was small it was fine for what we wanted. Room had a microwave and hot plate and a couple of fridges although we didn’t make use of them. Bed was comfortable and AC worked well.

Check out was simple and they stored our bags for a few hours before we set back off to the airport.

Would happily stay again.

title: My First Stay
text: I enjoyed my stay here.  I liked the wine at night and the snacks.  I wish they had more at breakfast and the coffee machine is quite slow as they are individual cups.  The room was clean.  We didn't eat at the restaurant but we did go and enjoy the view and some drinks.

title: NY with family
text: Very positive experience for me and my family (wife and 2 sons under six years) i recommed this hotel,  excellent location and excellent value  for price. The resort rate includes wi-fi, snack and water.

title: A little above but expensive
text:
First of all be aware that nothing that they offer is free, they charge and additional "accomodation fee" per night. Actually it is one building for two hotels with two different names so you never know where you are. The location is great, although a very touristic area in NY, everything around was quiet and next to a convenient shopping and dining area, and close to subways. I was given a room with the worst possible view, I think it is the one they keep for solo travelers. Rooms don't have a safe box. Instead you have to come all the way down to the lobby with your things in front of everyone and get locked in a tiny tiny room. Oh, but you do have a yoga mat in your room, everyone knows that is much more important. The capsule coffee in the room is really awful, but that is not to blame on the hotel, coffee sucks all across USA. Anyway they could offer Nespresso or DolceGusto instead. The building has two terraces, one facing the WTC with an expensive restaurant with expensive breakfast, another one with seats but where nobody cares for so if you want to enjoy a drink you have to go yourself to the opposite side of the building and ask for it. 
Some of the lobby staff are ok, but others are not that friendly, they just seem to want to get rid of you soon. Also they should take a look every now and then to check that not all children of one family take over the computers for guest use. A couple of times I found cups and plates lying on the floor in front of the elevator that remained for days without any staff to remove them. The wine event every day is nice but it could be relocated to a later hour or make it last longer. I appreciate the coffee, soft drinks and snacks in the lobby.

title: BEAUTIFUL HOTEL
text: This is by far the finest hotel in nyc. Excellent resturant view of the world on the 20th floor. A special mention to Kevin the manager who made my trip an extraordinary experience. The best views of the freedom tower and lower manhatten. Aslo a big thumps up to Sergio and tatta at the front desk. When ever am in nyc. I always stay at club quarters- World center hotel.

title: Convenient, Clean, Zero Fuss
text: The hotel is at a prime location near the subway and near shops, and because it is Downtown, it is easy to get to all of the great neighborhoods like the LES, West Village, etc. It is clean, comfortable, and quiet.

title: Not Impressed
text: Not worth a detailed review.  WTC CQ can contact me if they want, but I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.  Overpriced, unclean, paper thin walls and two poor experiences in a row is all I need to avoid in the future, despite the super convenient location, in my case.  Bummer

title: Ottima posizione
text: L'hotel e' a due passi dal World Trade Center. Camere pulite e a due passi dal World Trade Center. Dispone inoltre di un ristorante all'ultimo piano con un terrrazzo con vista mozzafiato, davvero imperdibile. Ho trovato pero' il personale della reception poco sorridente e a tratti maleducato.

title: good location and quick service, good manner of team
text: really good place(3 subway lines are there), clean. bed is really good. for any request, answer very fast. 1st lobby, they provide water, coffe, fruits, cookies, chocho whole day, it is really nice service.

title: Great hotel
text:
Hotel was very clean. Every day  a fresh room. 
Coffee,  thea, snacks Every day for free. And from 5 till 6 free wine .
The hotel is nearby the 9/11 monument en musea 2 minuts walks.  There are also shops and the metro station is also at 2 minuts walking

title: Great
text: Our first time at Club Quarters.The staff very helpful, the location very handy for tourists.The 20th floor dining facility has a fantastic view of the World Trade building and the 9/11 site. Certainly will use again.

title: Good experience
text:
Great service!!! Everyone was so nice to us and even gave us an upgrade because I was traveling with injured foot. Room is really clean and can’t hear noise outside at all. 
10 mins walk to subway(with my boot on). 
Overall great place to stay

title: Great Location, just check the location of your room
text:
I have mixed emotions with this hotel. I stayed for ten days but had unluckily been placed in what I believe was one of the worst rooms in the hotel, located opposite the gym and between the elevator shaft so there was noise almost 24-7. The room had a window but a giant pipe blocked the small amount of natural light that would have made it though. Without lights, the room was pitch black day and night. 

I will give credit to the incredible staff that made me feel very welcome and you cannot fault the fantastic location of this hotel. The room was a nice size it is just a shame that there were a few issues with its surrounding.

title: Great place to stay very close to the WTC, Freedom Tower and lower Manhattan
text:
Great hotel
Great location
Super service
Nice restaurants nearby
Easy to visit the WTC and Freedom Tower during slow hours
Close to ferry to Statue of liberty 
Great view from room
Very new and clean room

title: Amazing stay at Club Quarters World Trade Center
text:
Lovely hotel, great location - perfect for Business and leisure. Close to subway, shops and restaurants.
Our room - we had a One Bedroom Suite with sofa bed - was great - perfect size for 4 people, sofa and bed very comfy. The complimentary wine@5pm is a big bonus as well as the free coffee and snacks in the morning! The rooftop restaurant and bar have lovely views! I would highly recommend the hotel and stay there again next time I'm in NYC, you cant fault it!

title: Great Stay in NY
text: We chose this hotel for the proximity of the monuments we wanted to see.  It was perfect walking distance to the World Trade Center and 9/11 museum.  Bc I am recovering from a broken leg I had to get uber to get to battery park where we aboarded the Ferry to see Miss Liberty.  Coming home to wine and snacks each evening was so nice.  The good restaurants nearby was perfect too!

title: Loved NYC but overpriced hotel
text: We visited NYC for 5 days/4 nights to meet up with my family  from Chicago to celebrate my partners birthday.I chose to stay here as it was close to many attractions and had excellent reviews.The hotel reminded me very much of a Travelodge in the UK, bedrooms were small,facilities adequate and it was very much aimed at just getting your head down for a good nights sleep though the bed was very comfortable.The view from our room over towards the WTC memorial pools was amazing as was the view from outside both rooftop bars/restaurant.Everything was nearby and it was easy to catch the metro subway from the Oculus building,a short walk from the hotel.I feel the restaurant could be improved and the food offering of tapas dishes were poor for the price.In summary we had a great time in NYC but feel the hotel was overpriced for what was basic facilities,obviously cashing in on the location!

title: Great price, outdated hotel
text: My mother and I stayed here for a long Memorial Day weekend and we were very happy with the trip overall. The hotel was conveniently located and easy to get to. We chose this place mainly for the price and good reviews. The room was small as are all in NYC, but it was just what we needed, a place to sleep while we were out all day. The hotel was dated and needs updates all over, for example the clock in the room was a very old iPod dock with an old dock (the really wide kind). There was a weird small tablet attached to the wall that controlled the temperature, but it turned off every few hours which was a pain. We came back to our room at 77 degrees F after a hot day I the city and wished the AC was on like it was when we left. Also we did not have any view other than into other hotel rooms which is awkward. There is free wine (2 choices, red/white) in the lobby at 5:00 pm every day which is a nice touch! We also liked the restaurant on the 20th floor with an outdoor seating area. They have decent cocktails and it was a nice ambiance. I would return here, mainly for the low price and ease of booking here.

title: Eccellente
text: Situato in un’ottima posizione, difronte al World Trade Center, a pochi passi da numerose fermate della metro, dalla zona finanziaria e dal ponte di Brooklyn, è un albergo moderno di 20 piani. La nostra stanza era sufficientemente ampia, molto pulita e confortevole (materasso e cuscino comodissimi !). Dispone di una palestra (che non abbiamo mai usato) e di un ristorante interno per la colazione e la cena, caro ma raffinato e panoramico. Il personale è molto cortese (il giorno della nostra partenza, oltre che averci tenuto i bagagli fino al pomeriggio, ci hanno offerto la chiave per poter usufruire del bagno situato al secondo piano). Al piano terra si trova una sala nella quale la mattina si possono avere, gratuitamente caffè, cappuccino, te e barrette ai cereali; il pomeriggio, bibite, arachidi, smarties e altri snack gratuiti. In ogni piano si trovano bottigliette di plastica e un distributore di acqua depurata e fresca, sempre gratuita, da portare con se durante la giornata. Al terzo piano un distributore di ghiaccio. Al piano terra, postazioni con Pc Mac per navigare su internet e stampare le carte d’imbarco. La connessione wi-fi è gratis in tutto l’albergo. Non ci sono piaciuti gli ascensori, la cui logica di funzionamento, incomprensibile, obbliga a volte ad aspettarli per troppo tempo, e il fatto che nelle camere del secondo piano (dove alloggiavamo noi) si sentano troppo distintamente i rumori provenienti dalla strada (me la sono cavata acquistando dei tappi per le orecchie; consiglio, comunque, di chiedere una camera ai piani alti). Nel complesso, un albergo dall’ eccellente rapporto qualità-prezzo, soprattutto considerando gli elevati costi di Manhattan

title: Great hotel next to WTC memorial and museum
text:
Very impressed with this hotel. Highly professional staff who ran the place like clockwork.
We had a superior room with a kitchenette which I recommend, apart from anything else it was a good size in comparison to other hotel rooms in NYC. Very nice bed with exceptional pillows ( it’s the small things). It was a tight squeeze but we also got a roll bed put in for our daughter.
Talking of small things, this hotel goes out of its way to provide those nice touches that improves the quality of the stay; there were free water stations where you can fill up bottles that were provided. In addition to the side of the lobby there is a stand with decent quality snacks throughout the day including tea and coffee and finally wine from 5-6 pm, all complimentary. This kind of thing really does make a difference in a city as expensive as New York.
Finally I would recommend the breakfast in the restaurant in the 20th floor at least once - around $22 but lots of choice and sorts you out before a busy days sightseeing. 
All in all highly recommended. My family were very well looked after here.

title: Voyage professionnel
text:
Service professionnel et, personnel très sympathique et accueillant.
L'hotel est un peu vieillissant mais l'entretien et le ménage est bien fait.
Lit confortable.Situation de l'hôtel idéale.
Restaurant de l'hotel : Service un peu froid et peu accueillant meme si certains plats sont

title: Nice Downtown location
text:
Nice location near 9/11 Memorial and all transportation options.
hotel is good , rooms are good as well without being exceptional (our window was not correctly insulated which meant some exterior noise. I cannot imagine what it must feel in the winter.
Executive lounge available for snacks and drinks: this was really nice.

Positive stay globally to the exception of the check-in process, with a reception staff who told us that independently of our request for double room (with 2 beds instead of 1 queen), the hotel was fully booked and the room we got was the only one possible and "anyway double room doesn't exist in your category of rooms". 
Finally we arrived in the room and it was a double room with 2 beds which proves lack of knowledge of his hotel and lack of customer orientation. Other than that, good stay

title: Nice hotel in Manhattan
text: I kindly recommend Club Quarters Hotel. Good position. Very fast connections to all the City. View is incredible. On the 10th floor was a wonderful image. Stuff was very very friendly. Sergiu, on the reception, was very carefully with us. He helped us to feel very comfortable and to want to come back again. THANKS Sergiu. On the 20th floor there is a restaurant with very very impressive View !!! Strongly recommend. On the 12 floor they have Free Laundry. Very very important if you stay more then 5 days. Overall, go there with no stress. You wil not be disappointed.

title: 3 night stay in New York
text: When we arrived very tired from a long trip,Renoldo was there to welcome us and to show us what to enjoy while staying.Free coffee station available all day.Fruit and snacks available from 5:00 am until 6 :00 pm.Free wine available from 16:00 to 17:00 every day.Lovely resturant on the 20th floor with happy hour from 18:00 to 19:00 every day.Renaldo saw us coming back from Time square,wished us safe trip home.I can recommend this place

title: Excelente
text: Magnifico hotel,moderno y confortable. Perfecto para descansar despues de un largo viaje en avión. Todo muy prolijo y eficiente. La ubicación es muy buena, cerca del subte se llega rápido a cualquier punto de Manhattan. El personal del hotel muy correcto. Recomendaría este hotel  y volvería.

title: Vacance.
text: Très bien au pied du World trade center. Le restaurant du 20 étages et très bien pour le petit-déjeuner. Accueil très sympathique, chambre très propre et literie confortable. L’hôtel est au pied d’un métro donc très pratique

title: New York Trip
text: It was our first time to New York City. We were pleased with the location and how clean it was. We felt safe walking around the area. We could walk to everything that we wanted to do. It was a great trip.

title: Amazing location and friendly staff
text: This hotel is located in an amazing location just opposite of One World Trade Center with a stunning view from the rooftop bar. All staff very friendly and helpful. Nice facilities with laundry, water dispenser in each floor and more. Strongly recommend this hotel.

title: Review
text: We stayed here for one night and the hotel layout and location is great, however its in need of better mattresses, not so hard as the ones they have... other than that great hotel, commended for anyone

title: Great weekend!
text: Perfect size modern room,friendly staff,and a great location. We will definitely be returning to this gem of a hotel. We drove down from Montreal for my husband’s birthday weekend  and arrived a few hours before check-in which was no problem. The front desk checked us in early with a smile. The hotel is located right next to the 9-11 Memorial,  and there’s a short walking distance to the subway which made for easy access to the rest of the city .

title: Amazing
text: Had amazing first time in NYC and this hotel is amazing best nights sleep I have had in ages. Hotel staff very helpful. Had a room over looking 911 memorial gardens. Easy subway links to uptown. Will defiantly go back on day soon. Only thing they should mention is the deposit when you arrive and taxes and charges you have to pay on checking out.

title: a lot of mistakes
text:
They put me in a Suite and then told me they did a mistake and I had to change room during a meeting at 9 oclock pm. 
They put my colleague in another room (who was supposed to be with me) and we had to pay two room first.

title: Great location, terrific staff
text: The rooms are small, yet clean.  The location is so close to the financial district, shopping, dining and transportation.  If you are in NYC and don’t want to be in the mix of time square, I would recommend Club Quarters WTC.

title: Great place - great location, staff, amenities, etc.
text: Club quarters has never disappointed.  First time I stayed in this one.  all good experience, great secure lobby with helpful staff, room just fine, good internet, love the water bottles and water dispenser on each floor, roof top bar is excellent, used the gym and it was well equipped.

title: Want to go back!
