text: Excellent service in a great location.  The staff was incredible - from the front desk to the cleaning staff.  I am a Club Quarters fan, but CQ WTC is now my favorite.  It is within steps of the Oculus and trains to anywhere, so not only a lovely hotel, but really well located. Loved being able to escape the hectic streets around Midtown after long days. The 20th floor patio is spectacular!

title: First trip to NYC
text: We were very pleased with everything at the Club Quarters Hotel World Trade Center. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The accommodations were excellent.  We will definitely stay here again when we come to New York City

title: Wonderful Stay, Special Thanks to Ro
text:
We were booked to stay here for 2 weeks. It is a lovely hotel, very well located. It is right opposite the WTC, with lots to do nearby, and plenty of transport/connectivity accessible.

The Hotel has great Wi-Fi, an excellent rooftop restaurant with a beautiful view. There is also a nice lobby with complementary snacks and beverages through the day, and some wine in the evening.

A special shout out for Ro, who made our trip so much more comfortable by proactively reaching out to us while we were waiting, at the Lobby, for our room to get ready. He saw that we were booked to stay for 2 weeks and moved us to a larger room that had a little more space and an attached Kitchenette. This was an absolute delight. A fantastic gesture.

title: The Bed
text:
Amongst the most comfortable beds I’ve slept in. 

We’d had a long day of travel and planned on staying overnight in the city. We arrived late and were upgraded to a lovely suite. A large room with lovely bathroom and kitchenette, two televisions a desk, sofa and decent view of the city. But the best pet was that bed. Soft yet supporting. Excellent pillows sheets and comforters. 

We really enjoyed our stay. I highly recommend it!

title: I had been to NYC with my colleague on a business trip. Had a three nights stay, cozy in the heart of city
text: Very professional and pleasing front desk staffs, strategically located hotel with all facilities available at doorsteps. Easy to commute and avail metro as well buses,  hop-on-hop-off city tour, you can take a stroll to get a bird's eye view of World Trade Centre towers and can grab Indian food on the streets

title: Will definitely go back
text: I picked this place after reviewing many other hotels in the same area and I was not disappointed!  The staff was very nice and helpful, and the amenities provided made it worth the price.  If I ever go back to NY, this is where I will stay!

title: Great Place To Stay
text: I really enjoyed all they had to offer and the convenience of their location.  I picked them for their location to several places I needed to attend such as Pace University and a rental car place.  It was perfect as the walk wasn't too long to those places and so many food choices all within a few blocks.

title: Excellent Hotel!
text: This hotel is in a great location close to the WTC and easy access to the subway.  Friendly staff, nice clean rooms, great amenities.  Many great restaurants close by, including the restaurant in the hotel.

title: Ottima sistemazione
text:
L'hotel è situato a downtown, a pochi metri dal memoriale delle Torri Gemelle e quindi dalle fermate della metropolitana di Cortlandt Street, del WTC, e di Wall Street e Fulton Street. Posizione invidiabile, dunque, che permette di raggiungere qualsiasi zona di Manhattan in tempi brevi e quindi adattissima per i turisti.
Lo stabile è relativamente basso per la zona in cui è situato, essendo di 20 piani, ma dalla terrazza all'ultimo piano si gode di una splendida vista.
All'arrivo (25 aprile) il ragazzo della reception (Sergio, mi sembra) non ci ha spiegato nulla sui servizi dell'hotel, che abbiamo quindi scoperto man mano (palestra, snack, distributori di acqua, wifi ecc..), ma ha anzi registrato il pagamento di una somma maggiore rispetto a quella della prenotazione. Solo all'atto del check out ho saputo che la differenza era dovuta alle tasse, grazie alle spiegazioni di un receptionist molto più cortese (nero con le treccine).
La camera è carina ma molto piccola, ma questo lo sapevamo, ma la cosa "brutta" è che era al secondo piano, con una finestra ricoperta da finta edera: non passava pertanto un filo di luce nemmeno al mattino, data l'altezza delle costruzioni circostanti e nemmeno si poteva aprire, data la presenza delle rumorose unità esterne dei climatizzatori. 
A parte questo il soggiorno è stato piacevole: la palestra piccola ma carina e ben attrezzata, distributori di acqua potabile gratuiti e ben funzionanti (anche gassata), wifi ottimo e snack, tè e tisante gratuiti nella sala al piano terra durante il pomeriggio.
Il prezzo è buono per la zona in cui ci si trova.
Nel complesso consigliato quindi, pur con qualche piccolo accorgimento che si potrebbe sistemare.

title: CLUB Quarters WTC NYC
text:
This hotel is in an amazing location. Very central and access to all subways so easy to get around the entire city.

Rooms are very clean and comfortable.

Staff are super helpful.  During our 4 night stay, Ronaldo at front desk assisted us numerously on hotel matters and tourist inquiries - extremely pleasant and helpful. Thank you Ronaldo for your help during our stay 

Would stay here again and recommend to family and friends

title: Great Location
text: Everything I would need during a business trip.  Great amenities, room was clean, and plenty of restaurants and bars around to keep me and my colleagues busy! Will definitely stay here again if I am in Manhattan for work.

title: Awesome place to stay when in NY
text: Amazing place to stay close to restaurants, mall, 911, Subways.  Very quiet room away from noise city. Lots of free perks.  Take all the tours you can, took me forever to decide.  Many options. Computer for searches available in hotel, free water, coffee, sodas and best part free happy hour wine at 5 daily .

title: Okay place to stay. Close to Eataly!
text: Asked for a room as far from the elevator as possible but was put in one right by the elevator. 18th floor and the elevators can take a long time to arrive. Good location. Friendly staff. No room safe. Quite noisy...strong vibrations from something....AC units? elevators?...not clear...sometimes the glasses would rattle. Good location for Eataly and Century 21.

title: Overprised motel quality hotel
text: I was very disappointed to see a small closet like  room with dirty bedding for 282 a night. Very unwelcoming, I can not make myself to call this dorm like establishment the hotel... No this is not Hotel. And, I will not recommend this place to my friends.

title: Little bang, big bucks!
text: Small motel-style room at high-end price. Great location, poor parking options (not unusual for NYC), efficient and friendly staff. Close to bars, restaurants and in the heart of the Financial District and Wall Street; just blocks from the NYSE, Staten Island Ferry and Battery Park. Subway available and close at Rector Street Station. If you are in a pinch and must have that location, be prepared to "rough it" and pay for the privilege as this hotel relies heavily on its prime location to convince clients they are getting a good deal. But like the proverbial Empreor sans robes, guests will quickly discover that location isn't everything - Club Quarters would be well advised to up their game if they intend to attract/hold on to customers at that price-point (my dorm room in college was about as small - and similarly appointed. Not convinced up-scale travelers will find Club Quarters WTC to their taste. But if you're just in on a red-eye and only need a bed to sleep in and a shower with hot running water, it should be just fine. But if you are spending more than one night in NYC and don't absolutely have to have that location? I suspect you could do better.

title: Beyond Expectations
text: The services are great with friendly and helpful staff. The Hotel is strategically located at the center of World Trade area which provides ease of access to well known destinations and subway. Plenty of delicious food and nice restaurants are around the hotel.

title: Good location, easy to reach from airport, next to subway station. Snack bar on first floor is very helpful any tasty,
text: Good location, next subway station, near PATH station, easy to reach airport and other location. Near Wold Trade center and 9/11 memorial. At hotel you can get 20% discount voucher to One World Observatory. Breakfast for 24$ per person, but don’t worth it. You can get  Free coffee and snacks at launch. Stuff is friendly and nice, always ready to healp.

title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel ,very welcoming , perfect location , fantastic amenities,even hough we had booked a small double we had a very spacious room and comfortable beds .If planning a city break to new york you cant go wrong with this gem .The free drinks n snacks were a great bonus.

title: Very good weekend stay!
text:
My wife and I brought a friend who was visiting from Italy for a weekend visit. The location of this Club Quarters, right by the World Trade Center, was perfect -- a great view and exciting area for our guest to visit. 

The staff was courteous. The breakfast in the restaurant high atop the 20th floor was superb. The rooms were clean and neat. Overall, an excellent stay!

title: Highly recommended
text: Everything about my stay was great. Great location, nice size room, comfy bed, appreciated the complimentary filtered water, snacks, tea and coffea, Highly professional staff. No in-room safe deposit box is my only complaint.

title: Good hotel, Horrible management
text: I had one of worst experiences in my life dealing with staff at this location. From given room with stained bed, to charging my card without consent and don't get me started on that Kevin supposed "manager"

title: Kind and helpful staff
text: This was my first trip to NYC, so I needed a lot of help figuring out how to get around and organize trips. The folks at CQ were incredibly friendly, helpful, and treated me with kindness and care. I really appreciate their help. Also, the room itself was nice, clean, and very reasonably priced!

title: Excellent location, excellent hotel staff, excellent everything
text: This modern hotel is located right opposite The memorial park and museum where the twin towers once stood before 911. The hotel is clean, bright and well appointed. Thanks to the wonderful Stephanie on the reception desk we were able to upgrade to a great room that faced out towards the memorial park and new Freedom Tower. The room had a comfortable 6 foot bed, microwave, fridge, coffee/tea maker and large flatscreen TV. A nice touch from the hotel was the availability of snacks and soft drinks and hot drinks all day long in their club lounge for all guests. The convenience of this hotel is second to none being in close proximity to the World Trade Center and the Westfield shopping mall plus many other attraction. Most importantly the staff were courteous, helpful and friendly. What more could anyone want. Highly recommended for your stay in NYC.

title: Great Deal in NYC! One of the best place in town!!
text:
I was planning my third stay in New York months prior my arrival, and since the very first moment I got in love by the photos and description of this hotel.

The hotel is not in the city center though it has a great location. It`s near from 3 subway lines, and for us that was a differential (even though we prioritize walking over getting subway). As we got the Air train from JFK to the city, it was very easy to arrive in this hotel.

We got blown away with the room! First because it is quite larger in comparison with most of hotels in NY. We were granted with a king size bed, and our room had a breath taking view from 9/11 Memorial. Sheets and towels are in excellent quality. 
Please note that the room has minibar as well!! This is a great deal, and again, most hotels in NY don`t offer this benefit. 

Other points that must be highlighted as well: unlimited chilled bottled water, coffee machine in the room, hair dryer, iron and ironing board (this was excellent as well!! we had to use in some of our clothes), 24/7 gym (I personally got amused by this, since I work out daily), the "snack attack" table (another excellent touch CQ!! congrats for this great table full of snacks, beverage, and coffee machine all for free), free wine from 5pm to 6pm (we enjoyed this so much, specially those rainy days after long walks around manhattan).
**Free Wi-Fi with outstanding signal!!** They also offer a space with computers so you can check your e-mails, get your boarding pass back home, or just surf in the internet.

The rooftop has an outstanding view!! We visited it in our last night stay in the hotel and had some drinks. It is a very calm and pleasant space.

Travellers, sorry for this big text, but we really loved this hotel and wanted to express to you how satysfied we got. If you are in doubt, choose the option that will be the best cost benefit to you!! CQ Hotel will definitely be this number one option and will blow away you as we are.

Congrats to all the staff for the great amenities, service and overall experience. We will choose you again for sure in our next stay in NY or in other cities you may be. :)

title: Beware of terrace service
text: Location is very convenient, near the financial district. Revision rooms are ok, rather small. Might just be the average for the city. Service at the terrace bar was terrible, do not waste your time in there.

title: All in all ok.
text: We were not satisfied with the service of the roof terrace. A waiter pulled the plate from the table while we had breakfast.Only 1 small window available. The room was very dark even at daytime. ******

title: A great find in NYC
text: We liked everything about this hotel.  Location next to 9/11 memorial was very good, being convenient with a good variety of transport links but also away from the mayhem of Times Square etc.  Lots of places of interested within a shot walk too.  Wall at, Brooklyn Bridge, Staten Island Ferry etc.  Hotel provides good tea, coffee in lobby 24/7 asking with fresh fruit and snacks most of the day.  There are m&ms, peanuts, banana chips and sunflower seeds, all gluten free (or at least not containing gluten, which I are and was fine).  Each floor has water bottles to help yourself to and the is also still, sparkling water and cans of coke in a fridge downstairs.  Wine between 5 and 6 in the lobby was another welcome addition.  Staff were great and helpful.  We took an Uber from Newark for $42 but price for return was going to be $80, so we took a tube to Penn Station and the airline train straight to Newark.  Total was just over $15 each.  The PATH is also available next door but sit at weekends at the moment.  In all it took less time to go by public transport, so we would definitely do that next time.  Dos Toros opposite Staten Island Ferry was great for a food but loads of places to eat close by.

title: Love this place
text:
The location turns out to be very convenient for us, as we have family in Tribeca and can walk there easily to visit. We also felt safe returning late at night, no problem.

The proximity to WTC is convenient for tourists too, the 9/11 Memorial, Occulus, etc. So much to see!

The room was large and comfortable though the bed was a double not queen size.  The living room is always a welcome extra, with the snacks and drinks available, and comfy sofas to relax and socialize.

title: Location, Staff & Amenities
text: This is first time I have stayed at one of the Club Quarters properties in downtown NYC. I have to say this one has become a fast favorite. We first encountered Ronaldo at the front desk. He could not have been more professional, helpful and cool under pressure. Very friendly and knowledgable of just more than the surrounding area. This location has tremendous views of the Freedom Tower and Reflecting Pools from The View of the World lounge on the 20th floor. In addition, the hotel offers snacks in the Living Room plus Wine at Five. Nice way to wind down your day or start your evening. CQ WTC is a great central location for exploring downtown New York City, plus access to many of the subway lines, attractions and restaurants. A must-see is the 9/11 Memorial Museum. Not the happiest activity to do, but extremely well-presented and informative while maintaining the respectful dignity of this tragic, historic event.

title: perfect position and great view
text: We stayed 6 nights and absolutely I could raccomend this hotel. Many service in room and in the lobby.  Bed so comfortable!!! perfect position to visit Manhattan and Brooklyn, the subway is just 2 minute walk. The hotel is very near the 9/11 museum and memorial. Great hotel.

title: Splendida esperienza peccato l’inizio..
text:
Siamo arrivati il gg 25/4 per ben 3 volte ci hanno dato camere inadatte ad ospitare 3 persone (avevo pagato per una suite...) finalmente il giorno dopo ci hanno dato la sistemazione per la quale avevamo prenotato ...potete capire il disagio alla fine per “ammenda”
ci hanno “risparmiato” gli addebiti del club circa 22 dollari per notte 
Camera molto bella al 17 piano 
Asciugamani sempre carenti eravamo in 3 mai una volta il kit completo come anche le tazze ... 
per il resto tutto positivo pulizia cortesia dello staff (tranne quando siamo arrivate ..) 
Posizione strategia zona super sicura

title: Great Locale and High Tech convenient
text: Really a lovely hotel.  Balcony, phone is your key and remote control.  Yoga Mat in closet and I didn't verify, but a yoga class streaming on the TV.  How nice is that.  And compared to the other hotels in the area.  The price was definitely right.

title: Don’t expect good customer service here..
text: I have stayed at Club Quarters properties sever times and never had any complaints. This time I booked 2 nights on the same day of check in. All was smooth and easy. Due to a family emergency I had to check out a day early. The man at the front desk said he was unable to check me out because the system would not allow him to. He advised I would get an email the following day. I did not. I then called the hotel to explain my situation and asked to be credited for the night I did not use. They acknowledged I only stayed one night and credited only the service fee and directed me to call Amex Travel for the additional credit for the one day I did not use. Amex advises the hotel needed to authorize the credit. After waiting a month Amex received no response from the hotel and I proceeded to dispute the charge. I was told I could not be credited for the one night I did not use because the hotel stated I didn’t advise I was checking out and called the hotel two days later. The hotel already acknowledged on record I did not stay the second night with the refund of the service fee and due to their incompetence and unwillingness to be fair they have lost a customer:

title: Hotel amenities and actual stay was good - frustrating check in/out experience
text: This was for a business trip and I had trouble with using my corporate card upon check in (the room was already reserved on this same card). I was told I needed to provide another credit card to authenticate my identity, but that this card would not be charged for anything, so I gave them my personal card for these verification purposes only. Upon check out, without asking, they AUTOMATICALLY CHARGED MY PERSONAL CARD. The mistake was noted and they said they would cancel the transaction and charge the correct corporate card. Today I noted that the charge was not cancelled on my personal card, and charge went through. I need to check if they double charged me on my corporate card and figure out what happened and how to rectify.

title: Could be better
text: I was really surprised with the location. Nice view from above and near the Oculus and several places to eat. At the street, the view is not so good, mainly because of the Port and Autorithy Comand Center, just in front at the hotel. The place has a modern and confortable decoration, and facilities, very clean. They offer free wather, sodas, coffee and some snacks, that provides a good savings to the guests. My room shower was leaking a lot. Personally I don´t like big soft mettress and pillows, they hurt my back, and because of that i couldn´t have a proper rest. I missed a concierge service, there are few people at the front desk, sometimes only one, so it's hard for them to help the guests on more complicated matters, and they show some irritation when this is asked of them. Except in the reception and the ground floor, the interior of the hotel is too hot. Because off the lightness, the shower curtain always sticks in our legs. I felt a lack of patience and kindness on some off the staff, but this was more than compensated by the good will of Arnold, Mick, Stephany and Ro. At the end, where these people who made my stay at the CQ worth it.

title: Very good hotel
text:
We stayed three people for ten days it was very good hotel with great location 3 minutes away from subway and very close to the One World Trade Center .
The service was excellent thanks to Ronaldo and Leila !!!

title: Everything was excellent
text: I can highly recommend Club Quarters overlooking the world trade centre.  The location is amazing with lots of local shops and places of interest.  The facilities are really excellent with very welcoming staff.

title: Smooth process, great service
text: Everything went well, the process was smooth from the booking until the check out. Very well managed, great customer service. The room was very nice and clean with a lot of space. The position was great, with awesome views over the World Trade Center and close to the subway. Highly recommended!

title: Nice location
text: very close to World Trade center, and everytime we pass by, we remembered that time. Those people offered their life. Close to ferry, to Liberty, wall Street is just in the corner. Trinity and Saint Poul Church is also closeby, we enjoy very mixk

title: Schlechtes Zimmer im 4. Stock!
text:
Leider hatten wir das Pech im 4. Stock ein Zimmer zum Hinterhof zu bekommen. So gab es kein Tageslicht im Zimmer, es roch modrig und muffig. Reserviert hatten wir für 3 Personen, leider fehlten die Handtücher. Außerdem gibt es eine Küche ohne Geschirr. Auf Beschwerde an der Rezeption wurde lediglich gesagt, sie könnten etwas in unser Zimmer sprühen gegen den Geruch. Ein anderes Zimmer gäbe es nicht. Dieses Zimmer war eine absolute Zumutung!
Das Personal war bis auf die Mitarbeiter an der Rezeption freundlich.

title: Amazing Experience
text: Well equipped facility, location is prominent and service is good. Snack facility helps for people who has just checked in and can avail the facility to eat. WIFI is strong and can be easily access. Overall supeb experience

title: Fantastic View
text: Great view of ground zero from the room which had lovely big windows and was light and airy. Was lucky enough to have a corner room which I believe is bigger than the majority.  Appreciated the glass of wine and snacks at 5 especially as I was working.  Breakfast good.  Location excellent.

title: Feb 19
text: Fantastic location, the room was ok. Very clean, nothing fancy. The view from the 20th floor is amazing. Food is excellent in the hotel, but overpriced to me (first time in NYC). From a starting point each morning, this was terrific for what we were wanting to accomplish.

title: Misleading photos
text: The hotel is in a good position if the bulk of your time is spent in the Financial District. The beds are uncomfortably soft and the photos on the website are very misleading - you definitely don’t get the room you paid for

title: Great Location, Great Rooms, Great Value
text: Staff competent, courteous, responsive. Room: large, quiet, with small kitchen. 20th lounge magnificent views, great food, and friendly bar. Fitness centre on 6th. Wine at 5:00 pm in business lounge everyday, free. Great value for the money.

title: Unpleasant surprise afterwards
text: The hotel was clean and good in many ways, however we noted in the check-out phase that so called facility fees were charged. Now we understand this to be a rather common practice in urban hotels but to us it was an unpleasant surprise.

title: Unterirdischer Kundenservice
text:
Habe ein Zimmer für 3 Personen gebucht. Da ein Queen bed dafür nicht ausreicht, habe ich eine Nachricht an das Hotel geschickt und mich nach der genauen Bettenzahl erkundigt. Erhielt zeitnah eine Rückmeldungs des (namenlosen) Guest Service Managers, der fragte, ob er uns in ein Zimmer mit 2 Doppelbetten einquartieren soll. 

Das wäre für mich in Ordnung gewesen, leider habe ich auf meine Antwort sowie mehrfache Nachfragen seit Ende März keinerlei Reaktion mehr erhalten. Sorry, aber das geht überhaupt nicht, weshalb ich meine Buchung storniert habe.

title: Awesome NYC Experience
text: This hotel was in a great location! It was right next door to the 9/11 museum and was within walking distance of several subway entrances, battery park, and Chinatown. Despite being in the city, the hotel was exceptionally quiet and in a very safe area. We had a small suite with one double bed, a kitchenette, and a single pull out bed. The hotel also had complimentary breakfast and lunch snacks. We would certainly stay here again!

title: It's the only place we will stay in NYC.
text:
CQ is clean, friendly, and is the only place my wife and I stay when we visit the city.  Beds are comfortable, pillows big and fluffy.  There's a desk with chair and an additional chair for reading in each room we've been in.  The bathrooms are spacious and spotlessly clean.  The hotel has two elevators that are extremely fast.  If you want to go up from the ground floor to the 20th floor outdoor patio, it will take about 15 seconds.  
We love this hotel.

title: Great location, average rooms
text: The location is unbeatable for New York. right next to WTC and 9/11 Museum and Calatrava Metro station. Room was dark (no daylight-room inward) Room temperature always cold even when Airconditioning was turned up to 78 F. They gave us a heater to stay warm. Nevertheless for a 4 star Hotel that should not happen. Breakfast only all you can eat at 16$ or more. No regular breakfast. All in all 3 out of 5 points

title: Simple, comfortable and functional
text: The room had a fantastic view over the WTC memorial, and was comfortable and functional. Multiple places to put bags was great. The desk would have been great to do some work from if I had been working from my room on this trip.

title: Quality and price do not correspond
text: Apart from the very friendly front desk staff, something is off with the service at this place. I arrived and then got in bed in the evening to find that my bed had only 3/4 of the bottom layer sheet. It was a hassle to get the sheet changed, requiring me to go down and show the front desk staff person a picture and then having the person who came up immediately ask me why I hadn't reported the issue earlier. Is it normal to check and make sure that your bed is made properly at this type of property? I think not. I also found myself sinking down every night between the two single beds that were pushed together into a king. Additionally, I found a previous guest's extra suit jacket buttons on the desk next to the coffee maker tray--yuck!! It also seemed like they were skimping on towels in the bathroom, but that was just the icing on the cake. Overall, I'd just say they charge a lot of money and the service doesn't even match some of the more consistent mid-market brands in the area.

title: My go-to hotel in NYC
text: I have probably stayed at 50+ hotels in NYC, but I tend to always return to this little gem in the financial district. If you are looking for a no-nonsense hotel with all the necessary amenities, good bed, quite room, large enough bathroom and nice room service, this is the place for you. also: The financial district has become a very lively neighbourhood in recent years (compared to 10 years ago when this part of the city was dead on the weekends and evenings) with the new World Trade Centre, the shopping malls and proximity to the large Fulton Stop Subway station. Also: if you go during the spring and summer months, you should take advantage of the amazing rooftop bar of the hotel. There is really nothing bad that can be said about this hotel. I will definitely return again soon!

title: Hôtel agréable idéalement situé dans Manhattan
text:
Parti en voyage avec ma fille en août 2018, j'avais réservé cet hôtel quelques mois auparavant et je n'ai pas été déçu. Il est idéalement situé dans un quartier calme, juste à côté du mémorial du 11 septembre et du One World Trade Center. Vous êtes à quelques rues de Wall Street, du Charging Bull et du quai pour le ferry qui se rend à la Statue de la Liberté. Les stations de métro sont à proximité, vous avez le choix entre différentes enseignes pour le petit déjeuner, le déjeuner et le dîner. Personnellement nous allions souvent chez Dunkin' Donuts le matin et au Café Bravo le soir pour prendre un plat chaud à emporter avec un dessert que nous mangions dans notre chambre d'hôtel. Cela permet d'avoir un budget raisonnable pour les repas.
Le personnel est très serviable et souriant, le rooftop est très agréable et vous avez une collation gratuite entre 17h et 19h avec jus de fruit, verre de vin et cacahuètes ou céréales...
Je recommande cet établissement +++++++++++++

title: Very comfortable and convenient
text:
A real find.  I was given an upgrade which was great---my room had plenty of space, a desk with a good light, a kitchen sink and fridge, an excellent modern bathroom.   It was all spotlessly clean.  It was quiet and the bed was very comfortable.      The free coffee (real espresso) from the machine in the lobby was great, as was the fresh fruit.   The location is good, and it was very easy to get from Penn Station (15 minutes on subway) and also to JFK by the A line subway.   The desk staff were very helpful too.   

The only thing is that the breakfast in the 20th floor restaurant was a bit average.   Rather limited choice, and only packeted sliced bread.  It was included, but if I'd paid the ticket price I'd have been disappointed.  But that is a very small issue, because there are loads of diners around if you eat serious breakfast (which I don't really).  The hotel has a really nice "minimalist modern organic" feel to it but I suspect the restaurant is operated by different management.

title: Good location and price
text: Next to WTC Station. Free filtered water and snacks were nice touches. Great value compared to many other New York hotels. Some noise from loud doors opening and closing nearby and from the street (but this is common at most hotels).

title: Amenities in itself are worth the stay.
text:
Complimentary wine, water, and snacks in itself speaks for itself. Rooms were clean, efficient, and worth the money. I am now a CQ member for life. Beds are super comfy and plush. 

Con: Hard to get an elevator took the stairs 90% of the time.

title: Well located, Clean and Good Value
text: The hotel is located right beside the World Trade Centre so is handy for either Business or tourism. Rooms are not big but not unusually small by NYC standards. Check-in is quick and efficient - and also friendly. There is a bar/restaurant (indoor) and an outdoor terrace on the roof which are very pleasant.  It is a few minutes’ walk from both the Oculus Shopping Mall and Century 21 (depending on your budget!). All in, a good place to stay in Downtown NY.

title: Hotel and location good, but "facilities fee" and staff not so much
text:
I first stayed here five years ago, and not much has changed since then -- except the mandatory $20 per day "facilities fee". Don't get me wrong, the hotel is well-maintained and the location is great for downtown, but this new tax feels like a sneaky way to inflate the price while adding no new value.

The staff are also hit and miss -- some are super-friendly and helpful, but others not so much. In particular, the staff dealing with a fire alarm that caused a building evacuation at 11pm during one night made me seriously doubt our safety if this would have been a real fire. No one acted as a fire marshal, one staff member was rude to several guests, and the communication was ineffective (and contradictory).

title: Spectacular view
text: The room was clean, quiet and tastefully decorated; the view from my 16th floor room was spectacular. It was conveniently located for me as i wanted to be near the WTC and my family in Jersey City. The roof top restaurant was a plus to enjoy a glass of wine and the view.

title: Excelente atención, altamente recomendable
text: Excelente ubicación, muy cómodo, y lo más importante es la atención del personal del front desk: LUCRECIA LORA, la número uno, amable, cálida, siempre nos facilitó todo, una genia!! También Stephy y Arnold. Sin duda impecable elección. Muchas muchas gracias por atendernos tan bien siempre!!

title: Great location
text: Parking was a little over-priced but the hotel, location, view, service and staff was all amazing!! Went on a weekend get-away, while in Jersey on business! And it was the best choice, in 2 days got to do n see plenty, and at the end a great night’s rest!! I would definitely come back here again!!

title: Never disappointed
text: Always appreciate the staff and facility personnel continued effort to ensure their guests are well taken care of.  I am a frequent customer and rarely disappointed at my experience.  Room service is a plus when you check in late.  Another great stay!

title: Great Hotel
text: This hotel has great access to multiple subway lines, so you can get to almost anyplace in the city efficiently. Staff was very good, Rooms are clean, a little bare bones but you go to New York to get out and not hang out in your room

title: Great modern hotel very close to One World Tower
text: From check in to check out, the staff were extremely friendly and efficient (especially Ro and Andrew). The small extras (drinks and snacks in the lobby, top up points for bottles water) all helped make this a very pleasant stay.

title: Good affordable hotel near World Trade Center
text: Having stayed at the Club Quarters Wall Street, I wanted to try this location as it was also close to business locations. I found this facility to be much nicer as it is newer. The lounge room was always busy, there was a restaurant as well as room service and the front desk people were helpful. It's really close to the Wall Street area, as well as Occulus and Brookfield Place if you need to find somewhere to eat. Overall a good experience.

title: Excellent hotel and staff!
text: The staff at HQ was incredible frim the front desk, cleaning service, and resturant staff. One staff member, Ro, accommodated us after receiving horrific service from the nearby Holiday Inn. I will be back!

title: Quick Trip
text: Excellent Location. Near to World Trade Center Subway Station. Great view of Memorial 9/11. Easy On-line check in. You can easily walk to State Cruises Ferry to Statue of Liberty from Hotel. Although, the rooms are small, they are very comfortable.

title: Excellent location to WTC
text: I am so glad to have booked this hotel.  Our staff worker was amazing, hotel was exceptionally inviting, and the community coffee and snacks in the guest room was the icing on the cake. Delicious latte and cappuccino always available. When we opened our window and looked out, we could see partial view of the south pool.  What a sight. It was during winter, approx 30 degrees F, and being from Hawaii, we were really cold but walked the Hudson River walk, china town and enjoyed touching the snow. A great vacation indeed. There is a new structure that looks like a white eagle, it is a must see. What talented people to build something like that. It is also a mall.

title: convenient to WTC
text: For a business meeting at 7 World Trade Center, this hotel is extremely convenient, comfortable bed, cost-effective, and quiet. The room is small like most NYC hotel rooms, and has no desk.  The shower is created by a rubber gasket on the floor and a shower curtain.  There was a wine hour with bar snacks at the end of the day.

title: Not great
text: Disappointing overall,  room with huge support pillar in middle and located beside noisy lifts. Room not cleaned on day two of four. Breakfast hot items actually cold and coffee luke warm. Front desk staff were friendly though.

title: Great Location, Great Hospitality, Great Views
text: This is a great home base for exploring NYC as you are right near the oculus building and can catch a train easily. They provide really good coffee and snacks in the lobby as well as soft drinks which was a nice bonus, along with the complimentary wine happy hour every evening. The restaurant and terrace on the top floor had great views.

title: Eh
text: The hotel room was small and not a "suite" as suggested.  Hotel itself is nice and well situated but the rooms are lacking.  They are dated looking, did not smell great, the bathroom was small and are missing little things like Q-tips, shower cap etc.

title: What a view!!
text: What a view of our room!! What a very very nice stay!! Dawn A at the front desk was pleasant and made us feel welcome! Service was great, food was delicious and the accommodations meet all my needs! Everything you need is within a perfect distance.

title: Had a hard time finding it
text: It was a very nice hotel and loved the room.  The room was much bigger than the other Club Quarters where I previously stayed.  But the address on GPS kept sending me around the hotel for over 45 minutes.  I finally called the hotel which gave me another address to put in the GPS and I finally found it.

title: Not what the piciture shows
text: The decor and guest service is great..However, the room was not what it looked like in the picture displayed on your site. Its nice, but as far as the balcony and set up without the couch that i expected was not there. Also, one MAJOR important thing in the digital age we live in - is the ability to have a GOOD cell signal at ALL times. I had to TEXT or wait until i got outside to contact friends and family.

title: Best experience for our first New York trip
text: For our first time heading to New York this hotel made it soo comfortable! Loved the room and how easy it was to get around . The staff was very friendly and welcoming! We are looking forward to staying again!

title: Feels like home now!!
text: I used to work in one of the Twin Towers and have always loved this area of New York. When I see the Freedom Tower, the reflection pools, and the museum, I feel the power of hope. We have recommended your hotel to friends and relatives. Everyone who has taken our advice has been very pleased.

title: Solid Business Traveler's Option by WTC
text: Great hotel, 5 stars if they get better beds.  Have nothing but good things to say about the staff.  Location is great, walking distance to Battery Park.  Right by WTC.  Public transportation makes it very easy to get around.

title: Très bon hôtel
text:
Hôtel  bien placé et au calme au pied du mémorial du 11 sept. Plusieurs lignes de métro, 10/15 mn à pieds du bateau pour la Statue de la liberté. 
Personnel agréable et à l'écoute et compétents. Des encas sont proposés gratuitement toute la journée et du vin de 17h à 18h  de quoi se détendre après une grande balade.
Les chambres sont spacieuses mais manque de rangement. 
Très bon séjour je recommande cet hôtel

title: Un lugar recomendable
text: Una vista inmejorable. Un dpto muy lindo. Un lujo. Tuvieron la delicadeza de hacernos ingresar en cuanto llegamos (antes del horario del check in). Había agua disponible en botellas para recargar y llevarte. Muy cerca del subte (linea 1)

title: Excellent place
text:
Great value, right around World Trade Center and Wall St. Look for Mariott for the orientation.
It's not spacious, but you have everything including private shower/bathroom, amenities, free water refills, tea and coffee.
Recommend.

title: WTC Club Quarter - Good location and clean hotel
text: I frequent the CQ at WTC on many of my business visits to lower Manhattan. Very convenient to the business district but also to many landmarks close by, for those that want some sightseeing. The staff is friendly and helpful.

title: An amazing and beautiful  place to enjoy your tour in New York City
text: They have very nice customer care service and on the 20 level  there is a very nice restaurant "The Vie w of the World" , It is such an amazing place , you will be able to hare a clear view of pool of reflection, Wtc, and the beauty of the city

title: 4 days in NYC
text: Spent a lovely three nights here: patient, polite, and accommodating service despite the fact that the entire staff was sorting through a network issue at check-in time, and a clean and spacious room with a beautiful view.

title: Awesome
text: Honestly one of the best hotels I have stayed out the staff was very helpful and very professional at all times! Second the location of the hotel was amazing, very close to everything literally walking distance!

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: Amazing hotel with an amazing location.  Staff will go above and beyond to make your stay special.  Please make sure to have a drink at View of the World located on the 20th Floor.  Best view in lower Manhattan.  Rooms are very spacious with premium linens and tasteful furnishings.  Had one of the best sleeps on a hotel mattress.  Highly recommend this property!

title: fantastic place.
text:
A beautiful hotel in a beautiful, convenient location. The view from the room window and from the terrace was stunning.
Pleasant, helpful staff. Great perks too: coffee, purified water, snacks à volonté.

title: An excellent hotel for an amazing price
text: The staff was so nice and communicative. Whenever we needed something they were so helpful. The place is beautiful and the view is really nice. I was in a one queen sized bedroom and it was perfect and had everything that we needed for our stay. Felt super secure because the security made me feel safe. If you are looking for somewhere to stay i would definitely recommend this place. Super cheap for a NY hotel. Didn't expect it to be so nice when I booked it but I am glad I did.

title: Beautiful views with Great customer service!
text: My husband was in NY for business and I joined him to visit friends. This was our first time staying here and everything about this place was Great! No complaints. Thanks again to the staff for some delicious chocolate chip cookies. I also want to thank Kevin for his help for taking care of a package for us!

title: Just the job
text: I stayed for 4 nights whilst on a business trip.  The hotel had everything I needed and more without being even vaguely pretentious.  It is in a good location, and at the same time quiet.  There was a variety of front desk staff there during my stay, and they were all courteous and friendly.  The bed was great, the bathroom was ultra clean, and the shower pounded out hot water consistently.  The daily happy hour at 5 was a nice touch, although I could only take advantage on the day of my arrival.

title: Perfect Quick Stay Hotel
text: I had a good time. I just had to stay for a few days. I want to point out it was my first time getting a hotel, and everyone was patient with my ignorance, which I appreciate a lot! I have extreme anxiety so I wasn’t panicking but I am very happy every staff member was patient and even flexible with me. I had a nice view, decent neighbors, and free snacks. Can’t go wrong there. I won’t book again anytime soon because they’re a lot of fees that sneak up on you. But overall I love it and recommend everyone to stay here.

title: Wonderful Weekend - Nice room
text: The perfect sized room. Very clean. Nice staff. The water pressure could be better. But that's probably a city thing. The water was hot. It just comes out a bit weak. Truthfully I thought the room was clean but there were little things that most people would not notice. Lots of scuff marks on the walls. Easy enough to repair with a magic eraser. But they don't... And the bathroom had a faux medicine chest that then you opened it had a profane message etched into the wall. For a nice place you would think they would detail the rooms a bit better. Nonetheless it was a great value for a weekend stay. The beds are firm. Not wonderful, but you can sleep on them.

title: Clean Place
text: The only thing I didn't like is that they are still working on the buildings in the area and you have to walk around a lot of construction stuff. But once you get around that its a lot of things to do and eat.

title: WTC
text: Great location best views of the WTC complex. Great value, great rooms , excellent friendly staff, have stayed here multiple times and would stay no where else when visiting NYC. Can take a cab anywhere so to me this is the best hotel location and value in the entire city.

title: Great value
text: Easy in and out, nice people, designed for the road warrior. I like this chain - they are on to something. Rooms are small, but that is their design. Free wine during the early evening - people hanging out - a nice vibe - beats the deadness of a Marriott Courtyard - do activity in the evening. Deadsville.

title: The hotel was awesome and the staff is amaznig
text: We stayed here for the weekedn and it was a greta experience.  The hotel was nice with a cool view on the 20th floor.  The service was great as well.  The hgighlight of our stya was two etaff mambers who wokred the front desk and served wine at the 5.  Ro and Andrew.  These two were the most pleasant and professional hotel staff we've ever encountered.  They were freindly, helpful, kind, and all around awesome.  We couldn't be happier with their service.  Thanks Andrew and Ro!

title: Great value and wonderful staff
text: From the moment I checked in, the staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and well laid out. I had a wonderful view of the Memorial. The value for my stay was very good and I recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in the area.

title: Choose this hotel!!
text:
We frequently stay at CQ midtown which is always nice. But this is my 2d time at CQ WTC. Great hotel in a great location! Shout out to Ro who checked me in, then was the bartender at the complementary happy hour, and later kindly printed out a paper I needed for work (when I couldn’t quickly figure out how to use the business center printer). Thank you for going above and beyond! 
Really friendly staff here. Love that each room has a yoga mat and resistance band! Comfy bed. Nice bathroom. Nice soap/shampoo. 
And they serve complimentary La Columbe coffee in the member lounge! Best coffee ever. (From Philly!) And complimentary fruit and snacks. I like sitting in the lounge catching up on work enjoying the complimentary offerings. 

The location near the WTC is great. Lots of nice shops and restaurants nearby. And it’s a short walk from the PATH train from Newark. (Take the Amtrak to Newark and then the PATH train to WTC. Much better than taking Amtrak to NY penn station and then having to trek downtown) 

If you are looking for a pretentious hotel, this is not it. It’s a friendly comfortable place, like a home away from home.  I will be back!

title: Dreadful experience
text: We had three rooms during our stay and Room 902 was uninhabitable....front desk would not help so we had to double up family members...smell in 902 was of a dead, decaying animal...really horrible...we have put the matter "in dispute" with our credit card company as Club Quarters WTC has not returned any of our phone calls...

title: Valentine’s celebration
text: Booked dinner at Morton’s the day after valentine’s and was pleased to go upstairs to a welcoming bed without any of the city noise.. hotel was clean and quiet. I look forward to staying at this location again.

title: Terrible experience from the start
text: We checked in around 11pm. We got a room without the bathroom light. The maintenance guy was very nice and helpful. He suggested to get another room. The frontdesk personnel got us another room however it was already occupied. Finally we got a room closed to midnight after the long flight to NYC. We finally settled in after mid-night. The frontdesk did not apologize what happened or assigned us a slightly better room. We were very disappointed with the service.  The stuff is overall unfriendly and no help throughout our trip.

title: You get what you pay for
text: I thought the price tag for a 4-star hotel seemed like a steal. I was very underwhelmed (and slightly skeeved) by the hotel rooms, which my coworkers deemed to have a "sad bachelor" vibe. Granted, it was clean (but not overtly so) and I slept well...I just probably won't go back.

title: Love WTC Club Quarters
text: Excellent rate, helpful staff, clean comfortable rooms. Easy walk to Oculus and 911 Museum  and Brookfield Mall. When requesting extra pillows or more coffee, response is swift and courteous. My favorite spot to stay when visiting family in th city.

title: Love CQ
text: I booked for a Saturday night couple getaway..love this location. In the World Trade Center area.. Easy to get to, great location, great staff. Love that they have coffee in the lobby of the hotel, snacks. The front desk offered help.

title: So quiet !
text: Perfect place if you want to sleep well, very quiet. I loved the restaurant on the 20th floor, views are amazing. Staff is not overly friendly but respectful. The bed was very confortable . Room a bit small.

title: Excellent, accommodating staff
text: Thanks for a great stay, and for being so helpful. The staff went out of their way to accommodate my requests, since the first room I was in was not to my liking. The area is a little boring, in that it's not so close to restaurants and cafes, but only a short walk from West Broadway and Tribeca.

title: Disappointing Service
text: This evening my crew arrived at the hotel to find the door locked (approximately 12:30am, 2/10/19). We could clearly see the desk staff and tried to get his attention by banging on the door to let us in. Eventually, a hotel guest let us in. When I asked the desk personnel if he saw us he said yes. I asked why he didn't assist us by opening the door. He retorted, that if he banged on the cockpit door, would we let him in? I find this to be inappropriate and rude. He told us we had to ring the bell. Clearly we had no idea that there was a bell and then he went on to make rude comments that it was right in front of us. We checked in on the opposite side of where this employee was and I asked the person assisting us if he could then show us where the bell was for future reference. Why were we treated this way, I have no idea. I view this as an isolated incident because we have always had excellent service at Club Quarters. I cannot tell you how disappointed I was.

title: Club Quarters - WTC
text: Great Rate!  Great Location! Good Breakfast/Snack area!  Friendly Staff!  It was perfect! The room is small, (like most rooms in NYC), but it has everything.... and the rooms are new and clean.  I will stay here again when I am here on business or personal travel!  Great Value!

title: STOP charging early check in fees
text: Good location and great price just the early check in fee of $50 when the room is empty and available is just a joke. Was a big fan of this brand till this recent incident. WHY would you charge $50 when the room is empty and available. Seriously? What do you accomplish by doing that? What a great way to say welcome and at the same time screw you.

title: Très bon rapport qualite prix
text:
Emplacement au top (metro,visite, calme, restauration)

Chambre propre tres belle vue pour nous,personnel aimable et dispo

Allez boire un verre au rooftop de l'hôtel,happy hours entre 4 et 7 pm

Seul bémol,largeur du lit limite (140 cm)

title: RO
text: This guy is the bomb dot com. 😜 now I guess I gotta keep typing so make it two hundred characters... the snacks and espresso drinks were also amazing. Oh, and if you show up at the right time, RO will pour you an awesome glass of wine. Thanks for everything!

title: Best hotel near World Trade Center
text: The weather was bad snow storm and high winds at the time I arrived from my flight for a business workshop. I was exhausted from my flight and agitated. When I arrived at the hotel in the evening I was greeted right away by SERGIO. He immediately put my bad mood into happy thoughts as if I was at a luxury hotel and treated with the highest hospitality I have ever encountered. He checked me in and asked me if I needed anything to make my stay more comfortable. He offered me a umbrella and gave me a tour of the hotel of all the relaxing things to do such as the restaurant with the best view on the 20th floor and the gym which included peloton even yoga classes in your room. He even called me and asked me if my room was ok and if I needed anything. The hotel was beautiful and they even have free happy hour starting at 5pm in the lobby. I was highly impressed and have never had such superb customer service. I would highly recommend this hotel. And make sure to ask for Sergio he is the BEST!!! :-)))

title: Great place to stay
text: I was in town for two days of meetings downtown and needed a place to stay. The deal on this room was impossible to beat. Yes the room was a bit small, but it was well appointed, very clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. Definitely a keeper.

title: NY weekend
text: Great accommodations;cozy;everything available View was great overlooking the WTCLocation was convenient to get around Roof top restaurant was nice but a bit pricey All staff were friendly and helpful

title: Great Stay at WTC
text: Great spot, close to public transit, shopping, monuments, Wall St, Statue of Liberty, NYC City Hall and the World Trade Center!!! Absolutely breathtaking views of the site! Club Quarters has been great in NYC, London and Washington DC. I’ve never been disappointed.

title: Be aware
text: I paid for a room with a view and got one looking into others’ windows on all sides. Oh well, I said. Days later I got an email from a manager named Krystin saying I could tell her directly if I had an issues. So I did, explaining the two-night stay was fine but told her the story about the room. That was a week ago and I haven’t received a response. Even a half-hearted apology would’ve been fine. But nothing? C’mon. The least you can do is tell me you’re sorry.

title: Very Good Location
text: We chose Club Quarters on the advice of my cousin. The location was perfect for seeing the 9/11 Memorial. The room was small but fine for 2 people. Mini fridge, Queen bed and a desk and chair. Room was clean and when I asked for extra pillows and towels I received them quickly. I love the free water station on the floor. Saves a lot of money by not having to buy water everyday. He loved the free snacks in the Living Room, nuts,  M&M,s snack mix. I would definitely choose Club Quarters when I travel in the future.

title: A gem of a place to stay
text: This hotel is ideally located for Downtown and close to public transport. The rooms are clean and set up for work. Staff are friendly and the lounge downstairs allows an attractive environment to permit meetings with colleagues and working space. Combine this with views and a gym and you have a near perfect package.

title: Perfect For Work
text: We enjoyed staying at the Club Quarters in the World Trade Center. Very close to the memorial site. A very clean and quiet hotel. The room was pretty big and even had a kitchenette. The value was excellent.

title: Clean rooms and great people
text: I always stay here when I travel for business. There are a lot of choices in New York for hotels; but this is my favorite. It’s reasonably priced, has the perfect amount of amenities, the rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff are amazing time and time again. For this trip, it was Andrew at the front desk who made me feel right at home.

title: Room with a view
text: I get tired of looking at brick walls and alleys out of my window but I love CQ hotels.  The staff is excellent, the service is great, cable sucks but you can't have it all.  The snacks in the lounge area are a hit!!

title: Horrible
text:
Nous avons séjourné ici durant le nouvel an, seuls points positifs de l’hôtel sont la vue et la gentillesse du personnel de restauration.. 
En dehors de ça, réception interminable, obligé d’attendre 4h dans le hall pour obtenir la chambre, qui soit dit en passant est affreuse.. Absence de chauffage ? Au mois de décembre pendant la période de noel ? Chambre réservée pour 4 mais literie et accessoires de cuisine pour 2 ? Donc les deux autres personnes ne se douchent pas et ne mangent pas ? Canapé lit à ressort, c’est sympa pour passer une bonne nuit, quand l’un se lève l’autre vole.. 
Fuyez

title: Great place to stay
text: Had a great stay at the CQ, WTC location.  The hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly.  Rooms clean and comfortable.  Location is outstanding, views o relooking the memorial and looking up at the freedom tower.  Convenient to subway lines, good dining options, and shopping.  Would definitely stay there again.

title: Great stay
text:
We were upgraded to a suite with a view of the memorial. The room was clean and all the staff were very friendly (front desk, housekeeping and restaurant). We enjoyed the wine happy hour and free snacks! Free water bottle refills also a very nice perk. 

Perfect location if you are in town to visit the 9/11 Memorial and Museum.

title: Great all around!
text: We had a wonderful stay at the CQ WTC! From the moment we checked in we enjoyed ourselves, the woman at the front desk was friendly and welcoming wine happy hour was amazing and the views and room were great! Highly recommend.

title: Preferred Business Hotel
text: I stay at this location about 3-5 times a year for business.  Over the years I have grown to love the Club Quarters Brand even for personal travel.  This particular hotel is within a 10 minute walk to my office and within a 10 minute walk to a number of excellent restaurants.  They offer several perks that I don't receive at other hotels such as free wine from 5-6pm in the lobby, an espresso and snack bar throughout the day, and fitness equipment in the room.  Since the last time I stayed here they started offering a grab and go breakfast service for under $8!  The breakfast options are very filling too.  The only negative is the rooms only have showers, and the bedding isn't comfortable.  I highly reccomend Club Quarters and specifically the World Trade Center location given the quality and price.

title: Thanks!
text: I thought this was an excellent hotel. Yes it was a little pricey but with it’s convenient location next to WTC and several metro stations nearby, you can’t complain. The staff were friendly and I couldn’t have asked for more. Thanjs

title: Quiet Elegance
text: I wanted to be near the 9-11 Memorials and have had experience with Club Quarters in Washington D.C. and liked it.  This location is perfect for access to the 9-11 museum, the reflecting pools, the ferries to various attractions, Trinity Church and St. Paul's, Wall Street, and it is all around buildings that are human scale...except for the Freedom Tower - wow!  Club Quarters restaurant is terrific, staff is wonderful, water station on each floor is good thing...and wine at 5 in the lobby lounge....grab a taxi around the corner on West and you are good to go.

title: Wow
text:
What a hidden gem in nyc. Yeah it's a little bit outta the way, but the benefit is when you go to sleep its quiet. 

One of the nicest and cleanest hotels I've stayed at in NYC.

I love the complimentary  mix of  snacks waters  and nothing beats the wine @5 happy hour. 

The check inn was seamless. 

I am actually  heading back inn tomorrow night and staying at your same location.

title: comodo y agradable
text: El hotel esta bien. Mi habitación tenia una pequeña cocina incorporada con microondas y un saloncito con sofá cama. El precio caro, como todos los hoteles de Nueva York en Navidad. El metro y los autobuses a cinco minutos andando y enfrente un centro comercial. En la zona muchas tiendas, Century 21 y cantidad de sitios baratos para comer. Esta en la zona cero y desde la ventana se ve el museo y los monumentos.La vista desde el restaurante es impresionante y tiene hora feliz por la tarde.No dan desayunos pero en el salón que hay al lado del vestíbulo por la mañana ponen fruta y barritas y durante todo el día café,snack, bebidas frías.......gratis.Ademas tiene gimnasio y lavandería gratis con jabón y toallitas incluidas, ademas de secadora, algo muy útil a la hora de llevar menos ropa al viaje.

title: Nice location...
text: Nice location. Clean rooms, but didn't like the hidden fees, I spent 2 nights and was charged an additional $165 on top of the room rate. Why do I need to have st least 200 characters This foolish blahs blahs blah

title: Just okay
text: The hotel was clean. The check in/out process was easy. I booked a room requesting a sofa bed. I called to confirm that my room would have a sofa bed prior to my arrival and was assured there would be one in my room. When I checked in there was no sofa bed and was only provided with an uncomfortable cot. If I had known there would not be a bed available I would have booked a room in another hotel

title: Excellent hotel
text: Clean, comfortable and in a great lower Manhattan location, this is one of our favorite places to stay. The rooms are clean,comfortable and spacious and the staff is friendly, helpful and efficient. You cannot go wrong here.

title: First Class
text: Had to make a last minute get away to NYC, the Staff was excellent and very accommodating. It was very obvious that management did they job well, during our checking in and out process. Loved the wine at 5pm

title: Clean but basic
text: Upon arrival the standard room was tiny so we asked for an upgrade and got a bigger one which was nice. Depending on who was on reception depended on the service you got. We booked a car to return us to the airport and the receptionist didn’t actually book it causing us to nearly be late! Decent hotel, decent location but would definitely opt for something nearer Central Park as better subway options.

title: Great Location!
text: The location of this hotel is excellent. It is right across the street from the 9/11 Memorial and our room on the 17th floor had a partial view of the reflecting pools. It was a wonderful home base for exploring lower Manhattan. We had 2 room that were basically in a lock-off configuration which was great since we were travelling with our children. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

title: Family Visit
text: Very nice place, friendly front end staff. Right across from Freedom Tower . Nice Hotel to venture out in lower Manhattan. Close to many tourist attractions like the Statue of Liberty, and the seaport district.

title: Great hotel
text: It was a great stay! They got us balloons for my boyfriends birthday and champagne upon entry to the room it was great! Beautiful view of the WTC and close to everywhere! Recommend to anyone who goes to NYC.

title: Great location and amenities
text: We love the location and the ease of getting around. The nice touch of hydration station and afternoon snack really make a difference.  Rooms are very efficient but have everything you need. Staff is alway very helpful and friendly

title: great location and wonderful staff
text: We were very happy with our stay. The location was excellent and just steps away from the subway. The train ran under the building but was not so loud to keep us up at night. The room was clean and as we expected. The water bottle filling station and 24/7 espresso maker in the lobby was a nice touch. Everyone working at the desk was very helpful and friendly. We were even able to get a refrigerator in the room upon request.

title: Great Hotel in the center of Financial District
text: The position. There will be a dozen subway lines within 500 meters. The structure itself is clean, elegant and worth the cost of the room. The staff very kind. The possibility of having 24/7 access to a coffee machine on the ground floor, as well as drinks and snacks is a kind gift offered by the structure.

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: We stayed at the hotel during thanksgiving. From NYC standards, the rooms were spacious, clean and very comfortable. The location is great, in downtown close to every thing we wanted to be near. The most impressive thing was that my wife forgot her jewelry boxwith some expensive jeweler you In the room. It was turned over to the lost & found and we were able to get it back. Very impressive.

title: Good
text: A really good experience in New York, good location, kind housekeeper and good environment. Looking forward to live there again, and i will also recommend it to my friends who want to travel to NY and live nearby wall street.

title: Great place to stay.
text: Having a separate sitting area was very nice.  The queen bed was in a small alcove which was a little difficult to navigate, but was worth it to have the separate area.  The microwave and fridge were nice to have also.  Refillable water bottles and water fountain was eco-friendly and a nice bonus. Overall, loved the location and space.

title: CQ NYC-WTC
text: This location, mere feet from the NYSE, is in about as central a location as one can get.  the hotel staff was professional, courteous and welcoming.  The hotel itself seemed always in perfect order.  The adjoining eatery was outstanding in selection, quality and service.  The rates are very good when compared with other hotels in the area:  as good as any and better than most.

title: Very spacious Club Room.  Very conveniently located.
text: Book a club room if you need need a more spacious room.  It's worth it.  The hotel is basically behind the One World Trade Centre with easy access to subway.  Attractions are just nearby.  There are several Club Quarters Hotels, so do make sure you book the right one if you wish to stay at this hotel. This was our second visit.

title: Rooms vary
text: We checked in a little after 10pm and ended up with a queen Murphy bed. The fire escape map posted on the inside of the door showed all but one room on that floor (2nd) were larger. We thought maybe our room doubled as a break-out conference room, as this was the business/conference level. The rooftop area was locked, so we were unable to enjoy the view ($22 resort fee for ??). Location was fantastic, but the address they gave us for parking ($39) was nonexistent. Luckily, we were able to find street parking.

title: the gem in a bustling city
text: had an amazing stay at this gem in the bustling city, location is perfect as you are able to enjoy the humbling view of the Freedom Tower and 9/11 memorial, are connected to any party of the city inside out and have access to shopping, eating out for anything you could possibly think of (Morton's happy hour all day Sunday next door - great start), fab amenities incl free wine hour every day, excellent fitness facility small but equipped with everything you need for a good workout, the room set up is great with the little kitchenette, but above all the service makes the difference, Marsha and Arnold made my stay even more enjoyable and are willing to help and go the extra mile, their smiles alone made the rainy days disappear, thank you again for an amazing time in my home away from home!

title: Enjoyed it!
text: The employees were extremely helpful and kind! I stayed overnight for a job interview the next morning. I stored my baggage while interviewing the next afternoon and easily picked it up during the evening. No issues at all.

title: Semplicemente perfetto
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato qui dal 14 al 18 e dal 23 al 25, prenotato una camera queen piccola a settembre ad un prezzo veramente eccezionale. Purtroppo ho dovuto prenotare con cancellazione gratuita altrimenti avrei pagato ancora meno.
Camera pulita e con tutti i comfort, leggermente piccola in 2 con cinque valige, ma avendola scelta e comunque ci siamo stati solo per dormire quindi è stata perfetta così.
Dispenser Di acqua ad ogni piano con bottiglietta fornita da loro e riempibile a piacimento.
Lobby con macchina per caffè, the, cappuccino, gratis h24.
La mattina a disposizione inoltre barrette ai cereali e frutta come colazione/snack.
Dalle 17 alle 19 vino gratuito e salatini.
4 stazioni con pc per navigare in internet, stampare carte d'imbarco o come ho fatto  io, per trasferire le foto dalla SD card della macchinetta fotografica ad una chiavetta USB.
Nei 5 giorni in cui non abbiamo soggiornato perché siamo stati a Miami, ci hanno tenuto le valige ad un prezzo eccezionale (avevo richiesto la possibilità in fase di prenotazione e mi era stato accordato il tutto).
Posizione spettacolare proprio di fronte al WTC, a 2 min a piedi dalla metro si collega sia al JFK sia al LGA e praticamente a quasi tutto quello che c'è da fare e vedere a NY. A 5 minuti dai traghetti per Liberty/Ellis Island e Staten Island.
Personale cortese, preparato professionale e sempre con il sorriso e pronto a soddisfare ogni richiesta. Tutti davvero lodevoli. In particolare l'ultimo giorno avevamo l'aereo alle 22 e ci siamo imbattuti in Sergio, che ci ha aiutato in tutto, dal tenere tutte le 5 valige fino a tardo pomeriggio al metterci a disposizione il bagno nella lobby, la sala del caffè come se fossimo ancora ospiti per tutto il giorno, e non è da tutti.
In sintesi non avremmo potuto trovare sistemazione migliore in base al rapporto qualità prezzo. Consigliatissimo in tutto e per tutto!

title: Business trip
text: Enjoyed my stay,clean quiet room. Concierges friendly, enjoy the snacks downstairs and wine nights. Great views from higher floors. Only problem I’ve had is sometimes the elevators get crowded and can have longer wait times.

title: great hotel. Nice and Clean
text: neat feature outside our room. Free water bottles and filtered water dispenser right in the hallway.Staff was friendly and helpful. Held our bags when room wasn't ready and sent them up to the room while we toured the city.

title: Will be back
text: Hotel staff very friendly and helpful.  They recommended restaurants and assisted with airport transportation.  They also spent some time, at a very busy hour, to explain the subway routesAn added Extra special touch was Happy Hour every day at 1700hrs including snacks all day.  Was perfect after a long day of walking and you just needed something. Room was super clean - surpassed expectations Great location Easy access to subway

title: Great rooms and amazing staff
text: Amazing staff, who made our stay comfortable. They were always flexible with our needs. Shout out to Albert, Arnold, Stefanie, Tati, Andrew. The best value for money one can get in downtown NYC. Great bar too

title: NYC
text:
the location is ideal to visit the 9/11 Memorial and Museum as well as Battery Park and Lower Manhattan!!
the room was clean, good size and nice views. 
had a delicious burgher from room service.
restaurant/bar not so great but the views were amazing from the balcony!

title: Make a business trip enjoyable.
text: The Hotel has a very friendly atmosphere,  The staff was helpful without being intrusive.  The living rooms off of the lobbies were a very nice touch. with coffee, soft drinks and snacks.  Overall a very pleasant experience.

title: Club Quarters did Awesome this trip.
text: I arrived early, as usual to drop off my car & luggae, it took only a few minutes. When I got back from my long day of meetings, it took 1 minute to get my room key & my luggage was waiting for me in my room. I awoke as planned and alerted the front desk I would need my car. When I got down stairs, my car was out front waiting for me. I used the Kiosk to print out my receipt. Well done Club Quarters at WTC!

title: Great Hotel with wonderful service
text:
Stayed here for a Christmas trip again. The hotel is perfect, central located next to the 9/11 memorial.

Especially the support at the front desk is fabulous. The staff is always friendly and looks for solutions if something does not suits. 

Thanks to Leila and Marsha-Ann who offered me a extraordinary room after I have asked for a room change. They did a great job. It’s always a pleasure to stay here.

title: ÓTIMO HOTEL
text: Optamos por não ficar na Times Square e escolhemos este hotel, que foi maravilhoso. Fica muito perto do metro, o que facilita para ir a qualquer lugar, e da para ir caminhando até a ponte do Brooklin e até o ponto de embarque para a estátua da liberdade. O quarto tem um tamanho ok para 3 pessoas e as camas confortáveis, inclusive o sofá cama. O hotel oferece um happy hour diariamente e recebeu as encomendas sem taxa adicional. Ficaria hospedada novamente neste hotel.

title: Not as nice as it looks at first
text:
At first glance, this hotel looks modern and clean, My second glances found many exceptions. 

I stayed in room 1611. The sink in that room is cracked completely in half. I felt underneath and it seems to have been repaired with caulk or something similar, and the sink is watertight. Nonetheless, it was pretty unsettling to have to wonder if the sink would leak, and not in line with the impression the hotel seemed to want to make.

The bed in my room was a Murphy (folding) bed, which was a little surprising. If that's the furniture choice, however, I do recommend that when the room is cleaned the bed should be lifted up and carpet under the bed vacuumed. That was not the case; there was dust and scraps of paper under the bed.

More minor, the lighting above the bed wasn't working well. There are two holes for lights in the headboard/cabinet, but only one opening had a light. The dimmer switch to control them is in poor condition, and the one light did not dim, it flickered. Also, water pressure was low and hot water was not very hot at 7am.

On the plus side, the bed was comfortable and wifi was strong.

I was really puzzled by the relationship between Club Quarters and the World Center Hotel. They are in the same building. Their doors from outside are right next to each other. Their lobbies are back to back. And when I got my key and went upstairs, I had to walk past the World Center Hotel's elevators to get to my room, which was above the World Center's lobby. Why aren't these just one hotel?

title: new and fresh
text: Overall, the stay at this hotel was good.  Service was good.  Room was new and modern.  It is a good option for New York.  A it less expensive than other hotels but definitely a decent accommodation.  Not the Ritz but you also are not paying Ritz prices.

title: KEEP LOOKING-Not worth it
text: The hotel in itself feels very unkept and cheap. We arrived to no one in the tiny lobby and assumed we had to self check in through a kiosk only to learn it doesn't work several minutes later when someone finally showed up behind the desk. I was there at 5 pm and told my room was not ready. Fine. Came back to the property at 11 pm only to find I was put in a single instead of a double. I reserved and paid extra for a room with a second bed in the form of a pull out sofa. I was put in a regular room with one bed and when I called to correct it they told me there was nothing they could do tonight and possibly the next night as they were completely booked and offered me a breakfast voucher. Really?? I have extra ppl with me that need accommodations and they offer a breakfast voucher. A cot would have never fit in the room so that wasn't even an option. SO to sum it up, it's pricey for no reason, not the cleanest, not modern, cheap, and not run correctly. The customer service is sub par and all in all this place can be compared to a Manhattan Motor Lodge if such a place existed.

title: Roomy and extremely friendly staff
text: We had a standard room with king bed. Plenty of room and when we needed directions etc., the staff were so friendly and helpful. Near subway and several great restaurants. Luggage was in room once it was ready and we returned to hotel since we arrived early

title: Cheap, but for good reason.
text: Good location if you want to be downtown, but bad service and amenities. Only decent perk was free wine from 5-6 every night. Very disappointed in the housekeeping as we would return from the city about 3-5 pm and the room wasn't serviced from the previous day.

title: Really not 4 star hotel
text:
So dissapointed with my visit in Club Quarters. The room was small, furniture cheap and connecting door to the room next door was not that nice experience either. 
We booked a superior room with a fridge and freezer. It didnt work and complained 3  times about it without it getting fixed. 
Really dissapointed in this hotel and cannot  recommendate it.

title: Quiet with great staff
text: I’ve stayed here for the last couple years, a couple times a month and have never been disappointed. It’s clean and most importantly quiet. Nicely appointed rooms with a small kitchenette. Water and vending machines on each floor. Coffee supplied on the main floor.

title: Klare Weiterempfehlung!
text: Lage: Das Hotel liegt direkt neben dem One World Trade Center (One World Observatory) im Financal District in Downtown Manhatten (VIEL ruhiger als die Gegend um den Time Sqaure!). Ein Einkaufszentrum (dort ist besonders der Supermarkt/Restaurant EATALY zu empfehlen) und mehrere Subway Linien (z.B. Endstation der E-Linie, welche direkt zum Airtrain (JFK) führt) sind quasi direkt vor der Haustüre, man erreicht somit alle Sehenswürdigkeiten innerhalb kürzester Zeit zu Fuß oder mit dem öffentlichen Verkehr (Wochenkarte ca. 30 Euro). Zimmer:Gebucht hatten wir ursprünglich ein kleines Zimmer mit Queensize-Bett. Bekommen haben wir ein großes Zimmer mit riesigem Kingsize-Bett. Die Qualität der gratis zur Verfügung gestellten Toiletries war für Hotelartikel ausgesprochen gut und ist auch immer mehr als ausreichend wieder nachgefüllt worden. Bei einer Außentemperatur von -10°C bis 5°C ist die Zimmertemperatur allerdings, wenn die Heizung abgedreht wurde (was automatisch passiert sobald man das Zimmer verlässt), innerhalb kürzester Zeit auf ca. 16°C gefallen. Im Badezimmer gab es gar keine Heizung. Hotel allgemein/Personal: Vom Front Desk Personal über das Housekeeping bis hin zum Service im Restaurant waren alle Personen ausgesprochen freundlich und bemüht. Ein großer Pluspunkt dieses Hotels sind, besonders im Hinblick auf die unglaublich hohen Preise in New York, die rund um die Uhr gratis zur Verfügung gestellten Getränke und Snacks (Kaffee, Tee, Softdrinks, Müsliriegel, M&Ms, Knabbergebäck, Obst) sowie der tägliche 5 Uhr-Wein.

title: Good location for quite comfortable business travel
text: This is a well priced hotel for the area.  Comes with all the standard amenities for short and long term stays.  This hotel has a rooftop restaurant and bar.  the views of the freedom tower are spectacular.

title: A great time was had by all !
text: This hotel is amazing !
