Right in downtown Manhattan , off the heather path a little which is nice since there is practically 0 traffic on that street which makes loading/unloading sooooo much easier and is a stones throw away from the freedom tower and 9/11 memorial and close to subway stations . Excellent front desk staff who were very helpful with directions. They held our bags since we arrived early and let us explore the city before check in and did the same after we checked out. Rooms were a bit smaller but it is NYC after all so we had no complaints and the beds and pillows are super soft. I would definitely stay here again .

title: Great location; easy stay; quiet neighborhood
text: Great weekend stay. Gym was good. Food at breakfast was adequate. Complimentary water and snacks and wine were great!! Great location and easy walk to WTC, many subway lines, the PATH, and more. Highly recommend if you do not want to stay in the hustle and bustle of midtown.

title: 2 spectacular weeks
text:
Excellent choice. 
Clean, nice staff, good value for money, great location by 9/11 Memorial.
Facilities at no extra cost include laundry, free purified water/coffee from beans/fruit/cold drinks, WiFi, Apple computers in the lobby.
Has plenty of space downstairs to relax and read a book or work.
Great terrace to enjoy in the summer at the 20th floor.
Excellent value for money

title: A Secret Gem
text: Love love love this hotel. Customer service is awesome. Views are wonderful and the convenient location make this a great choice for anyone traveling to NY. A great value. I would come back to stay again.

title: Sergio & Albert are great
text:
If only for the service and hospitality these guys provided I would have given this place five stars.

I’m going to write a separate review about the restaurant in the 20th floor which kind of killed the joy I had with the hotel...

title: Average & expensive
text: For the room rate it was pretty average. There's no safe in the room so you have to go to the safe at the front desk. The shower was weak with little water flow. The wifi internet was intermittent. It was simply expensive for what it is. If you're going to spend this amount of money you can get better quality.

title: Good Choice for Financial District
text: CQ was all around a decent stay.  The rooms are clean and contain everything you need, but the club room was really tiny, even for NY standards.  Regardless, when you’re in NYC, you’ll be spending most time outside.  The bed was satisfactory, the coffee machine a plus, and the lounge a nice amenity.  Every once in a while you’ll have that craving for late night m&ms ... or sparkling water, and the lobby lounge will fulfill your basic snacking needs.  My only real complaint with the room was the low water pressure in the shower.  Front desk was staffed by nice folks who mostly executed tasks in a timely manner.  Check in was unnecessarily lengthy, but a request to fix a light out in my room was addressed almost immediately.  All in all, CQ is a good choice for the price considering how high NYC hotel fares in December high season.

title: Love this place
text: Just stayed here this past weekend. Great time, great hotel, staff is super helpful! Ronaldo helped me with my needs on multiple nights, grateful for him and his service. He was super kind and helpful and always had a great up beat attitude! Appreciate his service. I would recommend this hotel hands down to anyone. Free snacks, soda, wine for a hour a day, you can do your own laundry if need be, and the rooms are awesome due to the views! I have stayed here in the past before because I love the hotel so much, the views are spectacular and love that some of the rooms have the glass wall basically to look out. The rooftop is awesome. I was super bummed though to find out there will be a huge massive tower building going up infront of Club Quarters, the views will now basically be staring right at a building (so kiss any view goodbye unless you pay more to have a suite and have the 9/11 memorial view). Of course this is nothing the hotel can do anything about, but seeing this was ALWAYS my go to hotel and have never had a issue, I am deeply saddened I will have to now look for another spot. Again, this is nothing on the hotel itself, it is out of their control where building decide to go up. But the view and glass lookout wall in the rooms were my main reason for always staying here. I will always love this place, and I made sure to appreciate the view one last time. Thanks for everything CQ!

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: Very clean, modern and convenient to all NYC has to offer. Very economical as well. We really enjoyed the rooftop dining, and access to filtered water. Great and reliable parking service as well. We stay here often and have never been disappointed.

title: I will come back
text: We had so much a great time here with my girlfriend. Everything was perfect, the staff was perfect and so kind to us. The breakfast was amazing too. I advise to taste the wine at 5pm, it is precious !From Paris, France

title: A great location away from the rush of Uptown
text: Location is great - you are a 5 min walk to the Freedom Tower and the 911 Museum and Memorial.Walking distance to Battery park for Liberty Island ferries,Hotel is tucked away in a quiet area, with a roof top restaurant view of the Tower etc.Staff were welcoming. Hotel itself is of a good quality, with some great added extras that were a treat - Lobby area had complimentary snacks and drinks, and was a small oasis away from the rush. Happy hour drinks were great.The rooms were nicely appointed - TV was huge and very easy to navigate. Each floor had filtered chilled water and bottles to use.Reception was attentive and helpful for any Hotel enquries or needs.My only suggestion, and its only a small issue,  would be for staff to upskill there "tourism" knowledge, to help tourists better. There did not seem to be much understanding about any of the attractions or sites, and how best to navigate and understand the myriad of things to see.

title: Staff great, room not so great
text: I stayed at Club Quarters WTC about 5 years ago and it was great. This trip I was given a handicapped accessible room that was dark, view of another building, wallpaper coming loose on the walls, shower with a makeshift rubber floor boarder in an attempt to keep the water in the shower area. Clock/alarm did not work and bed very hard. Simply a very different experience than the first stay. Staff was great.

title: The Cleanest hotel ever
text:
We stayed here for a week over thanksgiving/Black Friday. The hotel itself was great, honestly the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in! The room and bathroom were always up to the same gold standard every time.

The location was great, just a couple of minute walk away from the subway station, plus there’s fast food restaurants and a Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts just down the road. The majority  of the staff were cheery and helpful as well which helped make the whole process a lot smoother.

If you can, request a room with a view of the World Trade Centre Memorial - we had one overlooking the police station thing which was okay but the ones with views over the WTC looked great.

The only 2 complaints I have are as follows:

1. When we first arrived they took my card and took a ‘pending’ payment which was 25% more than the cost of the stay. This was removed when we checked out and we were charged the proper amount, however there was no communication to why the card was charged this much - I can only guess a safety deposit.

2. We booked the thanksgiving dinner at the hotels restaurant for 8PM. When we arrived we were seated and our drinks order took, then when we came to order the thanksgiving meal which we had RESERVED, we were told they had sold out. This was hugely disappointing as we had been looking forward to this all week, especially after we had pre booked it.

All in all, the hotel is in a good location, good price and cleaner than a soap factory - I would recommend!

title: Good
text:
It's a good hotel with good amenities, such as free water and free coffee, but when I stay in a club quarters I expect the top. For example, I had some problems with my reservations and the receptionist didn't help me at all (honestly she was very annoyed and it looked like I was a problem and not a customer).

Except for this, good hotel in a good position.

title: If in lower Manhattan look no further
text: Front desk staff is very friendly.. view from 20th floor is amazing. Also the bartender at the bar upstairs makes a fantastic Moscow mule. Room was very clean and quite spacious for a Manhattan hotel. Will be back!

title: CLUB QUARTERS WORLD TRADE - LOVE
text: I recommend the Club Quarters World Trade, it has great amenities/snacks, the 5-6 happy hour, rooms are clean and spacious, and the location is great near subway entrances 2 blocks or less. Being near the world trade center is special and our view was amazing.

title: Great location for NYC getaway
text: For a 2-day stay in Manhattan, the location of the hotel right beside WTC was the perfect choice. Clean and modern rooms with decent size. Free wine reception was another pleasant surprise. All places in Manhattan can be reached by short walks or using subway. Plenty of bars and restaurants around the hotel.

title: World Trade Center
text: Excellent hotel for business travel. Easy check in, clean large rooms, plenty of space to work Great WiFi Nice features such as coffee in room, wine offerings in the afternoon, snacks, etc. the electronic key on my phone was nice feature but did not work occasionally. Suggest you take physical key as well   I will use this hotel chain regularly whenever I travel

title: Great location, nice hotel, good vibe
text: The Club Quarters WTC is in a super location.  The hotel is modern and in nice shape.  They have a good supply of free snacks, a happy hour at the end of the work day, and a nice view from theupper floor restaurant too.  I have stayed here at least 10 times and always look forward to it.I have only had excellent experiences with the staff who have all been friendly and helpful.

title: Good value for money
text: Ask for a  room with  kitchen (gas oven) facility!! This will enable you to cook your won stuff if you are tired of eating out. This facility is not available in any other hotel in manhattan or near WTC

title: Great business traveler hotel
text: Comfortable beds, unlimited access to free water and wifi, dedicated restaurant for guests which serves great food, and lots of easy access plugs for charging electronic devices.  All this adds up to an efficient and relaxing stay away from home.

title: Never choose this hotel
text: Extremely rude and not helpful. I was trying to get my package and called many times. The only answer I got is I need to wait and they are super busy even it was already 12am. I had to go downsaits to the lobby to see what happened. But they were not busy at all and was rude

title: Club Quarters, WTC
text: Check-in and check-out were painless; front desk is friendly but efficient.  The room was clean and the shower pressure was good.  This location is close to my office and restaurants.  Nothing fancy but it checks all the boxes.

title: Could have been great :-(
text: Just returned from a 3 day stay at this hotel NYC.  Was in town with my husband to see my son. Selected this hotel based on price and reviews.  Below are pros and cons:Pros:-great location.  Literally right next to the 9/11 Museum and fountains.   Had a great view directly overlooking the fountains.  -had an upgraded room that was spacious-loved the free snacks and sodas/coffee in the lobby-loved the fact that the only extra charge for room service was $2.50Cons:-Bedspread had stains on it -bed was hard as a rock-doors to bathroom and sitting room were foggy glass - so if you were sleeping you would get light from the sitting room.  And the glass door to the bathroom provides very little privacy.  -no exhaust fan in bathroom -hotel has 2 names which was very confusing and I still don’t know exactly which one I stayed in. -upon arrival found that the electric outlet for the coffee maker was broken.  Requested it be fixed 3 times.  Only had someone show up after I said don’t worry about it we were leaving the next day.  Told them face to face not to send anyone else.  10 minutes later mantienance was at the door asking to fix it.  It was almost comical the lack of concern they had for taking care of this issue or respecting my wishes.  I had to order room service coffee at my expense.  Asked at checkout if they could take that off the bill.  I got the same answer I got during my stay about the broken plug “we will look into this”.  My guess is they won’t follow up nor could care less.  -came back in the evening on the second day to find our breakfast dishes still sitting in our room.  Called down to ask if someone could please come take it away and reminded them to fix the plug.  Came back from dinner and it was still there (and still broken outlet) What’s wrong with this place?  I’ve honestly never seen such a lack of concern for satisfaction.  They honestly asked like they could care less. If you stay here be prepared to be treated as a inconvenience rather than a valued customer.

title: Nice hotel
text: Good location, loved the fresh water tap, the lounge with good coffee, AC in the room, the view from the top and the breakfast in the restaurant. The extra bed could've been provided with a duvet, though extra blankets were available in the room. We appreciated the fridge and the ironing board in the room. All these comfort details made our stay feel easy, comfortable and positive. Overall: Highly recommendable.

title: David
text: We stayed hear from 8th Nov to the 13th 2018 can not fault this hotel very clean right next to ground zero subway 2 mins walk. But most of all the staff were fantastic very helpfull with directions and anything you needed. Nice people. Make sure you go to the 20th floor and visit the cocktail bar and see the views of the city. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Try the Irish bar over the road again nice bar nice people and bills burger bar burgers are spot on.

title: Great stay
text: Its very good staff, they offer free bottles and you refill with water, free amenities, coffee, snacks, sodas, fruits and wine from 5 to 6. I got a late checkout, that was great also and they keep your luggage, if needed.

title: Overlooking the WTC.
text: Weekend rate landed us at Club Quarters. Was ready to bite the bullet and brook a higher priced hotel and remembered that my college had an affiliation with CQ.  Location was great, wine at 5 was nice.  Room was small, but perfectly adequate. A great landing spot. And go get a drink on the 20th floor terrace.  A little pricey with an 18% tip added in. But a great view.

title: Good weekend away
text: Friendly and helpful staff. We appreciated the “treats” that were available. Our room was clean and well kept but some of the common areas of the hotel are showing wear. Convenient location to subway.

title: Good stay for the price
text: Definitely a place for business travelers or those seeking a quick-stay spot convenient-to-downtown sites. Skip the breakfast buffet (overpriced) but check out the view from their top floor restaurant. The club quarters members area has a nice selection of snacks and beverages, along with quiet spots to sit and work, etc.

title: Great stay in a good location.
text: We really liked the location. My wife really appreciated the coffee machine in the lobby. The room had a nice view and was clean. Close to the subway station in westfield mall which makes it easy to get around.

title: La réalité ne correspondait pas à la photo
text: Nous avions réservé une suite constituée de 2 pièces : 1 chambre avec lit et une pièce bureau avec canapé lit dans le World Trade Hotel et nous nous sommes retrouvés dans une chambre avec 1 lit double et 1 lit pliant dans Club Quarter Hotel (les 2 hôtels communiquent).Arrivés de nuit, j'ai tout d'abord pensé à une erreur puisque nous avions échangé par téléphone et par mail, mais non, on nous a dit que c'était bien ça et qu'il n'y avait pas autre chose.Au petit matin, nous avons quitté l'hôtel, car il ne correspondait pas aux prestations vantées sur site et attendues.A noter toutefois que le responsable a eu la courtoisie de ne pas nous faire payer les nuitées non passées dans son établissement.

title: NY trip
text: Great hotel, very clean, friendly, convenient. Ideal for family stay in NY.  Quiet location but easy access to major attractions. Happy hr wine was good also at 5pm! If we returned to NY anytime soon, I would look to stay here again.

title: Our review
text: We went to NYC to see the 9/11 Memorial and Museum and the Club Quarters Hotel was perfect. Our room view looked down on the Memorial which was spectacular.Marsha, the desk clerk was extremely helpful,also the complementry happy hour was very nice.

title: Excellent stay
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights on a work visit to New York and it was great location with great service. 

We had a superior room with a kitchenette which gave you a double bed and a large sofa bed which was more than adequate for two of us as the sofa bed is located in a separate room off the bathroom. The room itself is spacious and well laid out with a good little touches like a microwave and a coffee machine. Two small complaints about the room were that the shower wasnt as powerful as we wold have liked and the room with the sofa bed was a lot colder than the main room which I think was due to heating not being as efficient in that room. 

Staff were also very good in that the maid never disturbed you and always made the room when you were out for the day which was a nice touch and the staff on reception printed off some things for me when I asked without any hassle. 

The free water and soft drinks were also a really nice touch and I wish more hotels did this. 

The views of One World from our room was just a bonus and and the bar / restaurant on the room also has great service and views.

Would definitely recommend

title: Excellent mid-size hotel with great location in Lower Manhattan
text: My wife and I had 6 nights in a Superior Room with Kitchenette at the Club Quarters Hotel WTC. Our room was clean, modern and well fitted-out. The kitchenette and the in-hotel free guest laundry made it very suitable for a longer stay in NY. The location is excellent, being adjacent to the 9/11 Memorial and Museum and the new WTC subway station, and close to Battery Park and the ferry terminals. It's also in a quieter area away from the crowds and noise of mid-town. While expensive by Australian standards (and what isn't in NY?), the price was quite reasonable compared to other similar standard Manhattan hotels. We'd certainly stay there again on a future visit to NY. Highly recommended.

title: NYC Weekend stay
text: The staff was great, hotel very clean, and the room was a good size for a NY hotel. I enjoyed my stay. Even though it was a bit far away from the main attractions, definitely worth it! The view is great from their 20th floor of the 9/11 memorial!

title: A little gem
text: What this hotel lacks in size, glitz and glamour more than makes up for with exceptional customer service, location & personal touches. The water re-fill stations on each floor & complimentary tea/coffee, soft drinks & snacks are a welcome addition to your stay. This hotel overlooks the 9/11 Memorial, is steps away from Freedom Tower, the Occulus shopping & transportation hub and subway stations. It is a short walk to iconic landmarks such as Wall St, charging Bull, Trinity Church & Battery Park (Staten Is Ferry, Statue Cruises & Hop On Hop Off departure points). The rooms are clean, spacious, quiet , well lit and have plenty of power points and ample storage. The bathroom has great make-up lighting (normally an issue with hotels) if you are looking for a boutique hotel away from the hustle & bustle of Times Sq, but only a short subway trip away then this hotel is exceptional value and a little gem.

title: Great views of WTC, convenient location and really friendly staff
text: I was at Club Quarters WTC on business then my girlfriend joined me for a romantic weekend at the end of the week. The hotel is well situated near major transport hubs in the middle of downtown. Albert was very friendly checking me in and when I mentioned my girlfriend was coming, found me the most amazing room for our stay. All of the staff were very friendly and accommodating every time we had a request. The amenities are great with lots of nice free touches which would add up at other hotels (think water, snacks, WiFi, gym, etc). This is always my preferred hotel when staying downtown!

title: Love, love this hotel
text: Recently spent 2 nights at Club Quarters hotel and is my new favorite NYC hotel.  Shares all with World Center Hotel and both are great.  Nice size room with make-up mirror, refrigerator and Keurig coffee pot. Every floor offers filtered water and reusable bottles to use and the lobby has beverages and snacks all day long.  The staff were friendly and had my bags waiting in my room when I checked in.  Cannot say enough good about this hotel and really liked the location.  2 subway stops within 1-2 blocks and you can get anywhere you want to go.

title: Great location
text: Amazing location with great hospitality! The rooms were modern and very clean. This was my second visit to this hotel and it was squally as amazing as the first. I could walk and/or quickly access the subway which made it easy to get around.

title: Out of 7 hotels I've stayed at in NYC this is the best!
text: I travel around the world for business and every year take multiple vacations, (away from home 157 days in 2018) so when I take the time to rate a hotel you know I am passing along good advice. The rooms are spacious and clean and have many amenties like a mini fridge and microwave. The inside rooms are super quiet! The wifi is free, location is excellent, FREE happy hour wine get together every night and to top it all off the staff are very helpful, friendly, knowledgable and make you feel wlecom.. Lucrecia at the front desk is really a very special find in an employee!  Thank you Lucrecia, Dawn and all of the staff for making me feel I'm more than a reservation number!

title: Great little hotel with a bunch of nice touches
text: Free filtered water on every floor in bottles that you can seal and store?! Happy Hour every day with free wine?! Beautifully appointed hotel, clean and with a courteous staff. Awesome location next to Ground Zero in a revitalized part of town. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great Location
text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms overall are small, but there was more than enough room for us. We had a kitchenette, nice bathroom, & desk. The bed was the most comfortable bed we have ever had in a hotel! Also rooms are modern and extremely clean.  The staff were wonderful and the club room was great to grab a drink and snack. The hotel is located very close the the 911 museum and memorial, One World Observatory, the ferries, and subway.

title: Don't expect too much
text: Disappointing due to the price. Good helpful staff. The rooms were clean but small and it was a little awkward to find. We got off the subway at Fulton St but it was better to head to to WTC PATH. We wouldn't stay here again a little out of the way and overpriced.

title: Bag stolen
text: Dropped off a gift bag at the front desk for a friend staying at this hotel. The bag was clearly marked with name and room number. Front desk staff acknowledges the request and stores the bag. When my friend came down to pick it up, the bag was nowhere to be found. Do yourself a favor and stay clear of this dump.

title: Small Rooms
text: This hotel is walking distance to the World Trade Center Museum and many restaurants and bars. The rooms are clean but small. As with most NYC hotels, you can hear traffic noise at all hours. They have a nice happy hour.

title: Great Staff
text: The best desk staff in the city. I live next door and rent my apt out for big events (it was the marathon). They are the absolute best desk staff, and are trained to deal with a multitude of guests. Very good for international travelers or business travelers looking for help in the city.

title: Magnifique vue sur le 9/11 mémorial et le one world trade center
text: Hotel très bien situé, dans le quartier tristement célèbre des attentats du 11 septembre 2001. Depuis la terrasse du restaurant au 20 eme étage, vue directe sur le one world trade center avec en contrebas le mémorial des anciennes tours et des victimes. Quartier toujours en cours de travaux. Station de métro WTC proche. J'ai trouvé que le ménage de la chambre aurait pu être un peu plus appuyé...

title: Meget fint hotel
text: Dejligt hotel med venligt hjælpsomt og smilende personale. Pænt rent og store værelser. Det fungerer perfekt med adgang til kaffe,te,frugt og Chips dagen igennem. Desværre ligger der ikke mange sjove restauranter og morgenmads restauranter i nærheden så man må udtog gå lidt eller tage en bus, hvis man ikke vil spise på hotellet eller overfor i Bills. Der er dog også en italiensk i World Trade øverst !

title: Great Place
text: Customer service here is a big PLUS!  Very helpful. I have requested for early check-in & late check-out and the hotel was able to accommodate it. The view on level 20 is spectacular.This hotel is highly recommended.

title: Convenient location. Helpful Staff.
text: The room is equipped with one kettle, coffee machine, fridge and also microwave. Not only the facilities, but also the helpful and humble staff. So impressive! They provide two water machines for each floor and one pantry on the ground floor. Last but not least, the most attractive thing is the location. It’s super convenient! You can go any attractions easily by spending just little time. I will come over again. Cheers.

title: This hotel was our focal point for our trip to New York City.
text: Our visit to the Club Quarters World Trade Center was outstanding.  The staff is very helpful and courteous. The room we had was on the fourteenth floor and had a great view of the 911 memorial area.  Every night there is a complimentary wine tasting with snacks.  In fact, the snacks are there all day.  The location of this hotel is also very outstanding.  We happen to really like the downtown area with its narrow streets that wind around.  Not only are you near the World Trade Center, but near the sourthern tip of manhattan where you can pick up boat rides to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island.  There are great restaurants in the area around Stone Street.  Fraunces Tavern is nearby.  The subway system is easy to access in this area.

title: World View Buffet
text: On 10/26/18 I went to floor 20 to have the breakfast buffet.  It was the first time I had been there and I had no idea whether you could order off the menu or if it was buffet only.  I watched the waiter bring drinks to 4 other guests (I was there before all of them) before he asked me what i would like.  The menu was unclear and I did not know that my latte would be an extra charge.  And I was not asked if I would like a refill.  I did not feel I experience good customer service and would not recommend this to anyone.

title: Outstanding staff, location and premise!
text: My wife, daughter and I spent this past weekend in NYC at the Club Quarters World Centre hotel. We visit New York a couple of times each year and found our first time experience with this property to be outstanding. After having some difficulty with our initial room assignment the staff upgraded us and were very apologetic about the problem. In the four day/ 3 night stay, we encountered a staff that were extremely helpful, courteous and obviously, well trained. The hotel is clean with very good Club Room amenities in which to enjoy after a day of shopping and/or a night of Broadway.  Thanks to Andrew and Albert and the rest of the staff for making us feel at home and providing outstanding customer service. Keep up the good work!

title: Refused my reservation
text: Caution here ... I had a recent reservation through Priceline for a 2-night stay and when I arrived they would not honor it.  They claimed my CC did not process, but the charge was there.  I think what really happened is that they were overbooked.  It was a real hassle to find a new room and get a reimbursed.

title: Made in Manhattan
text: This is not a 5 star luxury stay but it is a clean, safe hotel and in a brilliant location. Rooms are a decent size for NYC and have everything you need for a short city break. There is a lounge area with free refreshments every morning. The 20th floor has stunning views of the city.

title: Feels Almost Like Home
text: I have stayed here several times and have never had a bad a bad experience.  The rooms are consistently clean and the staff is always courteous and friendly.  I love the free 'Happy Hour' in the lobby, the restaurant has great food and they make a perfect martini.

title: Great place to stay in Downtown Manhattan
text: The greeting we received was very friendly and helpful. Our room had a great view and very nice. Loved the free wine and snacks along with the water bottles in the hall to fill. Great location and the 20th floor to dine and view the 911 memorial was spectacular.

title: Perfect for Lower Manhattan
text: If you want  to see the WTC and 9/11 monuments this is the perfect location. Near all major Manhattan tourist sites, Staten Island ferry and Wall Street are both close by. Near subway stops for easy access to all of NYC.

title: Kent’s 21st bday
text: The hotel was nice and in a good location. The room and hotel and clean. The staff made me and my son feel welcomed. Anthony, Lauren and Marcie’s were awesome and met whatever need we had. They also recommended great places to eat.

title: Très bon accueil
text: the junior suite was very confortable.  The location is very convenient . All the area of the World Trade Center must be seen.  The people of this hotel was very kind    When is this location, you can go everywhere easily.   And when we were there, the weather was very nice.  Cold, but shiny.

title: Very nice, cheaper hotel in the financial district.
text: Very nice, cheaper hotel in the financial district. Rooms are smaller from what I'm used to, but good for business travelers.  They have a very nice happy hour from 5 to 6, which is free to guests. Good snacks leading off the morning as well.

title: Felt looked after from start till finish
text:
This is a very nice hotel to stay in for a holiday to New York. The staff are very friendly and helpful, and were able to find us a plug adapter after we realised we had forgotten ours. When we signed into the free WiFi and provided initial feedback to the hotel. The front desk was very quick to ring the room to resolve our issue. 
There is a complimentary snack bar and mini fridge which was well stocked with soft drinks, M&Ms, peanuts etc which was very useful when we came back exhausted from a day out!

title: Review
text: Great hotel, rooms are very clean.Great location and services. Staffs are amazing. Especially Gergiu, the receptionist was very helpful and friendly to us. Parking was very easy to access and fees are affordable

title: Great location and hotel
text:
I highly recommend staying in this hotel. A 10-15 min walk to tourist spots (battery park, 9/11 memorial and observatories, ferry to Statue of Liberty, Charging bull). We parked at St George terminal to save up with parking ($8 for 18 hours) then walked to the hotel. It was exactly 15 mins of walking and we didn’t even realize it since we were sightseeing at the same time. Hotel is modern and clean. The bed is very comfortable, my 2 yr old slept throughout the night. I love the idea of having chilled water always available for guest. They have recyclable bottles that you take and reuse. There is a coffee/tea, snack bar at the lobby, compliments of the hotel. On the 20th floor is a lounge where you can see the towers surrounding the building and the One World Observatory. The staff is amazing and efficient. We asked for two more pillows and in 10mins time its already in our room. 
Will definitely stay again.
