title: Great Stay
text: I had a great stay at this hotel. I want to thank Mary, the hotel manager. She made me feel at home. She was very hospitable. She helped me with a spa treatment and with dinner reservations. My suite was very spacious and had a balcony with a nice view of the memorial.

title: Relax away from the hustle and bustle of Uptown NYC
text:
This is a lovely hotel located right next to the new World Trade Centre, the Oculus subway station, Liberty Park and the 911 Memorial.  It's within walking distance of several other subway stops, the seawall along the Hudson River, Whole Foods, shopping centres and great restaurants.  You really won't need a car while staying here.
The hotel actually shares two names, Club Quarters and the World Centre Hotel.  You can access either hotel via the front doors or through the lobbies.  There are four elevators helping to get you to your rooms without delay.  There is a lovely lounge area where you can enjoy complimentary coffee, soft drinks and snacks throughout the day and drink some free happy hour wine (from a vineyard on Long Island...it's pretty good too!) from 5:00 to 6:00.  There is a business centre and a meeting room open to all guests.  On the top floor there is a restaurant/bar with outside seating.  The view from there is quite breathtaking.  We didn't eat at the restaurant but the menu looked inviting.  One terrific bonus was the water station on each floor.  Bottles are provided for you to fill with filtered water.
You can become a member of Club Quarters which gives you special hotel privileges but it's not necessary, you still get good perks.
The rooms are small but clean and comfortable.  We had one overlooking ground zero, the new WTC buildings and the memory pools.  The view was really spectacular but also very sad when you stop to think of the destruction that occurred there just 17 years ago.  
We had no trouble with check in however when at reception I requested a room away from the elevator.  When we went up with our luggage to the room, it was located directly across from it.  I called the front desk and the clerk was happy to change us to a different and much larger room. The maid service was great and the staff are all very friendly.  My only real complaint would be the towels.  They were so rough they felt like sandpaper.  Toiletries were provided and there was a Kureg coffee maker (with coffee) and a small fridge in the room, along with two flat screened TV's, a desk and a sofa bed.  The king sized bed was very comfortable, linens clean and fresh.  All in all, there was plenty of room for two people to live comfortably for a week.  I'd certainly try Club Quarters again when visiting the Big Apple.

title: Beyond expectations
text: The gentleman who helped me with the check-in on Oct 14th was extremely cordial. Thanks to him, our stay went beyond expectations. Thank you very much Sr. I wish to see you again next time.Even though, next morning he was not there, I have to say, the rest of the staff was nice, as well.This will definitely be the hotel we stay in every time I go to NYC from now on. The location is perfect with access to a lot of metro lines close by, especially the red line 1, which it takes you directly to Penn Station (make sure you go "uptown" on your way back.

title: Best Place going in Lower Manhattan
text: The hotel has such a great location. The rooftop restaurant and bar are fabulous! The room was always clean and quiet. The staff is ever so helpful. Our flight to NYC was delayed by one day. This meant our reservations were all cancelled. The staff got us a beautiful room and our visit for our grandson’s Birthday was a complete success! Thank you, Club Quarters!

title: Love this hotel!
text: My sister and I enjoyed our stay at Club Quarters. Great location! Nice room: big & clean. Nice and quiet. Love the gourgeos view from the restaurant and terrace on the 20th floor! Also appreciated the free drinking water, free soda cans & coffee - and the treats we could pick up during the day: fruit, bars, m&m, peanuts 😊We also stopped by the ‘happy hour’ one day where we were served wine from along Island! A treat! Thank you! We’ll be back!

title: Insuperable choice in the World Trade Center area of New York
text: Very nice hotel, in the middle of Wall Street, with a superb view at 20th-floor terrace and restaurant, great service and friendly staff,  a formidable wine tasting every day from 5-6 pm and very good rooms for an NYC standard. No complaints at all. Highly recommended if you need/want to stay in the Wall Street area.

title: Great lower Manahattan property
text: This is a weekly stop for me and I won't go anywhere else in lower Manhattan, even for points.  Staff is friendly and very responsive.  I had a room with a balcony with table and chairs and really enjoyed it after work for winding down.  Great spot for morning coffee / tea too.

title: The best employee
text:
I was fortunate to ask help from Sergiu at the front desk. I was in a
huge rush to get to a seminar all the way up in Harlem in less than an hour. He took the time to find me the fastest way and make sure I will get there in time! That is the best kind of employee! A true asset to any company! Looking forward to come back!

title: Review
text: Overall good experience because everything was clean. My only suggestion would be to provide more sugar for the coffee maker. I really enjoyed myself during the time there. The downstairs lounge was very convenient

title: Excellent location and staff
text:
This is my second time in the hotel, and again I enjoyed the 6 nights stay very much.
We came in very early in the morning from a long international flight hoping to find a place to rest for a bit. Dwayne, the reception guy, helped us and was very kind and helpful to us during all of our stay.
The room was clean, and we got refrigerator in the room after our request. 
The staff was very helpful and ready to help in any request and question. The 5 PM wine testing was also very pleasant. 
I recommend the hotel for anyone that is looking for downtown quite and clean hotel with very helpful staff.

title: Great place near 9/11 memorial
text: This was an excellent place to stay.   Close to multiple subway options, 9/11, Eataly (this was surprise and a good place to get food for snacks or meals).  The restaurant/bar on 20th floor had great service and VIEWS.     The daily wine bar for visitors was also a nice touch.   Room was small but clean and well appointed.  Staff was friendly, helpful and courteous.

title: all the amenities I need at a great location
text: wifi always worksenough plugs and usb ports in all the right placeswater on each floorcleansnacks/drinks in lobbygreat food - room service always prompt and correct(okay, the only thing bothering me now is this forces me to give you a 200 word review - I'm out of things to say!)

title: Great spot in lower Manhattan
text: Great location next to WTC with larger than expected rooms for Manhattan.  Room was recently updated with new carpet and furniture, or at least it seemed brand new.  Helpful staff.  Needed engineering twice for a  faulty light in the bathroom and they were right on it.  Restaurant has limited menu but great view.

title: Great Hotel, fair price and friendly staff
text: Ideal location for anyone that is looking to do business or visit downtown NY. Beautiful views of the 911 memorial from the 20th floor restaurant. Rooms a good, clean and service is wonderful. Front desk staff and extremely helpful and will do what they can to satisfy guests.

title: Quite good but noisy district
text: Good location near Ground Zero which is central to visit south of Manhattan. Room are just large enough for a couple with suitcases. HVAC is efficient but windy making it uncomfortable. Room was almost clean but a bit used up. Good internet connection. Our room was viewing west and unfortunately heading above aircon system sitting on top of adjacent building. Day and night you enjoy noise detrimental to a good night. The view on top of the building is fabulous and breakfast for 22 $ is correct. Some find it expensive, we did not.

title: Ideal for business
text: 8 days business trip, and although my room was not ready on arrival at 6pm - everything was done to recitify the issue.  IDEAL location, pleasant staff. Room service good. Nice touches with recyleable water bottles. Great views.

title: My New Favorite NYC Hotel
text:
I’ve been to NYC 3 times in 2 years and this is my favorite hotel yet. This hotel was so clean. From the lobby, elevator, hallways, carpet, room, laundry room, this place was clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. I’ve read a bad review or two about this hotel and honestly I have no idea what they were complaining about. I loved this place. It’s amazing how a great hotel can be the cherry on top of a great vacation. 

While they don’t offer a free breakfast, they do offer many cool freebies. They have an automatic coffee machine in the lobby that grinds up the beans and makes you a fresh cup of coffee or expresso. They put out chewy granola bars in the morning. They have these devices that will dispense peanuts, m&ms, wasabi somethings, and snack mix. I think they have a wine social thing around 5pm-ish. They have a fridge with free cans of soda. They have free laundry room machines with free detergent and Bounce dryer sheets. I think they have an exercise room, but who needs that in NYC?  

The room was Goldilocks. Not too big, not too small, just right. Nice queen bed with crisp white sheets. Pillows were eh...ok. Blackout curtains. Nightstands with plenty of outlets to charge devices. Desk to shoot off some emails. Wall mounted tv with plenty of channels to watch while you’re resting your feet. Nice bathroom with plenty of counter space. Nice crisp thick clean white towels. 

Location is great. Right next door to where the World Trade Towers used to be. 5 minute walk to many subway routes. Right around the corner from a “I Heart NYC” souvenir store and many tasty restaurants. Short walk to Brooklyn Bridge too. 

I will always try to stay at CQ on future trips to NYC and any other cities I travel to. 

If I had to nitpick something...it would be the coffee they provide in the room. Nasty K-cup coffee. Doesn’t even taste like coffee. Maybe bring some K-cups you like if you’re into that. I’m coffee snobby I guess.

title: Traveler review
text: very good overall. Perfect for travelers. Got the mini kitchen which is a little overboard for short trips...but mini fridge was perfect. Also had cutlery, plates and bowls and cups.  The digital room thermostat was a nice modern touch.

title: Great hotel and location!
text: Wonderful staff and accommodations! Modern, clean and spacious room with comfortable bed and beautiful view. Close to restaurants, attraction and stores. Thanks to Tati at the front desk for being so helpful. Look forward to staying there again.

title: Outstanding view of 9/11 memorial
text: Modern & clean hotel. Friendly service.  Booked a room with view of 9/11 memorial and it was outstanding!  Good area. Lots of restaurants nearby. Easy walk to attractions.  I liked that you have to scan your keycard for the elevator (another level of security). Check in was a breeze. Desk clerk was friendly & helpful.  Room was ready at specified time.  No complaints. Would definitely stay again.

title: Favorite Business Travel Stay
text: Love checking in at 5 to free wine tasting hour and snacks! Great location for financial district, 9/11 Memorial and Brookfield Place. Only hotel I’ll stay at for work trips. Terrace bar with great views.

title: A touch of Royalty
text: The beds are so comfortable, roomy. The rooms have a mini refrig and microwave. The rooms are a nice comfortable size, with a writing table.  I could stretch out in the bathroom, it was so roomy. Shower was just right. I love the lounge area, with a large tv and snacks /beverages throughout the day. Wine in the evening was so sweet, you got the opportunity to meet and socialize with others in the hotel

title: Comfortable and quiet, great views but location not great
text: Comfortable and quiet room with easy to reach outlets for charging, and with better than usual space in in the bathroom.  Excellent views of the WTC and lower Manhattan from the rooftop.  Lobby offers good quality coffee all day.  The only downside is location - the hotel is isolated and a bit far from the subway, and there are not a wide array of restaurants in the area. Unusually empty in the streets during the evening (though it felt safe.)  A much different experience than staying in Midtown where you are surrounded by restaurants, coffee places etc.If you are going to visit the WTC Memorial, this is an excellent location for your stay.  If not, be prepared to spend more time and possibly more money  (in cabs/Uber) in transit to your destination.

title: A wonderful hotel
text: This is a great property with a wonderful, professional staff and great lower Manhattan location.The restaurant, lounge and fitness center are excellent and the accessibility to many different subway lines really make this a go-to location for us.

title: Great stay for a long weekend
text: Spent four nights here on a long weekend.  Really enjoyed our stay.  Great location.  Very clean. Super friendly staff. Rooms are small but that's all you need for NYC is a bed and a bathroom.  Would definitely stay here again next trip to NYC.

title: Love the location
text: If you get a room with windows and a view, it is excellent.  However, they have rooms that have no window or a very small one that are dark and depressing. The happy hour is excellent and I highly recommend attending that.

title: Nice place in lower Manhattan
text: Check in was fast, the room was a decent size for NYC, and the restaurant had a terrace that looked out over the 9/11 museum and memorials.  If you're planning to go to the museum, this is a good place to stay as it is in walking distance of the hotel.

title: Great stay at Club Quarters, WTC
text: My stay was thoroughly enjoyable. The room was very comfortable and modern and the main floor lounge was a great spot to relax and wait for my trip to the airport. I would definitely stay there again.

title: Perfect for business travel
text: It was my first time staying at Club Quarters and I was not disappointed. The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming. A great place to come back to after work and socialize, if you're so inclined, or not. While the room was not large, it perfectly fit the needs of this business traveler.

title: Hotel review
text: The team was super helpful and accommodating. The weather called for rain and the front desk offered me an umbrella to brave the weather. Stay here- great service and clean, good size room. Ambers Team -Leila, Kingsley and  Sergiv really make you feel welcome. I’ll be back.

title: New York City Adventure
text: Hotel location was excellent with short walk to deli’s,restaurants,and subway.The entire staff was very helpful.The five o’clock wine Hapy Hour was very friendly and relaxing .Would gladly stay here again!

title: Club quarter hotel
text:
I was visit this hotel is amazing near LSI English  and located close World Trade Center some room view to World Trade Center you can select this room from reservation, all staff helpful and smile 
I stay 10 days

title: Our New York City Adventure
text: This hotel is perfectly located in the heart of the WTC memorial and the financial district. Th hotel is update, clean and provides amny little touches - the opportunity to fill water bottles beforeheading out for the day is an awesome touch!!! Rooms were very clean and  the view from the 20th floor of the WTC Memorial is breathtaking. Highly recommend this property.

title: Ok, but lots of small issues
text:
My company’s NYC office recently moved from the area near the Empire State Building to the WTC area, so this was my first stay. The room was well decorated but definitely on the small side. A couple staying more that two days would have difficulty finding enough room for their clothes.

The man who checked me in was pleasant, informative, and efficient.

When I got to my room, there was a big bag of trash and a big bag of recycling inside. It’s a small thing but possibly indicative of other management issues. 

The elevators are slooooooooooow. Part of the problem is that the building has four elevators but only two are supposed to be used by hotel guests. And one morning one of the elevators was off line for maintenance. But even when the elevators are running, they are very slow for such a tall building.

Checking out, the online system did not work. It was especially frustrating because it let me enter all the information into the system but then wouldn’t accept the “GO” command. So I went to the lobby to checkout and nobody was there. I had a meeting to get to, so I called afternoon to have them send me a receipt (since previously I tried to add my stay to their app, but the system couldn’t find the reservation).

In sum, enough things went wrong on this stay that I’ll definitely check out one of the many other hotels in the area on my next trip.

title: Situation parfaite.
text:
C'est la localisation de l'hôtel qui avait motivé mon choix et je dois confirmer que je n'ai pas été déçu. Le lieu est parfait. La chambre était très agréable: la literie fut impeccable, la propreté était évidente. Le bureau était spacieux pour un peu travailler quand même durant mes vacances et la douche était impeccable.

Cette hôtel a bien sûr les allures d'un lieu où accueillir plutôt les hommes d'affaire, surtout dans ce coin entre Wall Street et Tribeca mais j'y ai croisé tous les profils: businessman, couple, jeune avec senior, enfants avec parents... Le lieu convient à tout le monde.

Le personnel a l'accueil est très poli, attentif, serviable. J'ai notamment demandé assez tardivement en soirée qu'on me réserve un taxi pour le lendemain, très tôt: c'est un gros 4x4 qui m'attendait. Une agréable surprise.

Un mot forcément sur le restaurant au dernier étage avec vue sur le site de Ground Zero: exceptionnel! J'y ai mangé un excellent risotto aux asperges vertes, un soir, sur la terrasse couverte. Magique! J'ai aussi pris un petit-déjeuner qui fut bien mais je préfère quand même aller en ville le prendre pour moins cher et tout aussi bien...

title: Wedding Hotel
text:
My now wife and I stayed here for four nights whilst we got married in NYC.  Location was perfect for City Hall and the view across the WTC whilst having breakfast was breathtaking. The room itself was typically small New York style but comfortable, clean and well equipped even if on morning of my wedding I discovered iron was not working. Thankfully a call to reception saw a new one within 10 minutes.

Would I stay here for sight seeing? I would say no as apart from WTC and visiting Statue of Liberty Midtown is much better for Top Of Rock, Central Park, Empire State etc.

title: Stay
text: The service was professional.  The room was very comfortable and cosy.  Cannot comment further as it was only for one night.  But if I have to come to New York again I will definitely stay at Club Quarters.  The amenities in the room were just right.

title: Terrible Service and Cleanliness
text:
I am staying at the club quarters and found dried blood on my sheets prior to sleeping. I went down to the reception and got no apology but just a "pack your bags" and we will send someone up.

Someone did come up and just offered to change the sheets. After pushing for a room change I had the exact same room but on a different floor.

I would not be writing this review typically but given the service and lack of caring I felt it was important for everyone to know.

title: Kann man weiterempfehlen
text: Wir waren Nächte im Club Quarters.Die Lage ist genial. Man ist schnell überall.Man schaut direkt auf den One World Tower und das Memorial.Im 20. Stock ist eine Sonnenterasse und der Frühstücksraum bzw. das Restaurant mit toller Aussicht.In der Lobby gibt es kalte und warme Getränke und eine Kaffeemaschine für den Cappucino zwischendurch.

title: Recommended
text: We had a perfect time. High class hotel, perfect room, a lot of amnesties, very good location for a tourist couple. The room was small but comfortable. Very clean. We found everything needed by walking distance. Safe area with a lot of police around.

title: Room was excellent, very roomy and clean.
text: I stayed in the hotel for 13 days on business and felt that the service and staff were excellent. Beds are very comfortable, wifi is very fast. The location was perfect for my job. I definitely recommend this Hotel for business or leisure travel.

title: Business review
text: Room was small but very functional. Would be helpful to have an ironing board and iron in room.All in all, it was an enjoyable stay. I would recommend it to others. Right next to the World Trade Center Memorial. Good restaurants near by.

title: Wonderful hotel with great front desk staff
text: The hotel is great location ,bed is comfortable ,nice bathroom ,and great Air condition but what is greater is the front desk staff (Leila) she makes us Love the hotel before we went to our room. I really appreciate her

title: Bom custo benéfico
text:
Hotel bem limpo, silencioso, com água grátis, maça e banana em alguns dias, refrigerantes, café, leite, chá, cereais, barrinhas de cereais e M&M! Achei uma ótima cortesia essa, nos acostumamos a comer o que eles tinham no café da manhã e foi muito bom, sobrou mais dólares para outras coisas! O hotel é próximo da estação de metrô, da century 21 e um dos locais mais seguros de NY, por estar perto
Do WTC, onde há dezenas de policiais em todo o canto! Somente um ponto não me agradou, a cama.., para um casal ela é muito pequena realmente, pedi para trocas mais dado o tempo curto que ficamos achamos melhor não perder esse tempo e assim nos dividíamos entre a cama e sofá cama. Destaque para atendente Leila que nos ajudou no último dia com as nossas malas e com algumas dicas como a vista de cima do hotel que é das mais belas da cidade! Postei umas aqui para vocês!

title: Very nice
text: Stayed here for business.  For runners easy access to Battery trails. Very modern and updated, good customer service. Great location can walk to 9/11 Memorial.  Wonderful views from restaurant on top floor.  Also has a viewing (smoking?) Balcony up there.

title: Excellent location
text: Everything you need for one night or multiple nights stay.  Attentive team available to help at any time day or night. Compact and clean room and facilities.  Close to subway options to get anywhere in the city and beyond.

title: Go To in the Financial District
text:
Reasonably priced and good for a functional stay. Have stayed here for business and you cant beat the location. Located on the south side of the memorial park. A few steakhouse type restaurants next door and a short walk to Battery Park.
If you don't need a hotel experience and simply need a place to sleep, this place is good.

title: The never ending smoke detector
text: I love this location and I love CQ however this trip we had a smoke detector that kept beeping.  On 2n night they replaced batteries around 8pm ( Tue night) and around 6 am it started beeping again !  I normally sleep well but both nights I think I slept a total of 6 hrs!

title: Perfect
text: Very large rooms, little kitchen, fridge and micro-wave.Confortable bed, and especially very spacious room.A few steps from the Memorial Monument et from many metro lines.Unfortunately I was at the 2nd floor, so no view at all.But very nice restaurant with full,view at the 20th floor.Friendly open bar for guests from 5 o’clock.

title: Perfect in every way!
text: Love the reusable waterbottles and filling station! The reception area is very nice as well! I left an item and was called by the housekeeping staff and was able to retrieve it. Nice hotel in every way

title: good
text: We have stayed at this location a few times and have had excellent service each time.  Staff very friendly and helpful.  Room was clean and spacious and the location was perfect for where we were going.

title: SUPERB!
text: We checked in on our 34 wedding anniversary and they immediately graced us with an upgrade and other kindnesses!  Every person has been beyond helpful and kind...washing away that 'tough NYC' image.  Room is lovely....we look down upon the 9/11 memorial pools and to the regrowth of this tragic area.  Very handy to all things NYC and we've walked it all!  Stay here!

title: Amazing !
text:
I Stayed Here For Valentines Day & It Was The Most Amazing Experience! The Hotel Was Still Underconstruction But Remained Clean & Tidy!
When I Checked In Craig Was SUPER Amazing To Me & My Hunny. You Never Forget Great Service & I Wont Forget Craig! He Made Sure We Knew Where Everything Was, We Had All The Numbers To The Late Night Eateries & That We Had An Enjoyable Stay!!! My View Was Amazinggggg! The Hotel Feautred Smart TVs(Which I Love) & The Bed Was Very Comfortable! The Hotel Is Neighbored To My Fave Store Century 21! So After A Full Day Of Shopping We Got To Relaxxxxx..
Thank You Craig! I’ll Be Back In A Few Months!

title: Excellent stay
text: We were lucky to get a room on the 18th floor with a great view with the floor to ceiling windows.  Location was excellent, short walk to the World Trade Center and tons of shopping.  You won't be disappointed.

title: Excellent option for a stay in Lower Manhatten near Battery Park & World Trade Center
text: This property is top notch. the front desk is very helpful and accommodating. I requested a room with a bathtub and on my second night, they moved me into a small suite that had a kitchenette at no additional cost. the views from the 20th-floor rooftop bar are exceptional. the rooms are somewhat small but for a solo traveler, they were fine. I like the ability to sign in and watch Netflix on their SmartTVs. walking distance to the world trade center memorial, Brookfield place, and  Battery Park are a plus. My only criticism and it's a small one is the exercise center ONLY has treadmills and no ellipticals

title: Amazing
text:
It was my third time when i stayed in CQ World Trade Center Hotel and it was such an unforgettable stay. The perfect location, right in downtown next to the World Trade Center with its fantastic architecture, near 9/11 Memorial, several lines of subway is nearby so to reach the main sightseeings is not a problem at all.
The room was spacious and clean, kitchenette was great addition , there is nice lounge with free snacks and coffee/ tea/ sodas in the hotel. You can use free launderette and free bottled water too. 
The personal is very friendly and makes you feel very welcomed. 
Summing it up i do recommend this hotel for everyone and will stay at it during my next time in fantastic New York City

title: Stunning view
text: Geräumiges Zimmer mit kochecke und Kühlschrank.blick in den Innenhof.leider gibt es keinen Safe im Zimmer.das Zimmer wurde nur jeden 2. Tag gereinigt.super Ausblick vom 20. Stock auf den Hudson River und das World Trade Memorial.

title: Excellent stay
text: The rooms were quite small, but for the price and the fact that were weren’t visiting to stay in the room, not a big deal. The location was great, we could easily walk some place nearby or the many metro stations also close by. There’s a great view of the WTC memorial from the 20th floor restaurant. I really enjoyed the main floor coffee machine and not having to use the tiny ones in the rooms. Also having wine, soda and snacks happy hour each day was a pleasant bonus. Checkout was easy, we did this on our own from the computer and bypassed waiting in line at the desk.

title: Exceptional
text:
This was our 2nd time staying there. Weve never had any problems in the past. This time was exceptional because one of the staff members "Sheila" helped us find our way to the train station. Which was sweet and generous of her. She was warm and friendly. Because she was so kind, we will never hesitate to stay at Club Quarters.

As for the hotel itself, the rooftop lounge area is nice. The view breathtaking. They even have frose's! Whicj I missed out on because they weren't ready. Hopefully we can try them next time! 

The staff is pleasant and everyone was helpful. There is bottle water in the lobby at your dispense. I have only good things to say about this hotel. I recommend staying there for sure!

title: Fantastic staff with an incredible location right next to the WTC memorial
text: There is no shortage of hotels downtown anymore, but I keep coming back here because of the great staff,  fantastic location and the little details which make such a difference. When you check in try to get a room facing the WTC memorial site with a fantastic view of downtown. Upon request you can get a very late checkout which is a life-saver when I'm flying back to Europe in the afternoon so I can relax in the room until going to the airport. On every floor there is a (free) self service chilled water station so you can fill the provided bottles or your own container. This is so convenient and saves me easily $15-$20 a day because I don't have to call room service or go find a store to buy drinking water. Downstairs is a little food and refreshment station where you can get coffee, cappuccino, fruit, peanuts and other snacks etc. Recently they added a happy hour with wine at 5:00 pm which is also free of charge and unheard of at a hotel in New York City. A special thanks goes out to Albert who's always helping me out with last minute changes and really goes out of his way to make everyone feel welcome. Let's not forget Renee the housekeeping manager and her wonderful staff keeping everything always immaculate and for locating my lost items forgotten in the room!

title: Unpleasant reception staff and bad management
text: 1. Booked a room with a kitchenette and didn't get that. Instead, the front staff have the excuse that kitchenette is a microwave and a refrigerator, which, by the way, is available in almost every other room anyways2. MEAN FRONT DESK STAFF! Stephanie was really rude  to us and literally started shouting when I took up the room issue with her. 3. No housekeeping until evening.  No housekeeping until eveningI don't know how this hotel is deemed a 4-star. They have horrible customer service and make the guest feel unwelcome.

title: Excellence at its best
text:
My review goes for two locations first the Wall Street CQ and then the Washington Street location in NYC. Around 11:30ish pm, I walked into the Wall Street location. Unfortunately I did not pay attention to my booking and went there since I’ve stayed there before. Thankfully both gentleman at the front desk, knew right away I made an honest mistake and lead me in the right direction. They were pleasant and professional. I appreciated that! 

Now Washington Street CQ - Craig is the man!! My check-in was seamless and he answered all my questions. I even appreciated that he took it a step further to make my stay more comfortable for my partner and I, with an upgrade!! Talk about bomb customer service. Craig you truly made my stay memorable. CQ will always be my first choice for a safe, comfortable and wonderful escape in the city. 

Go Visit! It’s worth it!

title: Great Wedding Trip
text: We married in New York City in August 2018. The Club Quarters Hotel was the best choice for this occasion. We asked for a room with a great view and could change the room immediately. The service was excellent. We got as a wedding gift a wedding cake and champagne from the Hotel! Soft drinks and snacks are for free, too and even the location is great. We will definitley stay in the CQ Hotel again, when we are in New York City next time!

title: Fun amenities at an amazing location.
text:
The Club Quarters World Trace Center on Washington Street is located in the heart and soul of lower Manhattan; just steps away from the Freedom Tower, 911 Memorial, Brooklyn Bridge and The Oculus. 

Some of the things that will make your stay very pleasant:
"Wine at 5" where you can sample and enjoy wines from New York State Wineries.
Free 24 hour snack and beverage service in the lobby.
Comfortable, quiet, clean rooms.

My accommodations were in a "club" room - one level up from a standard. It included very cushy and dreamy bedding, s small kitchenette with all the necessary appliances and fridge, plus a separate couch area. I was amazed at how quiet my room was as I was in the middle of the floor near the complimentary distilled water dispenser with supply bottles, and near the elevator. 

It was a very comfortable stay, and I would look forward to returning.

title: Buona qualità prezzo
text: Buon hotel a due passi dal memoriare e a 10 minuti dalla metro. Abbiamo soggiornato qui 4 notti. Le camere sono pulite e il personale gentile. Nella hall mettono a disposizione degli ospiti ogni giorno bevande, frutta, cereali e barrette. La vista dall'ultimo piano piano è bellissima, il ristorante forse un po' caruccio ( due piatti, acqua e dolce 80€). Abbiamo usufruito anche della palestra (forse necessità di quche attrezzo in più). Nel complesso lo consiglio per chi visita New York.

title: perfect !
text: Good location, close to ground zero, lots of shopping around, c21, oculus wtc,...very kind service, the team at reception was very helpful.  beautiful room, pleasant lobby.. I ll recommend it to my friends.

title: Excellent Accommodations & Service
text: The Club Quarters is a fine New York City Hotel. The staff goes out of its' way to make sure every guest  is well taken of. The rooms are a bit small but they keep you organized. I always look forward to my next visit at the Club Quarters.

title: Pleasurable Experience
text: Club Quarters has always made me feel welcome.   It is a friendly establishment that treats its guests as guests, unlike other hotels.   The staff are all very friendly and there are ammenities such as complimentary coffee and snacks as well as the opportunity to wash some clothes.   As you would find at an establishment where you are actually welcome.I always enjoy coming back to Club Quarters.

title: A pleasant surprise
text: I’d heard Club Quarters rooms were small but was pleasantly surprised at howclarge our room was at this location. I’d call this a hidden gem in thevfinancial district. A bit hard to find, but worth the hunt. One note though, the walls seemed thin, someone in the next room called to say our TV was too loud when it sounded normal in our room, perhaps because it was wall mounted and the speaker may have been in the back?

title: Great hotel
text: The hotel was in a greatLocation.  The view I had was great and it was close to all areas I was interested in going.  The staff were all friendly and welcoming.  I like that idea that not just anyone can enter the hotel and you need a key to get anywhere in the hotel with the option of getting your key on your smart phone.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Michal B
text: personnel was very attentive. Coffee and fruit station was excellent. Rooms were spacious and very clean. The location is prime with WTC buildings around. Everything - including tourist attractions - was close

title: Great downtown location by memorial makes this one of the quietest hotels in New York
text: Arrived at 2.30am and was met by Craig who worked his magic to put is in a great room with a balcony.  Coffee and snacks in the club lounge were a bonus, as was complimentary wine at 5pm.Being on the road for nearly a month we were delighted to find a guest laundry that did not charge.Great location be the 9/11 memorial meant little road noise, but easy access to transport.  Loved our visit and would stay there again

title: Comfortable, Affordable, Great Location
text: Club Quarters gives you exactly what you need in a hotel. Great locations, comfortable, private room, great amenities and a 24hr snack bar. The restaurant at the top served delicious food and had a great view.

title: Thanks for making my special weekend awesome
text: Price was great. Staff was very accommodating and made my special weekend even more special. Location is great. The bartenders for the rooftop lounge are knowledgeable and makes great specialty cocktails. Add a pool to the rooftop lounge and this place would be perfect.

title: Loved it
text: I loved how all the staff were pleasant. They have a happy hour which was amazing. My only complaint was the bed was a little hard for my liking but it didn’t interrupt me getting any sleep. Place was clean as well. I would definitely come back and recommend as well. Loved the rooftop views as well.

title: Vacation
text: Fantastic location in lower Manhattan. Right next one World Trade Center. The room was fantastic and very modern. Wonderful steakhouse on the property. Great starting point for sight seeing. Not far from battery park and the dock for Statue of Liberty / Ellis island tours!

title: OTTIMO HOTEL PER VARIE RAGIONI!
text: Ottimo hotel. Ho pernottato in questo hotel con mia moglie e mio figlio di 11 anni per 7 notti. La camera pulita anche se non proprio per disabile in sedia a rotelle come anche non lo era il bagno, comunque comoda  con una meravigliosa vista. La colazione sulla terrazza Top of the world se non compresa e costosa ma affacciarsi sul Memorial di fronte al One World Trade Center ha anch'esso un prezzo. stanza grande e molto pulita; Personale molto gentile, preparato e disponibile in tutto, compresi gli addetti alla manutenzione e la Reception, in particolare la Signora Lucrecia, un angelo caduto dal cielo! L'attenzione al cliente è fortemente recepita. La posizione ottima, ben collegata con le fermate metro.

title: Club Quarters Wall Street
text: The room was alittle small but we only slept there so thats ok. It was nice to stay away from the crazy busy part of town and have easy access to the subway and statue of liberty. Start early in the morning for the best time

title: Semplicemente favoloso!
text:
Io e il mio compagno abbiamo soggiornato qui per 13 notti. Premesso che era la mia quarta volta a New York e la quarta struttura provata in città, devo dire che il Club Quarters WTC vince su tutte per più di una ragione.
Posizione: perfetta, comoda a moltissime linee della metropolitana e altrettanto pratica per gli spostamenti a piedi a Lower Manhattan, Battery Park (per prendere traghetti per Statua, Ellis Island, Staten Island, Governors Island) Brooklyn, Chinatown, Little Italy, West Village e Union Square. Nelle immediate vicinanze si trovano numerosi Starbucks, supermercati (tra cui Whole Foods che offre una sorta di servizio mensa di alta qualità fino alle 11 di sera), negozi, attrazioni.
Camere:  (noi avevamo la Club) ampie, pulite, con tv, macchina del caffè, ferro da stiro, bagno altrettanto spazioso e pratico. Pulizia ineccepibile. 
Servizi: punto di forza della struttura sono i servizi e la disponibilità del personale. Oltre alla palestra, della quale noi non abbiamo mai fruito, l'hotel mette a disposizione degli ospiti un servizio di lavanderia gratuito (con lavatrici e asciugatrici). Ad ogni piano ci sono pratici distributori di acqua con tanto di bottigliette da poter riempire e portare con sé. Nella lobby, ogni mattina e sempre a titolo gratuito, viene offerta ottima frutta fresca e barrette ai cereali. Allo stesso modo, durante la giornata sono sempre disponibili te, caffè, cappuccino, infusi, arachidi, salatini, acqua, lemonsoda, pepsi. Ogni pomeriggio alle 17.00 viene offerto un aperitivo gratuito con vino bianco e rosso.
Per un'esperienza in vero New York style, da non perdere una colazione, cena o aperitivo al ventesimo piano con vista sulle Memorial Pools, 9/11 Memorial e One World Observatory. 
Considerato che siamo a New York, cosa poter chiedere di più? Sicuramente non mancherò di tornare in occasione della mia prossima visita a questa meravigliosa città. Un sentito grazie a tutto lo staff!!

title: super location, great hotel. Exellent service.
text: It was a great experience to stay at the CQ World trade center. Our hotel had a beautiful view of the memorial and was located in a perfect spot. Parking is available for a good price (39$) and service at the desk was exceptionnal.

title: Bien, pero mucho ruido.
text:
Nos pusieron una habitación cuya ventana daba a la trasera de un macroedificio que tenía entrada de mercancía de camiones a todas horas, con lo que además de tener la vista horrible, oíamos la marcha atrás de los camiones a todas horas (especialmente molestos a las de madrugada). 
El hotel, al igual que muchos otros, tiene puertas que comunican las habitaciones entre sí. A pesar de ser común y estar cerrada es algo que perturba un poco, especialmente viajando con niños pequeños. 

El restaurante del hotel, abierto al público general, tiene unas vistas impresionantes, aun así, no nos trataron muy bien por no tener reserva e ir con una niña pequeña.

Ubicación ideal.
Happy Hour: Servicio de vino y snacks a las 17:00.
Al salir del hotel necesitábamos información y un servicio y la persona que nos atendió lo hizo de lujo, nos ahorró mucho dinero.

title: One of the best hotels we have stayed in
text:
We came to New York for an anniversary and from the moment we checked in, they made sure it was special for us. The best thing about this hotel was the cleaning staff. They always cleaned our room no matter what time we checked out and I have never seen a room so clean. It really does make a difference.

Special praise for Tatti who checked us in, made us feel welcome and even called a store for us to see if they had a toy in stock that our son wanted. She was very friendly and always smiled. Albert (tall bold guy) - great service and friendly.

title: Actually a few years ago
text: Stayed here actually back in February of 2015. It was a good hotel. Staff was pretty friendly. We upgraded to a suite. All the rooms were pretty small, however. But staff was accommodating. The restaurant was nice with a good view. Bar was good and the food was nice. A little overpriced but however had a good experience. Would stay there again.

title: HOTEL BUONO ma PROBLEMI CON CARTA DI CREDITO
text: L'hotel è buono ed in ottima posizione ma devo mettere una recensione negativa a causa di un problema non da poco che mi è capitato. al mio arrivo nonostante avessi pagato l'intera somma del soggiorno tasse comprese con 4 mesi di anticipo ! è stata bloccata sulla mia carta di credito l'intero ammontare, lasciandomi senza soldi sulla carta. lo staff non è riuscito a risolvere il problema. a tutt'oggi che sono tornato a casa ho ancora l'ammontare bloccato sulla carta.

title: Complaint
text: I arrived at the hotel at 3:30pm on Friday 8/17 to check in and I was made aware the room was not available and to give them 30 min which was fine since I understood check in is at 4pm. However, when I checked back there was a different receptionist (Andrew) who told me the room would not be ready for ANOTHER 30 min. When I booked the room I was told check in was at 4pm  but now I'm waiting for an hour for a room I guaranteed for a certain time.  When I inquired what was the additional hold up Andrew told me it was because they didn't have many suites and the previous people checked out late.  I asked for a manager and Andrew said he was a manager I asked for a card with his name on it and he gave a 8x11 blank sheet of paper with his name drawn on it in obscenely large font.  I didnt even mind waiting but it is beyond disrespectful how Andrew handled the situation. We were a party of four from out of state and 2 of them were senior citizens so as a MANAGER he should have been more hospitable and considerate. Again, I understand the situation with waiting for the room but what I don't understand is how a manager would treat a guest like this and a guest that had already paid. Frankly, after my interaction with Andrew I would not have stayed at the hotel if I had not already paid.  While we were waiting Andrew did give a complimentary breakfast for 2 but as I already stated I had a party of four so it did little to assuage the situation. When we finally checked in and let another receptionist know about our experience she did apologize but it's hard to get the distaste from your employee's classless act out of my mind. When we got to the room I called down to get extra towels and spoke with Kevin who gave impeccable service. The next day 8/18 at around 3pm I called the front desk from my room 4 or 5 times over the course of 30 min and received no answer. I went outside to the hallway phone by the elevator and none other than Andrew picks up I asked for towels. I advised Andrew of my attempts with my room phone but similar to his apathy from the previous day he did not acknowledge what I said about no response when I called from the room and simply said I'll send towels to your room. In closing, each incident is understandable I get that other guest check out late I get that the front desk could have been busy and no one was able to pick up but how Andrew handled these situations i do not understand nor will i tolerate his actions and that what has escalated it to the point of me complaining to an associate when I checked out.

title: Business with a View
text: The Staff was amazing.  Friendly and very helpful.  Great location.  many delicious restaurants close by.  Mass transit convenient and inexpensive.  High end shopping wonderful.  I really enjoyed the complimentary happy hour.

title: Excellent choice!
text: The hotel has a very helpful staff, and is located in a very good place, not only for business purpose but for few vacation days. I recommend the place and in my next travel to NY i will seriously consider to stay there again.

title: Grate place to stay
text: If you need to stay around WTC, this is the option. The staff is always willing to help and the place is very nice.Rooms are comfortable. I think you get more value than you pay.They have an area where they serve fruit and snacks that are great.

title: Fabulous hotel
text: Great hotel friendly staff especially Sergio on reception. We stayed for 3 nights and was a great base for all the sightseeing we wanted to do. Gorgeous open terrace bar at top.. a bit pricey but it was a special occasion for us..

title: Location!!!
text: Club Quarters Hotel is in a great location. Quiet, two blocks to subway, short walk to Ground Zero and great variety of restaurants. Have stayed here numerous times and always well satisfied. Nice complimentary social each afternoon.

title: Totally New York
text: Where do I start?  This hotel is located right across from the Freedom Tower and the 9/11 memorial waterfalls.  We paid extra for the city skyline view and it was totally worth it.  We had an amazing view.  The amenities at the hotel were exceptional.  The terrace is phenomenal, we enjoyed drinks while overlooking Manhattan every night.  The staff is beyond professional and they make you feel like royalty.  We had easy access to all the subway branches but could easily walk down to Battery Park, NYSE and the entire financial district.  Access to the Brooklyn Bridge was a bit of a walk but you get to see so much of the city who cares about the walk?  Complimentary wine after 5p.m.  Clean and spacious rooms.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and I again loved the staff especially Arnold and Andrew.  Perfect mannerisms and the utmost polite.  One other thing, they are shooting movies, tv-shows, and commercials all the time in New York.  Below our room was Liberty Park and we got a birdseye view of a scene from the new John Wick 3 movie being shot there.  Laurence Fishburne and Ian McShane

title: First wedding anniversary
text: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the club quarters hotel at the world trade centre, the view from the balcony bar is amazing especially at night, the hotel was spotless, free coffee, cold drinks and snacks all day and free wine between 5pm and 6pm and the staff were more than helpful, Andrew and Tatty especially deserve a special thank you, hope to see you soon Greg and Dawn

title: Great stay
text: Our stay with Club Quarters was perfect. We had everything we needed for a great stay. The front desk receptionist Rey was very friendly and knowledgle. He knew how to attend our needs and answered our questions. Will definitely be coming back!

title: Great property near the action on Wall St and Freedom Tower
text: Spent a night here on business last week.  Place is literally a few blocks from the Freedom Tower, Trinity Place, and Wall St.  Rooms were clean, service professional, breakfast was ok, not great, but the views from the 20th floor for breakfast are amazing as you can see the Freedom Tower and the pools.  Prices are good too.

title: Great Choice
text: Great room. Amazing location. Normally stay in Times Square but this was a nice change from the rat race of Time Square. Always felt safe walking around late at night. So much to do in the financial district. Great restaurants. Our room had an amazing terrace. I will stay here again.

title: Good hotel, good staff
text: Hotel staff was amazing in service. The room was very nice, although I wish I had a better view. The hotel was very nice about keeping my bags after I checked out before I went home. The hotel also provided free snacks in the lounge, however, did not provide a continental breakfast.

title: WTC hotel find for work or fun.
text: WE had a meeting at 1 WTC and this location would have been walking distance but for the 90/90 weather. The hotel is easy to find and has drive-up loading. We were on the second floor and it was quiet enough. Mini-fridge, micro and coffee in the room.

title: Top Hotel
text: Das Hotel liegt gleich neben dem World Trade Center. Subway Lebensmittel Geschäfte und Restaurants sind im nahe umkreis zahlreich vorhanden. Das Hotel ist sehr sauber und das Personal ist Top. In jeder Etage befindet sich ein Wasserspender mit leeren Flaschen die man nach belieben auffüllen kann. In derHotellobby gibt es kostenlose Kaffespezialitäten, Erdnüsse,M&M‘s,Pepsi,Sprite uvm. Jeden morgen gibt es zusätzlich noch kostenlos frisches Obst und Müsliriegel. Wir haben ohne Frühstück gebucht. Zum Frühstück holten wir uns immer Obst und Müsliriegel, das reichte uns für den Start in den Tag. In der 20 Etage befindet sich ein Restaurant und eine Aussichtsplattform.Dieses Hotel kann ich uneingeschränkt weiter empfehlen.

title: Love this place!
text:
2nd time staying here in 2 years. The location is great, across from 9/11 museum, One World Trade and many other points of interest.

They offer a lot that most hotels don’t offer complimentary. Examples include wine every night, snacks area that includes cans of soft drinks, chilled water with bottles to use, free launderette and guest room closet that has extra supplies.

Each room has a yoga mat and exercise bands you can use along with the CQ Cit program on tv. 24/7 gym that includes Peloton bike.

There are so many other amenities, you need to see for your self!

title: Great for short business travel
text:
I stayed at the Club Quarters Hotel for a one night business trip. The hotel was perfect for that purpose. Small rooms, but very clean and extremely close to my meetings at 4 World Trade Center.

A few small things that would have annoyed me if I stayed for a longer period of time:
 - The elevators were slow - with two elevators for a 20 story hotel, you're going to wait for awhile.
 - I realize it was a heat wave in New York at the time, but the hallways were incredibly hot and humid. It seemed like they were only using air conditioning in the individual rooms.
 - Rooms missing the "little things" - for example, no tissues. I can use toilet paper as a tissue, but is it difficult to add a box of tissues to a room?

title: A fun weekend with friends and family in nyc
text: Came to the city with veteran and novice travelers.  The hotel was great!  Safe, clean, great views and kind staff.  Easy access to subway. Very affordable!   A great place to stay.  The room slept 3 adults very comfortably.

title: Great views and location!
text: Good hotel, great location.  Close to several subway lines, WTC, Oculus... Hudson River Park, etc.  I would like to highlight the service of Albert at the front desk.  Our daughter came into town for our second night and he kindly switched our room to one that would accommodate three people comfortably.  We had our own private balcony/patio with furniture that overlooked the WTC pools, Freedom Tower and even a view of the Hudson River for fireworks on the 4th of July!  Each interaction we had with a front desk employee was extremely pleasant but Albert definitely went above and beyond.  Thank you!

title: Peter Smith's Review
text:
A good hotel in a great location. Professional service from the moment that you enter the reception. Good size rooms with all the amenities that you require for a stay in New York. The sky deck is a great place to have breakfast, dinner or a drink.

Next time I go to New York I will certainly be opting for this hotel.

title: Best Hotel in Lower Manhattan
text: Really friendly front desk staff. Were really helpful when we forgot a few bathroom items. Happy Wine Hour from 5-6 was a nice touch. Room was clean. Great location to 9/11 Memorial, Battery Park, and restaurants.

title: Quality hotel
text: Excelent and quality hotel. Nice and friendly staff. Excelent location for business and for visiting sites. Excelent restaurant with a view in downtown Manhattan. Coffee and purified water for free all day long.

title: South Manhattan Value
text: Quiet and modernized, in a terrific area, immediately adjacent to One World Trade and the 9/11 Memorial. Not to mention that O'Hara's Restaurant & Pub is just a block over, one of the greatest family owned bars in NYC.

title: Not much to say in favor
text: This Club Quarters is hard to get to by cab since much of the area around the WTC is closed to traffic. The elevators are very slow and I used the stairs most days. The clock was not set to the right time when I checked in and the hot and cold water taps were reversed. The room was small, although in NYC you expect that. That said, the bed and A/C were OK, the Internet worked fine, and there was hot water. Check-in/check-out was fast. The view of a police barracks was unimpressive.

title: Nice hotel
text: My husband and I stayed here one night.  The front desk staff was friendly and helpful.  Our room was clean and comfortable and the rooftop lounge enjoyable.  The location was excellent for 9/11 exhibits.

title: Great hotel
text: Was very pleased with this hotel! Will definitely stay here the next trip to NYC. Free wine from 5-6pm and there is free snacks and pop. Rooms were very specious and clean. The bed was comfortable. Few minutes walk to the World One and subway. Our room had great views of the city.

title: A place like home
text: If you're traveling to NY near the WTC area, this is the place to stay! Whether for business or personal travel, the Club Quarters Hotel will make you feel like they want you to enjoy your stay and to return real soon!  Because of my stay in NY, I would be eager to stay at a Club Quarters in another city with the hopes of having the same welcoming experience!

title: City break
text: Room slightly on the small side but with the nature of the trip this did not bother us one bit! Helpful and friendly staff on reception. Main advantage for us is how easy it was to get back on the subway wherever we were in Manhattan. We will be back!

title: Perfect base for New york visit
text:
We arrived after a long flight from Amsterdam to the club quarters with our 8 yr old daughter. 
Albert checked us in, we asked for a nice view and boy did he give us one! We got an upgrade to a suite on the 17th floor with a view of the WT memorial. Because the room wasn’t ready yet we also got a voucher to spend at the restaurant on the 20th, where we also enjoyed the view and the burgers with fries, very good timing!

The room was big, with an extra space with a fold out sofa and floor to ceiling windows with an amazing view, we slept with the curtains open! The bed is comfy, and the sofa bed although a bit thin was too.
The view is so amazing and you find yourself coming back to it whenever you are in the room.

The hotel has excellent extra’s such as free soda’s and nibbles like m&ms and peanuts, apples and oranges, free coffee and tea and wine o’clock with free wine.
The small kitchen area with fridge, plates and spoons

The location is great. You are straight next to the memorial, one world observatory and the oculus, walking distance to the free ferry to see the statue of liberty.
Also places like hudson eats  where you can very easily taste different kinds of foods are very close ( eatily and a le district) and great for kids!
The subway is a few minutes walk to the oculus. The financial district with the walks along the river way walk more relaxed than we expected and we were surprised about the amount of people walking around in the evening.

We loved the fridge and kitchenarea to have our cornflakes at in the morning.

This hotel has really made our stay in new york extra special. Thanks Albert, hope to return!!

title: Recent Stay
text: Excellent stay.  Room clean and functional.  We opted for a 'suite' so had a kitchenette, sofa bed plus a double.  Hotel brilliantly situated for 9/11 memorial and One World Tower.  Discovered (on the last day sadly) that the hotel serves complimentary wine (plus tea, coffee, coke and there's a sweet snack dispenser too).  All free between 5pm and 6pm.

title: recent stay
text:
Kingsley is a professional and excellent employee at this location. He is always helpful and friendly and kind. Always eager to help or assist in anyway. I am always happy to see him because I know I will be treated fairly. And I know that he will resolve any issues I may have with a room as he always has, unlike 2 of his colleagues. 
Always a pleasure to see him !

title: Friendly & reasonable hotel
text: We have stayed in this hotel for a few times during the last four years and found it clean and friendly. The location is very convenient in this part of New York and the rates are reasonable and highly recommended.

title: Not a great hotel but it did the trick
text: Decor and service could use some love. Rooms do not have safes. Top floor restaurant is nice, but the breakfast is very poor and lacking in options for those with dietary requirements. Excellent location though.

title: Disgrace
text: This hotel is a disgrace. Small rooms, terribly small rooms and extremely loud AC. Hotel reception staff not helpful at all. I asked to change the room to be able to sleep, but that didn’t happen. Staff taking no responsibility at all.

title: CQ doesit again
text: Great location.  Near everything. Close to restaurants, the memorial for the towers, subway.  Hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. Use the new CQ app and your phone becomes your key.  The app is also very useful in getting around down town.

title: 4th of July 2018
text: The hotel staff are the best! They are very friendly and helpful. The bed was very comfortable.  The laundry is small for the amount of rooms, but I got my stuff done! I'm not complaining one bit! I didn't eat at either of the restuarants, but it looked inviting. The hotel is in a great location to walk, and we did! We enjoyed the local eateries around the hotel, as well as the ice cream truck!

title: Estratégica ubicación para conocer Manhattan
text:
El hotel está ubicado a 200 metros del Ocullus desde donde se puede combinar distintas opciones de transporte. Está a pasos del Memorial Place y a pasos de la Esplanade sobre el río Hudson. Se puede llegar caminando a Battery Park. 
La habitación tenía vista al One World Observatory y se puede acceder, aun sin consumir, al piso 20 para tener una maravillosa vista de Down Town Manhattan. Cada ambiente en el departamento cuenta con un Tv propio. Entre los servicios que ofrece el hotel se destaca su completa kitchenette, que es reabastecida diariamente con café en cápsulas y té. El servicio de bebidas y snack es gratuito en el lobby. Se puede acceder al autoservicio de lavado y secado de ropa en el piso 12, sin costo alguno de jabón y suavizante. El personal es sumamente amable y brinda consejos para manejarse en el transporte.
Muchas tripulaciones de líneas aéreas eligen este hotel, lo que garantiza un estándar en el servicio. Volveríamos a alojarnos allí sin lugar a dudas!

title: Excellent hôtel
text: Très bon hôtel personnel très gentil chambre superbe service impeccable allez y sans hésité nous le recommandons à 100% tout près des ancienne Twins tower et de la Liberty tower quartier très calme et magnifique

title: Ottimo
text: Camera con Kitchenette molto spaziosa per la città di New York. Posozione comodissima, di fronte al WTC. Panortama splendido dalla terrazza. Distributore di acqua ai piani con bottigliette da riempire e portare via, comodissimo. Vino alle 18 nella hall e sempre caffe e snack. Consigliabilissimo

title: We enjoyed our stay!
text:
Very nice hotel, next to the Wall Street.
Free water, coffee and snacks in the lounge.
Staff was very helpfull and friendly.
The cleaner left us a very nice Note.
We enjoyed our stay.
We can recommend this hotel.

title: Best value we've found in NYC
text: Club Quarters is right at the World Trade Center complex and is within very easy walking distance to Trinity Wall Street,  St. Paul's Chapel, and the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island ferry and other Manhattan cruise docks. An excellent restaurant on the top floor with views of the city and two lovely decks for appies and drinks. Also enough good value restaurants within a few blocks  to please anyone. Only 2 blocks from the Rector St. subway station for the #1 train uptown. Special touches at CQ include 5-6 Happy hour with free wine and snacks every day, a water station with water bottles to take with you on your excursions, and a big fruit bowl in the lounge for replenishing your energy. Rooms are very nice, larger than we expected; our Junior suite was plenty large enough for us and our 12 year old grandson on the pull out bed. We will stay here again even if our trip only includes mid-town and uptown, it is so easy to grab the subway and half the price with more room and amenities than a mid-town hotel.
